content.256:
Subject: Please share your Poems and Short Essays for Matribhasha Diwas or International Mother Language Day
Text: Dear All,


The Institute is celebrating Matribhasha Diwas or International Mother
Language Day on the 21st of February, 2019.

To celebrate this day, which primarily stands for celebration of *diversity
and multilingualism*, we are inviting submissions from all students,
faculty and staff under two categories: *Poems and Short Essays.*

I would request you to share your entries in the form of a poem or a short
essay (1000-1500 words), on a topic that relates to your home or a memory
of your region/culture, or anything that might be a pleasant reminder of
roots and cultural/linguistic heritage. *The writing should be in your
respective mother tongue, as most of these languages are fast-disappearing,
with fewer users everyday.*

Please mail your entries to me with the Subject: Poem/Short Essay for
Matribhasha
Diwas or International Mother Language Day by 19th February 2019. Winners
will be declared by the 20th, followed by a prize distribution ceremony on
the 21st February 2019.

I look forward to your participation,


Warmly,

Ridhima
-- 


Assistant Professor (English)
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011
Phone: +91 836 221 2843
sites.google.com/view/www-ridhimalit-com
<https://sites.google.com/view/www-ridhimalit-com/home>

content.264:
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to participate in EMPI India Mobility Festival
Text: Dear Prof. Seshu,

I am writing to you on behalf of Entrepreneurship & Management Processes
International (EMPI) Group of Institutions, New Delhi. I had the privilege
of knowing EMPI since its inception in 1995. EMPI Group of Institutions was
established by a group of nation builders including Shri A.  N.  Haksar,
Chairman Emeritus, ITC; Padma Vibhushan Prof M. G. K. Menon; Dr. D. V.
Kapur, founder Chairman, NTPC; Prof. Udai Pareek, IIM Ahmedabad; Shri P. S.
Bami, former Chairman, NTPC; Shri Gurnam Saran, former Director, BHEL;
Prof. T. V. Rao, Chairman, TVRLS; Ms. Tara Sinha, former Chairperson, IIMC
and Dr. Ashok Jain, former Director, NISTADS, to name a few.

I have known the young co-founder, a prot√©g√© of mine, *Pankaj Saran,
President of EMPI Group of Institutions,* for more than two decades and I
am working with him and team to set up India‚Äôs first Innovation Cluster on
Aerospace & Defence, as a JV with the Government of AP next to Bangalore. I
am currently associated with EMPI as it‚Äôs Patron Chairman and Chief Mentor.
NITI Aayog had very recently accorded EMPI to establish Atal Incubation
Centre to spearhead innovation in the field of Renewables, Smart Energy and
Electric Mobility. The Centre is led by the dynamic *Mr. Vinod Midha*,*
CEO, AIC‚ÄìEMPI*; an IIT Alumni and former Executive Director, BHEL. Over the
years, EMPI has undertaken several theme based research and innovative
initiatives. In sync with such initiatives, EMPI has launched in end of
February, an *India New, Clean & Intelligent Mobility Mission* by
conducting a nationwide survey on ‚ÄúIndian Mobility Landscape ‚Äì A
Transformation to the Future‚Äù.

As part of the India New, Clean & Intelligent Mobility Mission, EMPI
is organizing India's first International Design, Technology & Business
Festival for vehicles of the future - Electric, Connected and
Autonomous, ‚ÄúIndia
New, Clean & Intelligent Mobility Mission Festival‚Äù on *20th & 21st
September, 2019* in association with Ministry of Road Transport and
Highways.

We cordially invite student teams from your esteemed Institute to
participate in this Mega Event and shall request you to kindly circulate
this information so that maximum number of students across disciplines can
participate. In fact, we shall welcome multiple teams from an institute to
register.
For registration they may login: https://ifutures.empi.ac.in/

The festival is an opportunity for your institution to showcase the talent
of your students through its various events.

Please find attached :-

   1. Letter
   2. Poster

---
With warm regards,

*N. Vittal, IAS (Retd.)*
*Padma Bhusan Awardee*
Chairman, EMPI Group
Formerly: Central Vigilance Commissioner
Secretary,   Deptt.   of   Electronics   and
Chairman,  Telecom  Commission  (GoI)

content.276:
Subject: Fwd: [IIT Dharwad] Regarding Invent@IITGN, Summer 2019
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: *Nithin George* <nithin@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Sunday, February 17, 2019
Subject: [IIT Dharwad] Regarding Invent@IITGN, Summer 2019
To: Svprabhu <svprabhu@iitdh.ac.in>


Dear Professor Prabhu,

Greetings from IIT Gandhinagar!

Invent@IITGN <http://initiatives.iitgn.ac.in/invent/> is an intensive
summer programme in inventing which originated in the US as Invention
Factory <https://inventionfactory.org/> and will run for the second time
outside the US at IIT Gandhinagar this summer. In six weeks (plus a few
days of technical training), fifteen teams of two IIT BTech/BDes students
will conceive of fifteen inventions, prototype them, ‚Äúpitch‚Äù them, write
and file a US patent application for them, and compete for the following
prizes.

Best Invention: *Rs. 2 Lakh*
Second Best Invention: *Rs. 1 Lakh*

[image: Invent_IITGN_2019_Slider.png]
The primary resource persons for this event will be founders of Invention
Factory, Professor Alan Wolf and Professor Eric Lima of the Cooper Union
(An elite engineering institution in New York City). We had an exciting
first season of Invent@IITGN last summer, with 20 students from different
IITs. You can see more details about last year‚Äôs inventions here
<https://inventionfactory.org/> and some feedback from participants below.

*"I feel lucky to have gone through the entire process of product
development at Invent@IITGN. From conceptualising an idea to prototyping it
and finally patenting it in a short span of 7 weeks was like practically
connecting the dots of what I had learnt in college curriculum but hardly
applied in real life. "*
*Shubham Nandeshwar, IIT Madras,*
*Participant, Invent@IITGN, 2018*

*"I found Invent@IITGN as the best place where I could work on a real-life
problem, where my creativity won't be confined to just my engineering
stream. The structure of this programme not only made me confident about my
inventive potential but also made me learn how to respectfully address the
criticism to my work. Invent@IITGN was one the best learning experience I
have ever had."*
*Yash Sharma, IIT Kharagpur*
*Winner, Best Invention Prize, Invent@IITGN, 2018*

*‚ÄúWe never thought we could do so much in six weeks! Invent@IITGN program
pushes you to give in the maximum efforts you can, for a project.‚Äù*
*Khyati Priya, IIT Guwahati,*
*Participant, Invent@IITGN, 2018*
You can access the poster of Invent@IITGN, 2019 here
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1prpDWZrO-NAbkREqbzejTV5E4H9t332S/view?usp=sharing>.
Every student completing the program will receive a stipend of Rs. 10,000
and will be provided free accommodation/food at IIT Gandhinagar
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dytEMl2HlC8> during the entire duration of
the programme. It would be of great help if you could kindly forward this
announcement to undergraduate students of IIT Dharwad and encourage them to
participate in this event.

Thank you for your help and support.

Regards

Nithin
invent@iitgn.ac.in

-- 

Nithin V. George,

TEOCO Chair Associate Professor | Electrical Engineering,

Associate Dean | Faculty Relations,

Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar,

Palaj, Gandhinagar,

Gujarat, India ‚Äì 382355
content.277:
Subject: Annual Progress Seminar of Mr. Souradip Chattopadhyay
Text: Dear All,
I invite you to Souradip's APS tomorrow (9th July, 2019) at room 207, 11:30
am. The title and the abstract of the seminar is given below.
Amlan
=============================================================
Title: Thin liquid film flowing down a rotating inclined plane: Stability
and Dynamics

Venue: Room 207 Time: 11:30 am - 12:30 pm

Abstract: In this talk, we are going to discuss the dynamics and stability
(linear and weakly nonlinear) of a thin liquid film flowing down a rotating
inclined plane.

Instability of thin liquid film down a rotating inclined plane is one of
the most important instability phenomena, both from the theoretical and
practical perspectives. The research on this particular topic was pioneered
by Davalos-Orozco and Ruiz-Chavarria (Physics of Fluids, 1992). They
considered a fluid layer flowing down a rotating inclined plane and only
captured the effect of the Coriolis force on the instability phenomenon by
linear stability analysis. Later, Davalos-Orozco and Busse (Physical Review
E, 2002) extended this research by considering the effect of Coriolis as
well as centrifugal forces but unable to analyze the nonlinear stability.

We have extended the work of  Davalos-Orozco and Busse, firstly by
analyzing the nonlinear stability of their problem and secondly, we have
used a new technique, called the "momentum-integral" method, to discuss the
instability phenomenon.

content.287:
Subject: Announcing eduroam
Text: Dear All,

Our institute is now connected to eduroam (https://www.eduroam.org/). You
can now connect to the Wi-Fi service at other universities that you visit
using your IITDh LDAP credentials, provided that university is also
connected to eduroam. eduroam is currently active in 101 countries.

How to:

   - Turn on your device's Wi-Fi and choose to connect to "eduroam"
   - username: <LDAP-id>@iitdh.ac.in (e.g., 160010001@iitdh.ac.in)
   - password: your LDAP password


Similarly, any guest (from an institute connected to eduroam) that visits
our institute may use our WiFi service through eduroam.

How to:

   - Turn on device's Wi-Fi and choose to connect to "eduroam"
   - username: <LDAP-id>@<domain> (e.g., xyz@iitb.ac.in , if the guest is
   from IITB)
   - password: her/ his LDAP password in her/ his host institute


Regards,
Rajshekar

-- 
[on behalf of]
Faculty in Charge
Computing and Communication Services
IIT Dharwad

may be all this and much more.

Text: ---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: *RABINDRA NATH SHAW* <r.n.s@ieee.org>
Date: Wednesday, April 10, 2019
Subject: Late Date for Paper Submission: 15th April 2019 (Extended). 20% of

************************************************************

Respected Sir/ Madam,

Submission link is open till midnight of 15th April 2019 as per request of
many authors. (Thanks for your support and overwhelming response that we
have received for GUCON 2019. I hope you will be with us in near future
also). I am glad to inform you that GUCON 2019 is Technically sponsored by
IEEE Industry Application Society, USA,  20% of the papers to be presented
on the GUCON 2019 will be eligible for further review to be published in
the IEEE IAS Transaction  after inclusion all the Presented paper in IEEE
Explore.. For more detail kindly visit our website www.gucon.org

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1e44AxB8hWS5xhS-E1DKa2h8N2sDa_Rih/view?usp=
sharing



------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------
INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTING, POWER AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES
(GUCON 2019)
IEEE Conference Record No: 47222
Conference Date: September 27-28, 2019, NCR New Delhi, India
Conference Website: www.gucon.org
IEEE Technical Sponsor: IEEE Industry Applications Society
https://ias.ieee.org/events-conferences/conference-schedule.html
------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------
//** Last date for paper submission: April 15, 2019**//
//** Kindly forward to your academic contacts and Research Scholars **//
//** Apologies, if you have received multiple copies. **//
------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear Sir/Madam,

International Conference on Computing, Power and Communication Technologies
(GUCON 2019) is being organized by Galgotias University, India on September
27-28, 2019. The University is based in Greater Noida (NCR New Delhi,
India), has an enrolment of over 19,000 students across more than 100
Undergraduate and Post Graduate program, is devoted to excellence in
teaching, research and innovation, and to develop leaders who'll make a
difference to the world.

GUCON 2019 is a non profit conference and it will provide an opportunity to
the practicing engineers, academicians and researchers to meet in a forum
to discuss various issues and its future direction in the field of
Electrical, Computer & Electronics Engineering and Technologies. The
conference aims to put together the experts from the relevant areas to
disseminate their knowledge and experience for the relevant future research
scope. The conference is technically sponsored by various society and
Institutes. There are multiple tracks in the conference covering almost all
areas of Electronics, Computer & Electrical Engineering.


TRACK A : Data Mining and Big Data Analysis
TRACK B: Communication Technologies
TRACK C: Cloud Computing and Computer Networks
TRACK D : Power Electronics and Control Engineering
TRACK E : Power & Energy Systems
TRACK F : Machines and Renewable Energy
TRACK G : Electronics Devices, Circuits and Systems
TRACK H: Signal Processing
TRACK I : Bioinformatics, Multimedia and Machine Learning
TRACK J : Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
TRACK K : Language Technologies and Information Retrieval

Prospective authors are encouraged to submit their original, unpublished
research paper (which is not under review in any other conference/ Journal)
of the given tracks in the format specified in the IEEE Paper Template
through easy chair for publication in the GUCON 2019. Submissions must be
plagiarisms free and submission must follow the IEEE Policy on Double
Submission.

Paper Submission Link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=gucon2019

IEEE Paper Template: https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/
templates.html

All submissions will strictly go through a plagiarism check, only those
submissions which pass through plagiarism check will be double blind
reviewed with at-least three reviewers and only accepted papers which are
presented during the conference will be eligible for submission to IEEE HQ
for Publication.


Selected extended papers will be published in the Special Issue on SCI,
Scopus Indexed Good Journals. List of said journals will be communicated to
authors after published their papers in IEEE Xplore.

**********20% of the papers to be presented on the GUCON 2019 will be
eligible for further review to be published in the IEEE IAS
Transaction*************

Keynote speakers (confirmed)
* Prof. N. R. Pal, President, IEEE CIS Society, USA
* Prof. Joydeep Mitra, Michigan State University, USA
* Prof. Marcin Paprzycki, Polish Academy of Sciences, Poland
* Dr. Daleep Mohla, IEEE IAS Society, USA
* Mr. Deepak Mathur, Director-Elect, IEEE Region 10,
* Prof. Vincenzo Piuri, University of Milan, Italy,
* Prof Valentina E Balas, Romania,
* Prof. L. C. Jain, Australia and Many World Leaders


Contact:
Conference Chair,
Website: www.gucon.org
Email Id: gucon2019@gmail.com
Mobile No: +91-9883266344

content.305:
Subject: Invitation for "Impressions'18" the dynamic cultural fest of College of Engineering,Pune.
Text: Dear all,

please find the below details regarding above subject.

We are very glad to announce that Impressions '18 is back with a bang.
Impressions is a fest by the artists, for the artists - a platform for
performers to display their talents and wow the audience! After a
successful second edition, with a footfall of over 10000, a live concert,
and rocking events that became cherished memories for all, COEP's one and
only cultural fest presents its third edition.
This 13th, 14th and 15th of December, Impressions will transport you from
the dull routine of the real, to the glitz and glamour of the reel. Join us
on a journey through time, to explore the evolution of Bollywood, seen
through the cultural lens. Impressions 2018 brings you a diverse range of
exciting events in five main modules, namely dance, music, arts and crafts,
dramatics and film-media, as well as some fun informals - there's something
for everyone!
So come join us! It is the time to bring out the artist inside you.
[image: overall_poster[1].jpg]

Registration link for Impressions'18:
https://www.townscript.com/e/impressions18-412443

content.317:
Subject: Talk by Dr. Kalghatgi on 13th Nov.
Text: Dear Colleagues and students,

  This is to inform you that Dr. A. T. Kalghatgi has kindly agreed to
deliver a talk on 13th of this month. Please note down the details below,
and mark your calendar.

Title: "Challenges in Defense Communication Technologies"
Who: "Dr. A. T. Kalghatgi"
When: 13th November, 2018 from 4 PM to 5 PM.
Where: Room no. 119.


*All are welcome!*

*Description of the Talk*

*Overview *

Defence Communication Technologies are crucial to ensure military
superiority and situational awareness. Beginning with voice communication,
defence communication has grown by leaps and bounds to adopt digital
communication practices. In the modern network centric warfare, defence
communication provides a backbone to a reliable and secure framework for
exchanging information.


Digitization of the battlefield has created a seamless network of sensors
and shooters. Situational awareness and new paradigms of warfare require a
robust, reliable, secure and near instantaneous transfer of data and
information. Traditional radio as well as satellite communication has grown
to provide high speed digital and mobile communication in a secure manner.
Transitions from wire to wireless high capacity radios and integration of
these to optical media has facilitated a quantum jump in bandwidth
utilization.

*Challenges*

Military communication requires ECCM and cryptographic solutions to be
incorporated over and above the COTS technologies. Additionally, hardening
of radio sets to meet harsh electromagnetic environment have to be catered
for.  For sustenance in harsh environment for long duration, design and
engineering challenges incorporating SWAP (Size, Weight and Power) methods
have to be built in.

Wireless network, in line with civilian/COTS technology, have to adopt
military IOT and military IP enabled communication.

To provide information superiority and better situational awareness and to
facilitate proper decision making, defence communication enables C4ISR
programs. To address challenges in network, elements like trusted
platforms, secure switches/routers are required to ensure C4ISR
communication framework. This presentation covers communication requirement
analysis, and technology trends on Radio, Network and C4I communication
programs.


*Bio: * Dr. Ajit.T. Kalghatgi (Born on May 3rd 1958) recently retired as
Director (R&D) of Bharat Electronics. He has more than 35 years of
Experience in the field of RF & Communication Engineering. After graduating
from Mysore University with BE in Electronics & Communications, he
completed his M,Tech in Microwave & Radar Engineering from IIT, Kharagpur
and Ph.D., from Leeds University UK.

He worked in Avionics Design Bureau of HAL Hyderabad as Design Engineer
where he was responsible for Microwave Front-ends & IFF transceiver. He was
with the University of Leeds, UK from 1988 to 1993 for his Ph.D as a
Commonwealth Research Scholar and later as a Post Doctoral Fellow.

He was Director (R&D) BEL from September 2012 to June 2018. He has been
with Central Research Laboratory of BEL from 1994. He was Chief Scientist
CRL Bangalore since April 2006. His research interests are in RF and
Microwave Systems, Smart Antennas, RF MEMs and Secure Communication
Technologies. He has more than 90 research papers and a patent to his
credit. He is recipient of R&D Award from BEL for his significant
contribution to its R&D programme. In recognition of his outstanding
contribution to Technology Development leading to Product Design in the
field of Secure Spread Spectrum Communication the Society of Defence
Technologists (SODET) conferred the Gold Award for Technology Development &
Innovation for the year 2005-06. He is also recipient of Raksha Mantri
Award for Excellence in Innovation for the year 2007-08, as well as for the
year 2008-09. AOC India chapter conferred on him the Achievement Award for
Significant contribution to Electronic Warfare Systems in India. He is a
Member of the Editorial Board of Institution of Engineering & Technology
(IET) UK‚Äôs Microwave & Antennas research publications, Fellow of IETE,
Member of IEEE and IET-UK.




Regards,
B. N. Bharath
Assistant professor,
Electrical engineering department,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
content.318:
Subject: Happy New Year
Text: Dear Colleagues:

This year has been quite eventful for us all in IIT Dharwad.

Our students have done us proud with their performances both in academics
and other spheres ‚Äì be it inter IIT sports, inter IIT Tech meets, cultural
programs within the Institute etc.

We have almost doubled our faculty strength and initial set of regular
staff members have joined and steps have been initiated for more staff
recruitment.

Our faculty members have got their first sponsored/consultancy projects;
their first publications with IIT Dharwad affiliation; taught courses on
their own; etc.

Second phase of renovation in present campus has been completed and third
phase renovation has been taken up. Master plan for new campus has been
made ready. Designs of buildings and estimates are ready. Compound wall is
almost done and construction of buildings in permanent campus is expected
to start soon.

All these give us the confidence that the foundations of our new IIT are
firmly in place and reinvigorate us to face the new challenges (student
internships, placements, new campus construction etc) that the year ahead
will throw at us. While acknowledging that the future of any great
Institute depends on the actions of all its stake holders, let us
rededicate ourselves to work together as a family and do even better in the
coming year.

Wish you all a fulfilling new year ahead,

Prof. SV Prabhu (Dean AP & SW)

Prof. SRM Prasanna (Dean RnD & FW)

Prof. Nagesh Iyer (Dean IPS)

Prof. P. Seshu (Director)

content.327:
Subject: Inter Branch Football Match
Text: Hey everyone,

On the basis of students interaction, their presence at the ground and
ground condition, few rules and regulation has been decided by our sports
department and secys.

* Rules for the Football match*

   - Match Duration - 45 min (20 + 5 + 20)
   - Rolling Substition
   - Team of 11 players (9 + 2)
   - Its compulsory for at least 2 players from 1st year should be the part
   of the team. Captain is the sole person for the selection process.

*If player any player *

   - *Found abusing others*
   - *unfair means of play*
   - *horseplay during the match*

*a straight 2 mins suspension will be mandatory for them.*

*Referee's decision will be the Final decision.*

*Rules for Tie-breaker(draw)*

   - Additional time - 14min (6 + 2 + 6)
   - Followed by Penalty Shoot if match doesn't end in extra time
   - Sudden Death

I wish all the players follow the above mentioned rules.
If they are found of breaking these rules, strict action will be taken
against them.

*FIXTURES :-*
*FRIDAY :-  CSE vs EE   Time - 5:30PM*

*SATURDAY :- ME vs EE  Time - 5:30PM*

*SUNDAY :- CSE vs ME Time 8:00AM*

*                   Time - T.B.D*

*Draw - 1pts each*
*Loss - 0 pts.*

All the best everyone.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Prof. C. Amarnath <c.amarnath@gmail.com>
Date: Fri, Sep 21, 2018 at 8:41 AM
Subject: Fwd: TP Msg. #1665 How to Choose a Thesis Topic
To: P Seshu <director@iitdh.ac.in>, SV Prabhu <svprabhu@iitdh.ac.in>, Dean
Faculty Welfare <dean.fw@iitdh.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Rick Reis <reis@stanford.edu>
Date: Thu, Sep 20, 2018, 7:56 PM
Subject: TP Msg. #1665 How to Choose a Thesis Topic
To: tomorrows-professor@lists.stanford.edu <
tomorrows-professor@lists.stanford.edu>



[image: Tomorrow's Professor]
<https://tomprof.stanford.edu/mail/1665#>
[image: Students working in lab]

*Effective Thesis is a project that offers students topics for their final
theses and dissertations that are meaningful and have a high potential to
significantly improve the world.*
1665
How to Choose a Thesis Topic

Folks:

The posting below looks at an interesting program that helps match student
research interests with topics that are meaningful to society in one way or
another.  It is by David Jank≈Ø of the *Effective Thesis Project*
http://effectivethesis.com (see end of posting for more details). Czech
Association for Effective Altruism www.efektivni-altruismus.cz Reprinted
with permission.

NOTE: Please feel free to Get in touch and give us feedback  - The
Effective Thesis Project.

Regards,

Rick Reis

reis@stanford.edu

UP NEXT: The Great Conference Con?

Tomorrow‚Äôs Research

---------- 1,278 words ----------

How to Choose a Thesis Topic

 Finding a good thesis topic is hard. I first experienced this problem
myself in the final year of my bachelor studies. I was ready to work hard
on my final thesis, devote hundreds of hours and exceptional effort to it
as these bigger projects always motivated me. Also, it was something
tangible to finish my studies with and I wanted to finish with a ‚Äúgreat
parade‚Äù. However, I was still unsure about what exactly it was that I was
going to devote so much time and effort to. I was in turmoil with almost no
advice at hand and most of my classmates felt the same. In the end, they
ended up taking some easily accessible topic they hadn‚Äôt thought about very
much. I was lucky enough to roughly know which area I was interested in but
had no idea what specific questions to ask. When I heard that one of the
teachers specializing in that area offered ready-made topics I didn‚Äôt wait
a second, made an appointment with him an agreed to work on the first topic
he proposed. I didn‚Äôt know anything about it, but I was ready to learn more
and the feeling of not having to search for a topic for next several weeks
was invaluable.

That was when I understood that choosing a topic is really hard. However,
it‚Äôs the most important part of the research process. When I reflected
back, it was hard to believe how little attention all of us gave to such an
important part of the writing process where we would invest hundreds of
hours and huge effort over the next many months. When I finished my
bachelor studies, I decided I wanted to try and chance things. I found that
people from what was called ‚Äúthe effective altruism community‚Äù did long
research into which world problems are most pressing
<https://80000hours.org/articles/cause-selection/> and that many of these
problems lacked research attention. ‚ÄúWhen there is a lack of research on
the one hand and thousands of students desperately looking for a topic on
the other, why not help them all?‚Äù flashed through my mind. That was when I
first came upon the idea of setting up effectivethesis.com
<http://effectivethesis.com/>.

Effective Thesis is a project that offers students topics for their final
theses and dissertations that are meaningful and have a high potential to
significantly improve the world. We have decided to offer help in this
regard in two ways: (1) putting up a list of topics in need of research in
which students can surf and match themselves with a topic they feel is a
good fit and (2) providing individual coaching for those students who
couldn‚Äôt find a fit with any topic on our list. Below, I describe both of
these services in more detail.

List of topics

We started our project by putting together a list of important topics
<http://effectivethesis.com/theses/> that lacked research attention. Since
no list like that existed, we decided to ask organizations working on some
of the world‚Äôs most pressing problems
<https://80000hours.org/articles/cause-selection/> what would they need to
know to make significant progress in their cause. We transformed their
responses into topic profiles, containing not only description of the
topic, but also justification of why the topic is important and a link to
relevant literature to provide a head start for those interested in the
topic. We also arranged with these organizations to provide consultations
to students who choose one of their topics to ensure high practical utility
of the student‚Äôs work. Via consultations, organizations can check whether
students are answering the right question in their research and also
provide some useful theoretical and practical tips to improve the research
and make it more relevant. For better orientation we included filter
functions to allow students to filter topics by their study discipline and
area of interest stemming from the most pressing global problems. The list
has now more than 200 topics in 21 study disciplines and is still growing.

Creating a list of important topics was a good start, however, there were
additional issues that needed to be addresses. First, we found that good
fit of a topic might differ for students optimizing for highest social
impact of their thesis, improving their general career prospects or
preparing for a research career. Whereas topics in our list will help
students to contribute to solving some of the most pressing global problems
and therefore have high social impact, it may not always help them obtain a
job or prepare for a research career. Therefore, we have written three
instructional articles <http://effectivethesis.com/how-choose-thesis/>to
provide students with advice in these three instances.

We have also found that some topics we proposed were too broad and would
require narrowing down, that some students couldn‚Äôt find a supervisor at
their faculty for a topic they liked and that some students were struggling
to assess whether they are a good fit for the topic they chose with their
skills and longer term career plans. Therefore, we created another service
to address these issues.

Thesis Topic Coaching

To account for the above mentioned issues, we decided to take a more
individual path by providingindividual coaching
<http://effectivethesis.com/thesis-coaching/>. In the coaching process, a
coach takes into account factors such as longer term career goals,
supervisor availability, students‚Äô interests, skills, experience and course
requirements and comes up with a choice of few topics tailored made to
student‚Äôs circumstances. In an online call, student and coach then discuss
coaches‚Äô suggestions and design the final form of the topic. If students
don‚Äôt prefer any of the suggested topics, they may clarify their
expectations and the coach will try to suggest a new set of topics based on
their clarification. The coach will not help students with thesis writing
itself, but if students decide to work on one the proposed topics, we will
try to connect them with external researchers or organizations working on
the same problem.

Effective Thesis is a charitable project that aims to direct research into
areas deemed crucial to significantly improving the world that at the same
time lack research attention. There is no cost to the students. The only
expectation is that the students will conduct as high-quality research as
possible and the Effective Thesis Project will do everything in its
capacity to help with that! Get in touch
<http://effectivethesis.com/thesis-coaching/> and make your thesis
meaningful!

About the Effective Thesis Project

*The Effective Thesis project aims to focus research on areas that have the
potential to greatly improve the world. A lot of skilled and talented
people at universities find themselves in a situation where they have to
write a large final thesis (bachelor, diploma, Ph.D.) at least once during
their studies. Many of them find it difficult to choose a topic and end up
giving much time and effort into a paper that only serves as a means to get
their degree, with almost no subsequent applications. But when there is so
much energy invested in the thesis, why not choose a topic that will, on
the top of gaining you a diploma, benefit and help someone else?*

*Our coaches have broad and deep overview of **the most pressing global
issues* <https://80000hours.org/articles/cause-selection/> *and people
working on them, so they can offer students topics tailored to their
expertise and situation. When students choose one of our topics, we will
also try to connect them with people both within academia and practice
working on the same issue to ensure highest possible quality and utility of
students‚Äô work.*



"Desktop faculty development 100 times per year."
Over 65,000 subscribers at over 950 institutions in more than 100 countries

<http://tomprof.stanford.edu/>:

Subject: Fwd: [Fwd: Artificial Intelligence Day at IIMB]
Text: Hello Sir/Madam ,

Data Centre and Analytics Lab (DCAL), IIM Bangalore in association with
IBM Research - India is organising 'Research AI Day' on 29 June, 2019 at
IIMB. The theme of the event is 'Usable Artificial Intelligence' featuring
expert speakers from academia and industry, a panel discussion, quizzes,
demos, posters and tutorials for students and practitioners of AI. More
information about the event and registration details are available on the
website.

With the goal of promoting greater participation of women in computer
science research in academia and industry, and to provide a platform for
them to collaborate, learn and network with each other, we are also
hosting the women outreach program of IBM Research - India 'Maitreyee'.

content.339:
Subject: World Environment Day - 5th June 2018
Text: *‚ÄúWorld Environment Day* (*WED*)‚Äù occurs on the 5th of June every year, and
is the United Nation's principal vehicle for encouraging awareness and
action for the protection of our environment. First held in 1974, it has
been a flagship campaign for raising awareness on emerging environmental
issues from marine pollution, human overpopulation, and global warming, to
sustainable consumption and wildlife crime. This year‚Äôs host country is
India and theme is ‚Äú*BEAT PLASTIC POLLUTION*‚Äù. We are celebrating this day
with theme of ‚Äú*SAY NO TO PLASTIC*‚Äù to support this initiative. We request
you all to celebrate this day meaningfully avoiding usage of single-use or
disposable plastic items in campus.



*Plastic Pollution facts:*

¬∑         Every year the world uses *up to 5 trillion *plastic bags

¬∑         Each year, at least 13 million tonnes of plastic end up in the
oceans, the equivalent of a full garbage truck every minute.

¬∑         In the *last decade*, we produced more plastic than in the
whole *last
century*

¬∑         50 percent of the plastic we use is *single-use *or disposable

¬∑         We buy 1 million plastic bottles *every minute*

¬∑         Plastic makes up *10% of all of the waste *we generate

*Wishes of World Environment Day*

*#Beat Plastic Pollution*

-- 
With Best Regards
Physical Education Team
IIT Dharwad

content.349:
Subject: Wednesday Presentations
Text: Hello everyone,
This wednesday, 13th September 2018, Mr. Rajkumar and his team will share
experience of their internship in Ooty.

*Topic: Cross-protocol communication between SDLC and USB protocol using
AVR microcontroller and** Pyserial.*

In the seminar First Mr. Harshit will explain an overview of woking of
telescope and various units/blocks involved in getting data from space to
storing it in memory , in upgraded ORT system .

Later Mr. Raj will tell about the SDLC protocol currently executing in
legacy ORT system . And how big circuitaries and many power supply involved
in SDLC receiver can be replaced using AVR MCU and pyserial, so it will
save space, power and maintenance issues.

Venue: Room 23
Time : 5 p.m.

Thanks,
Shruti Patel
General Secretary Academic Affairs

content.354:
Subject: Invited Talk by Dr. Barendra Kumar Bhoi on "Goods and Services Tax: Biggest Indirect Tax Reforms in India" 13/03/2018 at 2:30 pm
Text: Dear All,

A gentle reminder for the talk at 2:30 pm in room number 23 on GST by Dr.
Bhoi.

Thanks and Regards,
Ridhima


On 20 Feb 2018 3:32 pm, "Ridhima Tewari" <ridhima@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:


Dear All,


You are cordially invited to a talk titled "Goods and Services Tax: Biggest
Indirect Tax Reforms in India", by Dr. Barendra Kumar Bhoi.

The details of the talk are as follows:

Venue: Room No. 23, Ground Floor
Date: 13th March, 2018 (Tuesday)


The talk will be followed by a discussion with the resource person.

I look forward to your participation,



Thanks and Regards,
Ridhima



About Dr. Bhoi:

Dr Bhoi obtained his Ph.D. in Economics from the Indian Institute of
Technology Bombay in 1997 on the topic ‚ÄúFinancial Innovations and the Issue
of Instability in the Demand for Money in India‚Äù. His association and work
at the Reserve Bank of India dates back to 1984. Dr. Bhoi was the Principal
Adviser and Head of the Monetary Policy Department (MPD), Reserve Bank of
India, responsible for implementing the new monetary policy framework -
Flexible Inflation Targeting (FIT) in India and resolving transitional
problems. He has also deliberated and published on critical economic issues
in  Quantitative Journal of Economics, RBI Occasional Papers, as well as in
the Economic and Political Weekly.




-- 

"I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library."

Ridhima Tewari, Ph.D
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011
Phone: +91 836 221 2843

content.362:
Subject: Regarding selection for Inter IIT Cultural Meet Dance Group
Text: Hi all,

As you all might have heard that this year we are going to participate in
the Inter IIT Cultural Meet, we are going to conduct an audition for the
Dance Group which will represent our institute in this meet.

We are looking for Dance enthusiasts who are willing to practice hard and
participate in this event. The auditions will be held this *Thursday in
Bhoopali building at 10 PM*. All people who are interested are requested to
be present on time. If the participation is high, we will extend the
auditions till Friday.

For the audition, you have to prepare a dance segment of around *30 sec*
and present it to us.I think 3 days are enough for practice of 30 sec
dance.It can be any dance form on any song or tune or beats. There is no
criterion for 1st-2nd-3rd Year students. Whoever does well will be given
the opportunity. Other details will be given on spot. *Whoever is
interested is requested to register for the audition by replying to this
mail. *

If you have any query, feel free to contact me.

Yash Doshi.
Institute Dance Club Secy.
160020001.
+91 73386555449.

content.364:
Subject: Budget allocation for clubs
Text: Dear All,
As this semester has ended, the planning for the new semester has begun. In
this case, Prabhu sir has asked me to prepare a policy for the budget for
the students clubs.
Each year everyone pays Rs. 1750 as Gymkhana fees. From this money, the
college funds the student activities like the student clubs.
In order to make such a budget I ask every club secretary to immediately
contact me on my email. For this budget planning, sports activities and
interiit activities are not included. So I request all club secretaries to
contact me.
Vihang Puranik

content.377:
Subject: Regarding the use of weightlifting equipment
Text: Hello all!

It was observed that people who workout at the gym have been using the
weightlifting room equipment to squat and do leg workouts.I observed a few
students using the equipment without the correct form. It is highly
recommended not to use the equipment in the weightlifting room because it
is extremely dangerous to use the weights without supervision of trained
personnel. Also it was observed that people leave the bar with the weights
on the stands after use. This causes the bars to bend and lose grip making
them unfit for future use. So kindly refrain from using the weightlifting
equipment if you don't have any previous experience with them.

Also it is to be noted that weightlifting club and gym are not related to
each other at all. However, if you do want  to lift weights, the doors of
our club are always open.

I'm also attaching a form to know if anyone wants to join the club.

Form link: https://forms.gle/9McNML5FBohKpiNi6

Peace‚úå
Krishna Deepak Nandagiri
Weightlifting club secretary
IIT Dharwad
content.378:
Subject: PhD Coursework seminar
Text: Dear All:
         Mr. Vishal Rajendra Naik, PhD student, Mechanical Engineering, is
going to present a seminar titled "Bennett Linkages and its Extensions" as
a part of PhD coursework requirement. The schedule of the seminar is as
given below:

Time: 10:00 AM
Date: Wednesday, 31st of July, 2019
Venue: Room No. 210

Abstract:

In this seminar, Bennett linkage, which is a mobile over-constrained
spatial four bar
mechanism, would be discussed. Further, three extensions of Bennett linkages
viz (1) Single-layer layout network of Bennett linkages, (2) Multi-layer
network of Bennett
linkages and (3) Connection of two similar Bennett linkages would be
explained. All three assemblies stated above have single degree of freedom.
These assemblies can also be treated as deployable
mechanisms. Furthermore, a report would be presented on simulation of
Bennett linkages and its three extensions performed in multi-body dynamics
simulation software ADAMS. To facilitate modelling in
ADAMS, a program in MATLAB was written to get location of joints. The great
versatility of Bennett linkage and a major role it can play in applications
such as Six-legged Robot, Deployable Parabolic Cylindrical Antenna and
Long-Span Shelters are discussed.

All are welcome to attend

with regards

content.382:
Subject: Introducing CampusSpeaks
Text: Hey there,
CampusSpeaks is a community rating app (for Android and iOS) to better select courses/electives and professors to collab with (not just in IIT Dharwad but other institutes as well). Its algorithms helps you get better grades by suggesting the best courses to take in every semester based on the reviews, interests, activities and ratings given by your colleagues and students elsewhere. Everything recorded is anonymised and untagged to maintain privacy.

Visit this link for more details (and images/screenshots): http://campus.fromabctill.xyz <http://campus.fromabctill.xyz/>
Sign up to be notified on launch (soon).

Since data is crowd sourced more the number of users, more accurate will be the recommendations and predictions, and which also means that initially there would be some mispredictions! 

Warm regards,
Harshal Gajjar
160010003

*IPTSE 2019*



*Dear Sir / Madam*



We are pleased to inform second edition of *Intellectual Property Talent
search Examination ‚Äì IPTSE 2019* in association with Ericson co ‚Äì supported
by *AICTE & Dept. of Science & Technology. *

This Competition would greatly help spread awareness of Intellectual
Property Rights (IPR) and empower the young innovators to protect their
inventions.

IPTSE garnered support from different state governments, Ministry of Micro,
Small & Medium Enterprises, Govt. of India, important education
institutions like All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE),
Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti, Assam Higher Secondary Education Council and
many universities like University of Delhi, Mumbai University. In
continuation of our effort to promote IPR awareness, we are happy to
announce second edition of IPTSE 2019-20 with targeting of class IX to XII
school and under graduate students at university level.



Students have to appear for online examination and on the basis of score
obtained by the students, students will be awarded at regional and national
level with the Award Money, Trophy and Certificate as the token of
appreciation. Online modules on IP are provided to students that enable
them to prepare for examination.

content.394:
Subject: Re: Faculty Seminar by Dr. Parikshit Sahatiya on 13th August at 4 p.m.
Text: Dear All,

A gentle reminder for today's talk.

Best Regards,
Ruma

On Fri, Aug 10, 2018 at 10:02 PM, Ruma Ghosh <rumaghosh@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> A  seminar has been scheduled on Monday (13th August, 2018). The details
> of the scheduled talk is as follows:
>
> *Date*: 13th August, 2018
>
> *Time*: 4.00 pm to 5.00 pm
>
> *Venue*: Room No. 119
>
> *Title: Flexible substrate based nanoelectronic devices for applications
> in broadband photodetectors and smart personal healthcare monitoring*
>
>
> *Abstract: *
>
> Conventional electronic devices fabricated on rigid crystalline
> semiconductors wafers have evolved with the motivation to miniaturize
> thereby realizing faster, smaller and densely integrated devices. A
> parallel research that is rapidly evolving for future electronics is to
> integrate the property of flexibility and stretchablity of substrates to
> develop human friendly devices. While most reports on photodetectors focus
> on improving the responsivity in one region of electromagnetic spectrum by
> fabricating 2D materials hybrids, the main issue which remains unaddressed
> is the inability to absorb wide range of electromagnetic spectrum. The

content.395:
Subject: Faculty Seminar by Dr. Parikshit Sahatiya on 13th August at 4 p.m.
Text: Dear All,

A  seminar has been scheduled on Monday (13th August, 2018). The details of
the scheduled talk is as follows:

*Date*: 13th August, 2018

*Time*: 4.00 pm to 5.00 pm

*Venue*: Room No. 119

*Title: Flexible substrate based nanoelectronic devices for applications in
broadband photodetectors and smart personal healthcare monitoring*


*Abstract: *

Conventional electronic devices fabricated on rigid crystalline
semiconductors wafers have evolved with the motivation to miniaturize
thereby realizing faster, smaller and densely integrated devices. A
parallel research that is rapidly evolving for future electronics is to
integrate the property of flexibility and stretchablity of substrates to
develop human friendly devices. While most reports on photodetectors focus
on improving the responsivity in one region of electromagnetic spectrum by
fabricating 2D materials hybrids, the main issue which remains unaddressed
is the inability to absorb wide range of electromagnetic spectrum. The
first part of the talk focuses on the development of flexible broadband
photodetectors based on MoS2 and their hybrids. Also, ways to improve the
responsivity of flexible photodetectors will be discussed in terms of
strain modulation and Piezotronics. Second part of the talk will cover the
other research activities in the field of flexible and wearable
electronics. This includes wireless smart low-cost multifunctional sensors
for personal healthcare applications, fabrication of artificial electronic
skin (e-skin) based on eraser, and graphene based flexible temperature and
infrared sensor on polyimide substrate.



*Speaker's biography:* Dr. Parikshit Sahatiya received his Ph.D. from IIT
Hyderabad, Electrical Engineering Department and was a Research Associate
at IIT Hyderabad for 3 months. He is currently working as a Research
Scientist at Redpine Signals in association with IITH for the fabrication
of flexible resistive memory (memresistor). His research interest includes
fabrication of flexible and wearable nanoelectronic devices for IoT
applications and exploring emerging 2D materials for sensing applications
and flexible memristors. Dr. Parikshit has authored 22 publications in
peer-reviewed journals, out of which 17 are first author publications. For
his Ph.D. work, Dr. Parikshit has received ‚ÄúBest Project Award‚Äù, Indian
Nanoelectronics User Program, IITB for the year 2017 for his work on
multifunctional wireless sensors and has been nominated for Best Thesis
Award 2018 by INAE.


Please make it convenient to attend the talk.


Best Regards,
Ruma

-- 
Dr. Ruma Ghosh

Assistant Professor
Electrical Engineering Department,
IIT Dharwad, Karnataka-580004
Ph.- +91 8362212849

content.397:
Subject: Reminder: Announcement of Talk on 14th Nov., 2018; from 2:30 to 3:30 PM; Room-119.
Text: Dear All,

This is a gentle reminder for today's talk as per details given in the
appended email.

Thanking you,

Yours truly,
R Prabhu


On Mon, Nov 12, 2018, 7:51 AM Dr. R. Prabhu <prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> This is to announce a* Talk* as per following details:
>
> *****************************************************************
> Speaker: *D**r. Venkata Sathish Akella*
>                Senior Scientist (Project), Department of Applied
> Mechanics, IIT Madras
>
> Date.     : *14 November 2018 (Wednesday)*
>
> Time.     : *2:30 to 3:30 PM*
>
> Venue.   : *Room No. 119*
>
> Title: *Self-propulsion by Marangoni forces*
>
> *Abstract:* We experimentally study the self-propulsion of
> particles/drops induced by surface tension gradients also known as
> Marangoni forces. In the first part of the talk, we report experiments on
> an agarose gel tablet loaded with camphoric acid (c-boat) spontaneously set
> into motion by surface tension gradients on the water surface. We observe
> three distinct modes of c-boat motion: harmonic mode where the c-boat speed
> oscillates sinusoidally in time, a steady mode where the c-boat maintains
> constant speed, and an intermittent mode where the c-boat maintains
> near-zero speed between sudden jumps in speed. Whereas all three modes have
> been separately reported before in different systems, controlled release of
> camphoric acid from the agarose gel matrix allowed the observation of all
> the three modes in the same system. In the second part, we report
> self-propulsion of liquid drops on a liquid surface. The dynamics involved
> are quite rich in comparison to that of a particle on liquid surface as a
> liquid drop exhibits motion, deformation and break up. In this regard, we
> experimentally study the motion of an Octanoic Acid drop on aqueous
> solutions of octanoic acid. In the current work, we study a regime where
> triple line undulations result in varying Marangoni propulsion and a random
> walking drop. We discuss two parametric regimes where the drop motion
> exhibits a Levy walk and a near-Gaussian random walk. We present mean
> squared displacement, probability distributions of step lengths as well as
> from velocity auto-correlations from observations of the drop motion as
> evidence. Finally, we show that the drop `foraging' mimics a living system.
>
> *Brief Biodata (Sic):* My primary interest is in the area of Soft
> Condensed Matter Physics. I finished my Ph.D. in Physics from Brandeis
> University, USA, in Sep 2013. At Brandeis, I worked on nucleation
> kinetics of protein crystallization (Advisor: Prof. Seth Fraden). I have
> been a post-doctoral scholar with Prof. Mahesh Panchagnula at IIT Madras
> since Mar 2017. Before that, I was a post-doctoral scholar with Prof.
> Mahesh M. Bandi at Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (Nov 2013 -
> Mar 2017). I completed my M.Sc.(Physics) from IIT Madras and after that I
> began my research career at Hindustan Unilever Research India, Bangalore as
> a Research Associate in Chemical Engg. & Material Science division.
> *****************************************************************
>
> ALL ARE WELCOME.
>
> Thanking you.
>
> Yours truly,
> R. Prabhu
>
> --
> Dr. R. Prabhu
> Assistant Professor,
> Department of Physics,
> Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
> Dharwad - 580011,
> Karnataka, INDIA.
>
> Email: prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in
> Phone: 0091 836 2212 851 (Office)

My name is Simona Maschi, I am the founder and CEO of the Copenhagen

<https://ciid-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1rNPULTghPtGxhoUv-cixMa-Yz32lHu1pmEkrvPImT2c-1818581289&key=YAMMID-48216346&link=http%3A%2F%2Fciid.dk%2F>

Organization, UNICEF, Boston Scientific, and INTEL, as well as government
and municipality employees in various cities.

Council under the Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs, we are bringing
our Summer
School to Kochi India
<https://ciid-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1rNPULTghPtGxhoUv-cixMa-Yz32lHu1pmEkrvPImT2c-1818581289&key=YAMMID-48216346&link=http%3A%2F%2Fciid.dk%2Feducation%2Fsummer-school%2Fciid-summer-school-india-2018%2Fworkshops%2F>.

<https://ciid-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1rNPULTghPtGxhoUv-cixMa-Yz32lHu1pmEkrvPImT2c-1818581289&key=YAMMID-48216346&link=http%3A%2F%2Fciid.dk%2Feducation%2Fsummer-school%2Fciid-summer-school-india-2018%2Fworkshops%2F>

content.405:
Subject: This World Mental Health Day, Let's Make a Promise
Text: <https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=PromiseBoard&yd_term=19>
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=PromiseBoard&yd_term=19>
A student's life isn't the easiest is it? There's just so much pressure -
parents, society, peers, etc., the pressure is relentless. It sometimes
feels like we're carrying the weight of the world on our shoulders all
alone. Worse still, it's so difficult to talk about it with someone.

*‚ÄúI fell and scraped my knee, I need to visit a doctor‚Äù* is easy to share,
yet *‚ÄúI failed and have been tremendously down since then. I think I should
talk to a counselor‚Äù* is not so easily expressed is it?

Isn't It time we start giving mental health the same importance as our
physical health if not more, and truly become the best versions of
ourselves?

*So, this World Mental Health Day, let's resolve to bring a change and help
build a friendly, safe, non-judgmental and supportive campus for ourselves
and everyone around us, one promise at a time. Here's how you can do it -*

Remember, it's ok not to feel ok, and there is absolutely nothing wrong in
seeking help.

You can always reach out to an Expert at YourDOST

connect to an expert now
<https://yourdost.com/chatSession/?workgroup=demo@workgroup.chat.yourdost.com?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=PromiseBoard&yd_term=19>

Wishing you a very enlightened, World Mental Health Day!

Love,
*Team YourDOST*
content.406:
Subject: Annual Progress Seminar of Mr Pranjal Kumar
Text: Dear all,





The first annual progress seminar of Mr. Pranjal Kumar (Ph.D. student,
BSBE) is scheduled to be held on 3rd July 2019. Please find the details
below. All are welcome.



*Title*: Identification and Functional Characterization of MYC regulated
LncRNAs in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

*Venue*: Room 119

*Time*: 11.00 am to 12.00 pm

*Abstract*:

Cancer is a disease of uncontrolled cell growth. Lung cancer is the leading
cause of cancer-related deaths worldwide. Pathologically, Lung cancer is
subcategorized in two subtypes: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and
Small cell lung cancer (SCLC). NSCLC, a subtype of lung cancer, contributes
about 85% of total lung cancer-related deaths. Myc, a transcription factor,
is one of the most critical oncogenes and is deregulated frequently in
almost all the cancer types, including Lung cancer. LncRNA, a relatively
novel class of RNA, has shown to play a crucial role in cancer development
and progression. Many studies have been done to decipher the role of
LncRNAs in cancer development. However, a significant proportion of LncRNAs
remain unexplored. Here, we aim to identify the Myc regulated LncRNAs in
Lung cancer and characterize their function in lung cancer. We have
performed various bioinformatics analysis to identify RP11-132A1.4 as the
putative target of Myc in lung cancer. In the present work, I have knocked
down the level of Myc in A549 and H460 cell and check the expression of
RP11-132A1.4. In future work, I plan to study the role of RP11-132A1.4 in
development of lung cancer.
Thank you
Regards
Sudhanshu
-- 
Warm Regards
Sudhanshu Shukla
Assistant professor
Biosciences and Bioengineering
IIT Dharwad
Email: sudhanshu@iitdh.ac.in
Ph: +918362212853

We are celebrating the foundation day on Tuesday, 28th August 2018 at 10.30

content.419:
Subject: Talk by Dr. Hiranmay Ghosh (17/1/2019)
Text: Dear All,

You are invited to attend the following talk.

Title: Knowledge Representation for Cognitive Vision
Venue: Room 203
Date: 17/1/2019
Time: 15:00 hours

Speaker: Dr. Hiranmay Ghosh, TATA Consultancy Services

Abstract:

In this talk, we present a knowledge representation scheme that is suitable
for cognititive vision systems. In the first part of the talk, we review
the goals of computer vision and discuss why cognitive principles should be
used to improve the performance of artificial vision systems. We introduce
the concepts of perceptive and cognitive layes of processing in biological
vision, and illustrate various aspects of perception and cognition with
several examples. In the second part of the talk, we go deeper into
cognitive reasoning and address the representation issues for the various
layers of visual processing. We establish the requirements for knowledge
representation for cognitive vision and present a formal knowledge
representation scheme, Multimedia Web Ontology Language (MOWL), that can be
used for the purpose.

Speaker Bio:

Hiranmay Ghosh has received his Ph.D. Degree from Department of Electrical
Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, and his B.Tech.
(Radiophysics & Electronics) and B.Sc. (Hons. in Physics) Degrees from the
Calcutta University. His current research interests are Computer Vision,
Machine Learning, Cognitive Computing and Knowledge Representation.

He is presently engaged a Research Adviser to TATA Consultancy Services.
Earlier, he had worked in R&D functions in ECIL, C-DOT and TCS. He had been
nominated as Adjunct Faculty with IIT Delhi and with NIT Karnataka. He has
more than 50 publications to his credit in international journals and
peer-reviewed conferences. He is the co-author of a book Multimedia Web
Ontology Language.

He is a Senior Member of IEEE, and members of ACM and IUPRAI.

Regards,
Rajshekar

-- 
Rajshekar K
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science and Engineering
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad, Karnataka, India.
Ph: +91-836-2212-888
www.cse.iitd.ac.in/~rajshekar
content.420:
Subject: S02E01
Text: Some hints regarding the first challenge:

Is it really just an image? Is Windows Photo Viewer (Image Viewer for the
l33ts) the only way to open an image? But how can one open an image with an
file compressor, or a PDF viewer? Will changing extensions do? What more
can an image hide?

P.S. Not specific to this challenge, but if you get into trouble with linux
on any challenge, try using Windows alternatives of the application.
--

content.434:
Subject: Inter Year Basketball Tournament
Text: Hello everyone,
Having completed the construction of the Basketball court, an Inter Year
Basketball Tournament is going to be organised on *13th (Saturday) and 14th
(Sunday) of April*. A team (1st, 2nd or 3rd year) can consist of both men
and women.

Here is the link to register -
https://forms.gle/iat5Q8xFKQTarGiZA

*Also, if there are more than 10 registrations per team, there will be a
small round of selections held.*

Match schedule is as follows -
13th April, 9a.m. - M1 [3rd Year vs. 1st Year]
13th April, 5:30p.m. - M2 [2nd Year vs. 1st Year]
14th April, 9a.m. - M3 [3rd Year vs. 2nd Year]

14th April, 5:30p.m. - Finals
* Match timings maybe changed depending on the availability of the batches.

*Team Formation Rules*
Teams are supposed to have a maximum of *10 members (5 playing + 5 subs)*.
The matches will be played with *Full Court* rules.

*General Rules*
Scoring for the matches is as follows:
*Winning Team +2*
*Losing Team +0*

Matches will be played with *8 minutes* a quarter, with *4 quarters* in all.

There will be a *2-minute* break in between *1st/2nd* quarter and *3rd/4th*
quarter. Whereas there will be a *5-minute* break *after 2nd* quarter. If
the match goes to overtime, there will be a *2-minute* break in between
each overtime.

Each team has *4 timeouts* (which can be taken only when the team is in
possession of the ball), where each timeout is *a minute* long.

In case of a draw, there will be overtimes till a winner is decided (*6
minutes each overtime*).

Standard BFI rules will be followed. Referee's decision will be final.
(Ravi Sir and Sujatha Ma'am will be the referees)

Each team (1st, 2nd and 3rd years) is to be strictly composed of the
respective batch students.

If there is enough participation from the research scholars, there will be
a separate team of theirs. Otherwise, they'll be shuffled into one of the
batches randomly.

*Feel free to reply to this email in case of any ambiguity.*

Hoping to see good participation and spirit,
Thanks and regards,
Anudeep Tubati
Basketball Secretary
content.435:
Subject: Fwd: An invitation to your esteemed institution for participating in Jagruti'19 (All India Youth Conference at IISc Bengaluru on 12 & 13 January 2019)
Text: Professor in Mechanical Engineering, Larsen and Toubro Chair Professor,
Dean (Academic Programme and Student Welfare)
IIT Dharwad
On deputation from IIT Bombay


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Students' Council Chairman <chair.sc@iisc.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Dec 10, 2018 at 4:01 PM
Subject: An invitation to your esteemed institution for participating in
Jagruti'19 (All India Youth Conference at IISc Bengaluru on 12 & 13 January
2019)
To: jagruti2k19@gmail.com <jagruti2k19@gmail.com>


Dear Madam/Sir,

Greetings from the Indian Institute of Science!



It gives me an immense pleasure to invite your esteemed institution to be a
part of the Jagruti'19: 3rd All India Student Conference to be held on 12th
(Saturday) & 13th (Sunday) January 2019 at Indian Institute of Science
(IISc), Bengaluru, India. The national level youth conference will be
organized by the Students' Council IISc and Think India. Commemorating the
150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and celebrating Swami
Vivekananda's birth anniversary, "*Sustainable Rural Habitat-Returning back
to our roots" *has been considered as a theme of this year's youth
conference.  Being solution-oriented, Jagruti'19 invites original,
innovative and thought-provoking ideas from across India towards
understanding rural India and identifying ways in which a sustainable rural
livelihood can be achieved. The conference aims to discuss the current
situation, achievements, challenges, opportunities and advancements
concerning rural India. With the announcement of the conference, we would
like to invite students from all across India to participate in the
national level competitions; paper presentation, model presentation,
documentary presentation and street play. The conference will be a home for
two days for the heroes who have received many accolades, nationally and
internationally for their efforts, ideas and spirit towards transforming
rural India in a significant manner.

Kindly disseminate the attached pieces of information to the students of
your premier institution. I request you to extend your kind support for the
conference with your auspicious presence at the event and motivating the
students of your institution to participate in the same.

Kindly let me know if any other information is needed.



Thank you very much!



Regards,

Vivek Sharma (9980598513)

Chairman

Students' Council, IISc

&
Chief Coordinator of Jagruti'19

content.438:
Subject: Google Cloud Study Jam
Text: [image: cloud_study_jam.jpg]

It gives me immense pleasure to inform you all that *DSC IIT Dharwad* is
going to host its first *Google Cloud Study Jam* in IIT Dharwad in
collaboration with GDG Hubli <https://www.meetup.com/GDGHubli/> and GitHub
on *August 11, 2019*. It would be a 5 hours ( 10:00 am - 15:00 pm,
including lunchtime) hands-on lab session where students will get started
with the Google Cloud Platform. The session would be taken by  *Mr. Girish
Patil*, GDG Hubli Organiser, and team. These study jams will be series of
events diving deeper with every event. By the end of this event, you will
be having knowledge of the essentials of Google cloud platform. You can
attend this regardless of your experience with cloud computing.
The session is an open event and students from outside our college are also
going to attend this event. Since we have limited seats and we have already
got huge responses from students outside our college, those interested are
requested to RSVP quickly through this Registration link
<https://www.meetup.com/GDGHubli/events/263037798/> and fill up this google
form
<https://forms.gle/WrAtaqP57AAd8bCV9>

*Note*: Due to limited sitting capacity, no walk-ins are allowed. Only
those who register before seats get full will be allowed to attend.

Sonu Sourav
General Secretary, Technical Affairs
IIT Dharwad
content.439:
Subject: India‚Äôs biggest Inter Campus Photography Contest
Text: If anyone is interested in the competition, reply to this mail.

Regards,
Gautam Jagdhish
Institute Film and Media Secretary

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Bhattacharya, Shivantee <campus@chiiz.com>
Date: Thu 4 Oct, 2018, 3:14 PM
Subject: Welcome to Chiiz Campus
To: <170010031@iitdh.ac.in>


We are an online international photography portal with a monthly 100 page
magazine dedicated solely to photography. We aim to bring forth the
underrated photographers and exhibit their talent to the world.

We are proud to announce our latest venture into Photography ‚ÄúChiiz Campus‚Äù,
a platform for colleges/universities/clubs with photography enthusiasts who
are continuously striving to learn and explore everything about photography.

We are organizing India‚Äôs biggest Inter Campus Photography Contest soon
this year, which is one big opportunity to broaden your horizons in
photography. This one occasion will encourage young budding photographers
in our country to come out and show their talent. The competition will also
give an opportunity to win an amount of 1,00,000 and the winning photograph
will be published in our magazine. Apart from the contest, there will be
workshops, assignments and exhibitions at various campuses where
photographers can participate and improve their skills.

We invite you to be a part of this initiative where you will get to learn,
explore and compete with the photography societies of the colleges across
India! We already have the photography society of IIT-BHU, IMS Unison
University, IIT-Mandi, ICFAI University, Calcutta School of Contemporary
Photography, Jadhavpur University, P.G.D.A.V College (DU), Motilal Nehru
College (DU), School of Open Learning Delhi University, TCS Maitrayee
Photography Club, NSIT, IIT-Kanpur, Rajdhani College (DU) IIT-Kharagpur,
Hindu College (DU), Birla Institute of Technology (Patna), Atma Ram Sanatan
Dharm College (DU), Zakir Hussain College (DU), Maitrayee College (DU),
Vivekananda College (DU) and many more.


There is no limit for the number of participants from one team. Each
participant can submit a maximum number of 10 Photographs.


*It will be a great privilege for us, if we can **on-board** you as well.*

To know more about our magazine you can visit chiiz.com
Instagram Handle chiizdotcom

Thanks,
Shivantee Bhattacharya
Business Development Executive & Content Head
Chiiz

content.441:
Subject: Innovative Name and Tagline
Text: Hi peeps,
I had a chat with Amarnath Sir and we are sure to have a good set of
technical activities this semester.So, after a discussion with him, he
wanted me to do this.
1.)Suggest an innovative/cheeky/catchy name for our technical meet(think of
it as a tech meet and suggest a name accordingly).E.g: When this had
started in IIT Bombay, it was named Yantriki(Yantra - Machines and it was
Tricky :))
2.) Suggest an equivalent tagline,something which we will always remember
throughout, which complements the Name.

Remember, this will be remembered forever in the history of IIT Dharwad.So,
it would be great if you all can come up with some great ideas, for this.

Do send your response only to me.
Looking forward to hearing from you all.

Adios.
Samveed Desai,
Technical Secretary,
IIT Dharwad.

Dean (Academic Programmes),
Dean (Students Welfare),
Dean (Faculty Welfare)
Dean (Research & Development)

IIT Dharwad


Dear Prof. P Seshu, Prof. S V Prabhu, Prof. S R Mahadeva Prasanna,

Greetings. We are writing to you from Physical Research Laboratory (PRL),
Ahmedabad. PRL, under the aegis of the Department of Space, Government of
India is involved in research activities in the domain of Physical
Sciences (e.g. Theoretical Physics, Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics,
Astronomy and Astrophysics, Solar Physics, Space and Atmospheric Sciences,
Earth, Planetary and Geo-Sciences, etc.). Further, we are actively
involved in several science outreach activities for school children to
college students. The details of the activities can be found at our web
page,

https://www.prl.res.in

We are delighted to bring to your kind notice that the year 2019, marks
the birth centenary year of Dr. Vikram A. Sarabhai, the father of Indian
Space Programme and founder of PRL. To commemorate the occasion, PRL is
proud to announce the VIkram Sarabhai Innovation CompetitiON (VISION)-2019
award for the science and engineering college students pursuing B.Sc.,
M.Sc., Integrated M.Sc., or B.E./B.Tech. programs with the aim to
encourage the younger generation of scientists and the brilliant
innovators. The competition is preferably for the students in their
pre-final year (one or more years remaining for completion of their
degree).

Details of VISION-2019 can be found at following webpage,

https://www.prl.res.in/prl-eng/vision2019

The poster with details of the competition, award and application process
is also enclosed for circulation among your students and faculties. We look
forward to have active participation from your esteemed
department/institution.

In case of any query, please feel free to contact us at:
vision2019@prl.res.in

Thanking you in anticipation.

With best wishes.


The Coordinator
VISION-2019
Physical Research Laboratory (PRL)
Navrangpura, Ahmedabad
Gujarat-380009
E-mail: vision2019@prl.res.in
content.448:
Subject: Fwd: PANIIT CONCLAVE 2019: HACKATHON
Text: FYI

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Arjun Malhotra <arjun.malhotra@paniit.org>
Date: Thu, 3 Jan 2019 at 7:11 PM
Subject: PANIIT CONCLAVE 2019: HACKATHON
To: <director@iitdh.ac.in>


Dear Prof. Seshu,

Hope you are doing well!

PanIIT Conclave is being held at IIT Delhi on 19th and 20th January 2019.
Theme of the conclave is: ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence: What does the Future
Hold for India?‚Äù. We are expecting multiple participations from Govt. of
India, thought leaders in AI and top corporate leaders. A hackathon is
being conducted as part of the conclave.

The first PanIIT AI Hackathon 2019 aims to promote AI and ML among the
wider community of software and IT professionals and showcase the talent
among them. In keeping with the theme of the Conclave, the Hackathon will
focus on AI and how the technology can be used to solve problems important
to India. The teams will be given problems which will have direct impact on
the society, and present their solutions to the audience at the Conclave.
The Hackathon will be conducted in two stages. The first stage will be
conducted online between 4 January 2019 and 6 January 2019. The top 15
teams emerging from the first stage will move on to the second stage which
will be conducted on site at IIT Delhi between 19 January 2019 and 20
January 2019. Prizes to the winning teams will be awarded during the
Valedictory session of the Conclave.

Stage 1: MACHINE LEARNING/Online, 10 PM on 4 January 2019 to MIDNIGHT on 6
January 2019

The first stage will run online for 48 hours from 10 pm on January 4th
2019  to 12 AM (midnight) on 6th January 2019. A specific ML task will be
given to the teams. Training data for model building will be provided.
Prediction on test data in a specified format will have to be uploaded for
automated assessment. The top 15 teams will be selected based on their rank
on leader board and will be invited to participate in second stage of
hackathon.

Stage 2: BUILD MVP/on site at IIT Delhi, 12 PM on 19 January 2019 to 12 PM
on 20 January 2019
The second stage of the hackathon will be held at TCS PanIIT Conclave 2019
at IIT Delhi campus on 19 and 20 January 2019. This stage of the hackathon
will require the teams to build a minimal viable product, using machine
learning, which typically solves a problem specific to India. Each team
will be given 15 to 20 minutes to present their idea and demonstrate it to
the jury. The combined scores given by the judges will be used to decide
the order of merit. The top three team will be given cash awards.

Team Composition:
A team should consist of 3 members, at least one of whom must be an IITian,
either current student, alumnus, or faculty. The Hackathon will test both
ML and product building skills of the team. The ideal team composition may
consist of one data scientist or machine learning expert, one backend
engineer and one front engineer.

Travel cost:
Any member of a team qualifying for the second stage who travels to New
Delhi will be reimbursed travel costs up to Rs. 10,000 per person. Local
Delhi teams will be paid Rs. 3,000 per person towards local costs.

Team Prizes:
‚Ä¢ Winning Team: Rs. 300,000
‚Ä¢ Runners Up: Rs. 210,000
‚Ä¢ 3rd Prize: Rs. 150,000

Registration:
Teams can register online at
https://skillenza.com/challenge/pan-iit-hackathon

Periodic updates regarding the Hackathon will be posted on the website of
TCS PanIIT Conclave 2019 at paniit2019.org

If you have any questions, please feel free to reach me or Ravi Narayan,
Vice Chair of Programmes at ravi@narayans.com

Regards,
ARJUN MALHOTRA

Arjun Malhotra
Chairman
PanIIT Conclave 2019

-- 
Prof. P. Seshu
Director and Professor of Mechanical Engg,
IIT Dharwad,
Near High Court, Dharwad - 580 011

content.451:
Subject: Talk by Dr. Prabuchandran on 20th March (Wednesday) at 2.30 pm
Text: Dear all,

There is a talk by Dr. Prabuchandran K. J. (Amazon-IISc Postdoctoral
scholar at IISc) on this Wednesday (20th March) from 2.30 pm to 3.30 pm.
Please find the details below. All interested are welcome.

*Title*: Novel First Order Bayesian Optimization
*Venue*: Room 23
*Abstract*:
Zeroth Order Bayesian Optimization (ZOBO) methods optimize an unknown
function based on its black-box evaluations at the query locations. Unlike
most optimization procedures, ZOBO methods fail to utilize gradient
information even when it is available. On the other hand, First Order
Bayesian Optimization (FOBO) methods exploit the available gradient
information to arrive at better solutions faster. However, utilizing the
gradient information in the FOBO methods incur severe computational cost.
Further, the inherent sequential nature of the FOBO methods and the problem
of noisy gradient information exacerbates the computational overhead as
well as the underlying parameter estimation problem, limiting their wide
applicability. To alleviate the aforementioned difficulties of FOBO
methods, in this talk we propose a simple statistical model to leverage the
gradient information and present novel FOBO methods that search for global
optima effectively.  Furthermore, we explore application of the proposed
FOBO methods in the context of policy gradient reinforcement learning.

*Short Bio*:
Prabuchandran K.J. is an Amazon-IISc Postdoctoral scholar at IISc,
Bangalore. He holds  Ph.D. from Department of Computer Science and
Automation, IISc in the area of Reinforcement  Learning. Post his PhD,
Prabuchandran worked as Research Scientist at IBM Research Labs, India for
an year and half on change detection algorithms for multivariate
compositional data. His research lies in the intersection of reinforcement
learning, stochastic control & optimization, Machine Learning, Bayesian
Optimization and stochastic approximation algorithms.  His research
interest also focuses on utilizing techniques from these fields in
solving  problems
arising in applications like wireless sensor networks, traffic signal
control and social networks.

Thanks and Regards,
Sandeep

Sandeep R. B.
Assistant Professor
Computer Science and Engineering
IIT Dharwad

content.454:
Subject: I was a topper... but now I find myself lost
Text: YourDOST
[image: YourDOST at IITDharwad]
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=Year2019End1&yd_term=19>
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=Year2019End1&yd_term=19>
One of them is Rohan (name changed). Rohan, an 18 year old man, had joined
one of the country‚Äôs premier engineering colleges. He was always a high
achiever, being his school topper for the most part. Rohan arrived on
campus full of energy and confidence.
Everything was going fine, till the first quiz results came out. Rohan
found his name in the bottom 10 performers. He was in complete shock. His
confidence and self-esteem hit rock bottom. He felt he was inferior to his
peers, and started isolating himself more and more as his academic
performance, in his opinion, continued to be ‚Äúunder par‚Äù.
This was the state in which Rohan approached YourDOST. He felt like a
complete failure. Over the next few weeks, he and Archana, a YourDOST
expert, worked together to challenge his harsh self-judgement. After 6
weeks of regular counseling, Rohan is feeling more like his old self. He
has made some friends, and feels far more confident about himself. One of
the results of this was also a boost in his academic performance.
Like Rohan, would you like to give your confidence a boost too?

Let's make 2019 a year of hope connect with an expert now
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=Year2019End1&yd_term=19>

YourDOST

content.465:
Subject: Registration for Robotics Competition.
Text: Hey Guys,
Many of you have approached me saying they do not know the freshers or the
other students who are willing to participate.
So I am circulating this form to enable you to contact each other as easily
as possible. Please fill your name and roll number so that it helps you
form teams.
