content.472:
Subject: Fwd: Action Reqd: Next Steps & Recap || Winter Workshops Kick-Off Meeting
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: *Harshal Gajjar* <gotoharshal@gmail.com>
Date: Saturday, July 28, 2018
Subject: Fwd: Action Reqd: Next Steps & Recap || Winter Workshops Kick-Off
Meeting
To: 160010003@iitdh.ac.in


*From:* Rohin Banerji <connect@bhav.at>
*Date:* 27 July 2018 at 7:14:50 PM IST
*To:* connect@bhav.at
*Cc:* Kyle Keane <kyle@bhav.at>, andrew@bhav.at
*Subject:* *Action Reqd: Next Steps & Recap || Winter Workshops Kick-Off
Meeting*

Hello!

Thank you so much for wanting to be part of this adventure we are calling
Bhav.AT <http://bhav.at/>! We have spent the last few days organising
ourselves so we can be ready to focus our efforts effectively and provide
the needed infrastructure to make a global impact! "Bhav" is a Sanskrit
word with many meanings that will be revealed as we move forward :-)

Below are some highlights and updates about our next steps as an
organisation. We would love to have you onboard as well. Please fill out
the survey below and send us any thoughts you might have.

Five Highlights and Action Steps:

1. The August workshops are in full swing. Find more information about the
event here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeX8YKhD2v6qgqJtfxQ1TxzQkmot6fTn5HZIsJFDC1guDSzjA/viewform>
.

2. We are beginning to assemble small teams to run local events moving
forward (targeting a series of events in India this Winter). Please fill
out this Google Form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdxSYl3cttvbGjVJsk4CzpoQr44ECUUvJRQ6-MUihNWzhrWHg/viewform?usp=sf_link>
to
let us know how much time and in what role you'd like to help make this
ambition into a reality.

3. The initiative seems to be well received in India and Boston, with very
insightful comments, concerns and next step suggestions. The video recap of
our meeting can be found here
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CGpW0BUUozN02ZzUIOJA4PANcyKzURb-/view?usp=sharing>
.

4. Please feel free to reach out to connect@bhav.at with any questions,
comments or concerns.

5. Please forward this email to anyone you know who would want to help us
get out into the world and work as a community to "build Bhav" for all!

Feel free to email us at connect@bhav.at with any thoughts, concerns, and
comments at any time.

Best,

Rohin Banerji
Assistant to the Directors of Bhav.AT <http://bhav.at>
On Facebook <http://facebook.com/buildBhav> and Twitter
<http://twitter.com/bildBhav> as @buildBhav




-- 
Regards,
Harshal Gajjar

content.479:
Subject: Introduction to Workshop on Entrepreneurship: Tomorrow, 20th Sep., 5.00pm, Room 23
Text: Dear all,

A talk has been arranged by resource persons from Meivia as per the
following:

*Title of talk*: Introduction to Workshop on Entrepreneurship

*Abstract*: Over the past 15 years, Meivia has executed a number of
assignments calling for intense involvement with a range of start-ups,
small and medium enterprises, and incubation centers. Meivia‚Äôs range and
depth of experience has allowed it to identify a lot of skills that are
mandatory for an entrepreneur on a start-up path. We have distilled over
150 man years of learnings and experience, and designed workshops for
budding entrepreneurs. These workshops are a combination of presentations
by Meivia, discussions and idea sharing among participants. The workshops
are designed to communicate to the participants an overview of what lies
ahead in an entrepreneurship journey. It starts with the necessity of
having empathy and passion in the area of work chosen by the entrepreneur,
the importance of defining the vision and setting up systems to communicate
the same effectively and a quick dip into the required skills and resources
that are essential for a startup to succeed. We also talk about
alternatives that can be leveraged at the starting stage to source the
missing components. The introductory talk on 20th September will walk the
participants through the contents and the takeaways from the workshop. At
the end of the talk, we will also take any questions from the students
about the workshop.

*Date, Time, Venue*: Tomorrow, 20th Sep., 5.00pm, Room 23

*Brief Bio of the speaker*:

*Shalini Elassery*
Founder & Managing Partner, Meivia
Bachelor of Computer Science, University of Poona
MBA-Kellogg-Recanati School, Joint Degree from Tel Aviv University and
Northwestern University

   - Global Entrepreneur - 26 years
   - Founding Partner, Footprint Ventures (2006)
   - Consulting CEO Roles at several client companies

*Ramesh Jujjavarapu*
Senior Consultant, Meivia
BTech, IIT Kharagpur
MBA, JNTU

   - Technologist, start-up mentor ‚Äì 30 years
   - Oil and Gas, Iron and Steel (10 years), Information Technology
   industry (20 years)
   - Independent contributor for various startup product ideas
   - Worked as CEO in an e-commerce startup

Meivia Global Services (www.meivia.com) is a sector-agnostic management
consulting firm founded in 2002 by two women entrepreneurs. We started with
work in the India-Israel corridor and have since grown to provide
consulting across various verticals: strategy, information technology,
human capital, education, India-Israel corridor, business process and
startups - the last one is very close to our hearts.

Additional info about Meivia is attached herewith.

*Students may want to derive maximum benefit out of this talk.*
Thank you,
Sincerely,
Dhiraj.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.

content.481:
Subject: Teachers' day celebration-cum-lecture- with Dr. Sonde, Executive Vice President -- Innovation & Technology, Thermax.
Text: Dear All,

You are all cordially invited to the Teacher's day celebration on Thursday,
5th September 2019.

 As part of the function,  Dr. R R Sonde, Executive Vice President --
Innovation & Technology, Thermax will deliver a lecture on the following
topics:

*a. Emerging new pathways in energy and environment and exciting
developments in clean energy and transport.*
*b. Insights on the creation of ideas and their fast-forwarding concept to
commerce.*

The details of the event are as follows:
Venue: Room No. 23
Date: 5th September 2019
Time: 2:00pm (function begins)
The lecture begins at 2: 15 pm

Hope to see you all there!

About the speaker:

Dr. Sonde joined the Thermax Management Council as Executive Vice President
- Innovation & Technology in 2007.

A Ph. D. from IIT, Mumbai, Dr. Sonde comes to Thermax after an illustrious
25-year career with the Department of Atomic Energy.

He was awarded the Dr. Homi Bhabha Gold Medal by the Prime Minister in
2006, for his outstanding contributions in the field of nuclear energy. A
Member of the Department of Science & Technology's Scientific Advisory
Committee, Dr. Sonde continues to serve as a member on the IIT Senate
Committee. Since 2004, he had been heading the R&D and Energy Technologies
Centre of NTPC.

At Thermax, Dr. Sonde is currently developing and nurturing the Research,
Technology & Innovation Center (RTIC).

-- 
R Santhosh, PhD
Assistant Professor
Department of Mechanical Engineering
Indian Institute of Technology, Dharwad
Karnataka, India 580011
email: santhoshr@iitdh.ac.in

Subject: Hon'ble Prime Minister Interaction with IT Professionals
Text: Dear Students,

Hon'ble Prime Minister is addressing technological institutions, IT
companies, and IT professionals on 24th October from JN Stadium Delhi to
link them to societal issues.
Details are here:
http://Self4Society.mygov.in
https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/technology/gadgets/narendra-modi-to-launch-app-to-rope-in-volunteers/article25242381.ece

The webcast will be held in our campus. You are all invited to attend and
listen to the address.

Time: 1600 to 1730, today, 24th October 2018
Venue: Room 23



A description of the event:

H'ble Prime Minister will interact with IT Professionals who have made
India an IT superpower. Thousands of IT Professionals will gather at
Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, on Wednesday 24th October 2018, at 4 pm.  There
will be rallies of IT Professionals simultaneously in Chennai, Bengaluru,
Hyderabad, Pune, Mumbai and other IT hubs.

The H'ble Prime Minister, in his interaction with IT Professionals will
chart out the future direction, the IT Industry in India should take and
the new opportunities available globally. The H'ble Prime Minister will
also emphasise on all round innovation and particularly in IT in India.

This sector has the potential to grow further and create millions of jobs
in India and outside. This interaction will be very important for
engineering students to view and listen. It will add to their knowledge and
help them understand the future of IT more clearly.


Regards,
Rajshekar

Hope everything is fine at your end. Science congress timeline are coming
close. Therefore this is the follow up mail.



As per my letter and circular attached, I request  to encourage research
scholar/phd/post doc students to take advantage of the scheme indicated in
the above attachment as summarized below.

to be sent to me (in the address given in my above letter), latest by *Sept
15, 2019*. Authors need to be member of science congress association, if
not they can apply.

2.      *Poster award* : Application can be sent to the General Secretary,
Science Congress (as per prescribed format in the above circular), latest
by *Sept 15, 2019*.

3.      *Young Scientist award* (below age 32 yrs) : Application can be
sent to the General Secretary, Science Congress (as per prescribed format
in the above circular), latest by *Aug 16, 2019*. Science congress
association membership is needed.

Request  to circulate in *all the dept of your Institute asap* since time
left is not much.

If anybody needs any clarification, they can be contact me in my email.



Rgds

Asit K Das

President Engineering Science

Science Congress 2020.

Congress 2020 (Engg Science Section) which will be held in Bengaluru during

participation.



With warm personal regards



Asit K Das

*Dear  Sir,*

Hope everything is fine at your end. Science congress timeline are coming
close. Therefore this is the follow up mail.



As per my letter and circular attached, I request  to encourage research
scholar/phd/post doc students to take advantage of the scheme indicated in
the above attachment as summarized below.

1.      *Oral/poster presentation* : Abstract in the prescribed format need
to be sent to me (in the address given in my above letter), latest by *Sept
15, 2019*. Authors need to be member of science congress association, if
not they can apply.

2.      *Poster award* : Application can be sent to the General Secretary,
Science Congress (as per prescribed format in the above circular), latest
by *Sept 15, 2019*.

3.      *Young Scientist award* (below age 32 yrs) : Application can be
sent to the General Secretary, Science Congress (as per prescribed format
in the above circular), latest by *Aug 16, 2019*. Science congress
association membership is needed.

Request  to circulate in *all the dept of your Institute asap* since time
left is not much.

If anybody needs any clarification, they can be contact me in my email.



Rgds

Asit K Das

President Engineering Science

Science Congress 2020.







*From:* Asit Das
*Sent:* Wednesday, May 29, 2019 6:37 PM
*To:* director@iitdh.ac.in

Dear Prof Pasumarthy,



I am happy to inform you that I have been entrusted to organize the Science
Congress 2020 (Engg Science Section) which will be held in Bengaluru during
3-7 Jan 2020. In Engg Science, we will have 2 symposium, one day each,
namely

Infrastructure

In addition to above topics, other technical papers also will be presented.

Enclosed pl find the circular and details for submission of oral /poster
papers for the Congress. Also, there are several awards to be presented in
the congress.

Request for wide circulation of the mail and attached brochure for maximum
participation.

Asit K Das

content.500:
Subject: Fwd: Six ‚Äì week Summer Internship on ‚ÄúCAD/CAM & Industrial Automation using various commercial software packages‚Äù during June 1 ‚Äì July 15, 2019
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr Rajeev Verma <vermar@nitj.ac.in>
Date: Tue, May 7, 2019 at 7:13 PM
Subject: Fwd: Six ‚Äì week Summer Internship on ‚ÄúCAD/CAM & Industrial
Automation using various commercial software packages‚Äù during June 1 ‚Äì July
15, 2019
To: <rajeev545_engg@yahoo.co.in>



Dear Sir/Madam,

Greetings from NIT Jalandhar!

It is our pleasure to inform you that the Department of Industrial &
Production Engineering, NIT Jalandhar is organizing a self-sponsored Six ‚Äì
week Summer Internship on ‚ÄúCAD/CAM & Industrial Automation using various
commercial software packages‚Äù during June 1 ‚Äì July 15, 2019.

The objective of the course is to train participants to carry out projects
based on mechanical drawing and design using the CAD / CAM & CAE software
tools. The training is aimed to achieved the following objectives:

√ò  Introduction to Engineering Drawing, Mechanical Drawing, Methods of
Projection, Isometric and Orthographic Projections, Introduction to machine
drawing and assemblies.

√ò  Introduction to Finite Element Method: Basic Steps of FEM, FEM Modelling
and applications of FEM to 1D Problems in Solid Mechanics, Fluid Mechanics
and Heat Transfer Problems.

√ò  Hands-on practice on 3-D Modelling, Simulation and Analysis packages,
such as AutoCAD, Creo Parametric 4.0, and Fusion 360.

√ò  Hands-on practice on automation and simulation packages such as
Automation Studio and MATLAB.

√ò  Hands-on practice on Production Simulation using Flex-Sim / Pro-Model



The program will comprise of lectures, demonstration sessions properly
blended with practical hands-on on the relevant modelling, simulation and
analysis tools - AutoCAD, Creo Parametric 4.0, Fusion 360, Automation
Studio, MATLAB, Flex-Sim / Pro-Model.



Please find enclosed .pdf copy of the workshop flyer. I kindly request you
to participate in this workshop and to share our invitation among your
colleagues, students & scholars. The participation is open to B-Tech,
M-Tech. and PhD students, Post-docs, faculty, and Industry personnel.
Please note that we can accommodate limited number of participants.

-- 

*Thanks & Regards.*

*Rajeev Verma, PhD*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Industrial & Production Engineering*
*Dr B R Ambedkar National Institute of Technology,*
*GT Road Amritsar Bypass, **Jalandhar, Punjab, INDIA -144011*

*Tel: 0181-2690-301-02, Extn. 2852 (O)*
*Mob. +91-9464740847*
*vermar@nitj.ac.in <vermar@nitj.ac.in>, **rajeev.pec123@gmail.com
<rajeev.pec123@gmail.com>*

content.501:
Subject: Policy regarding transfer of copyrighted material
Text: The institute members are requested to refrain from transferring
(downloading/ uploading) any copyrighted material illegally using the
institute's IT infrastructure (which includes the institute's Internet
connection). Transferring copyrighted material to or from the IITDh systems
without express consent of the owner is a violation of international law.
This includes illegally downloading academic material like text-books,
research papers, technical articles, proprietary software etc. This also
includes illegally downloading recreational content such as movies, songs
etc. Illegally transferring copyrighted material via file servers,
distributed systems such as torrents, or any other means, is strictly
prohibited.

-
IIT Dharwad CC
content.502:
Subject: Request to Sign Pledge-Cards for Awareness for World Mental Health Day/Month, October 2018
Text: Dear All,

As some of you might know, the 10th of October, 2018 was celebrated as
World Mental Health Day globally. Many countries and organizations are in
fact celebrating the Month of October as World Mental Health Month.

We, at IIT Dharwad, have received pledge-cards from our
partner-organization Yourdost to mark these celebrations, and more
importantly, to raise awareness on Mental Health.

Though we are most certainly belated in celebrating World Mental Health day
(due to unavoidable reasons), we are definitely never late in extending our
support to issues of mental health and well being.

I request you to spare some of your time in signing these pledge-cards and
pinning them on the board. We have placed them on a table near the stairs
on the ground floor of Academic building.

I look forward to your support, and reading a lot of our names on the cards.

Thank you!
Ridhima

-- 

"I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library."

Ridhima Tewari
Assistant Professor (English)
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011
Phone: +91 836 221 2843

content.506:
Subject: Network downtime on 9th March
Text: Dear All,

Certain essential services and features related to the CCS are to be set
up. For this activity, the network will have to be brought down from 10:00
AM to 4:00 PM on Saturday, 9th March.

Once the network is back up, access to the Internet will be through a
controlled proxy. Each institute member will be given an LDAP/Kerberos
credential (username and password). You will have to enter this to gain
access to the Internet. A detailed how-to document will be shared. Our
staff will also be available to ensure that the transition is smooth.

Regards,
Rajshekar
[on behalf of IITDh CCS]

content.517:
Subject: Holi celebration
Text: Hi guys

Following are rules for celebration of Holi, follow these rules so that
tomorrow's celebration can happen without any hiccups.

Playing with colours:
1. All the students must use gulal or natural colours.
2. All students are only allowed to play with colours on the football
ground.
3. No playing in the front of the campus. Not even near the 1st years
hostel or the academic block, as the Academic block will be working
tomorrow.
4. Don't enter the hostel in between, the hostels will be closed from 9 am
to 1 pm.
5. Make sure you don't create a mess with all colour packets, make sure to
throw them into dustbins and clear all the mess before leaving the ground.
6. Don't touch the walls in the hostels after playing with colours.

If there are hiccups reach out the general secys.

Hope you guys enjoy your Holi celebrations together, btw Happy Holi.

Regards

ASHRITH ADEPU
Gen. Secy Hostel Affairs

content.527:
Subject: OSS Summer of Innovation 2019
Text: Join Us for a summer of innovation, in association with
[image: DSC] <https://developers.google.com/programs/dsc/> [image: GitHub]
<https://github.com/oss2019>
[image: OSS 2019] <https://oss2019.github.io>

The holidays just got more exciting!
Join us during the course of the next 12 weeks to learn the latest
technology, play with code, tinker around, and build something cool that
could inspire. The program aims at fulfilling our earlier promise to grow
together as a community. So, whether you are a pro or a newbie learning the
ropes, we would love to see you contribute in any way possible!
Details

*When? : *Officially starts on *May 6th, 2019*
*tune in regularly for updates

* What's in it for you? :* A huge learning experience - getting familiar
with git, python, node, android and other popular things in the software
field and a great tinkering experience for the curious mechanic.
- *Swags* for all participants
- *T-shirts* to those with more than 5 PRs
- *Exciting Prizes* for the Top 3 Contributors with most number of PRs!
(Pull Requests).
*T&C apply

*Where? :* If your're Going Home - especially if you're interested in
coding - it's NOT a problem. Collaborate with us on GitHub - an online
place where we share our work together. Interested? Want to know more?
Create a Github account and join our chat room using the link below
Join SOI 2019
<https://gitter.im/oss2019/community?utm_source=share-link&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=share-link>

Project Ideas
Hardware
1
SCARA
SCARA Robots are a popular option for small robotic assembly applications.
SCARA is an acronym for Selective Compliance Articulated Robot Arm. Learn
more and see if you have what it takes to become a SCARA Pro!
View More <https://oss2019.github.io/SoI.html>
Software
2
Information Security
Who will hack their way to glory? Who will ensure all systems are secure?
Sometimes, we must first explore before we conquer. This is more of a
learning path than a project. Never forget the *#1 Rule:* Be Ethical.
View More <https://oss2019.github.io/SoI.html>
Software
3
Crispy AI
Meet Crispy, an intelligent bot that listens and summarises lectures to
deliver content that is crisp and to-the-point. Join us as we learn to use
python, Django and NLP to bring crispy to life.
View More <https://oss2019.github.io/SoI.html>
View All Ideas <https://oss2019.github.io/SoI.htm>
Like . Share . Chat . Contribute

<https://www.facebook.com/OSS-Open-Student-Society-390468168410308/> [image:

content.528:
Subject: Announcing the Bighome service
Text: Dear All,

The Bighome service is essentially similar to Dropbox. Users can now back
up their important files on their Bighome storage space. The storage server
is highly reliable (RAID level 5). Synchronization and sharing service are
also available.

You can access the Bighome facility through the web browser. The facility
is also accessible from outside the campus.

Bighome url: https://bighome.iitdh.ac.in
Credentials: Use your LDAP credentials

Please send a mail to ccsop@iitdh.ac.in for any queries or issues.

Regards,
Rajshekar

content.531:
Subject: Report of PhD Coursework seminar
Text: Dear All:
   Kindly find the attached report for the seminar scheduled tomorrow at
10:00 AM in room no. 210. The title of the seminar is "Bennett Linkages and
its Extensions".

with regards

On Mon, Jul 29, 2019 at 7:13 PM Sangamesh Deepak R <sangamesh@iitdh.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All:
>          Mr. Vishal Rajendra Naik, PhD student, Mechanical Engineering, is
> going to present a seminar titled "Bennett Linkages and its Extensions" as
> a part of PhD coursework requirement. The schedule of the seminar is as
> given below:
>
> Time: 10:00 AM
> Date: Wednesday, 31st of July, 2019
> Venue: Room No. 210
>
> Abstract:
>
> In this seminar, Bennett linkage, which is a mobile over-constrained
> spatial four bar
> mechanism, would be discussed. Further, three extensions of Bennett
> linkages
> viz (1) Single-layer layout network of Bennett linkages, (2) Multi-layer
> network of Bennett
> linkages and (3) Connection of two similar Bennett linkages would be
> explained. All three assemblies stated above have single degree of freedom.
> These assemblies can also be treated as deployable
> mechanisms. Furthermore, a report would be presented on simulation of
> Bennett linkages and its three extensions performed in multi-body dynamics
> simulation software ADAMS. To facilitate modelling in
> ADAMS, a program in MATLAB was written to get location of joints. The
> great versatility of Bennett linkage and a major role it can play in
> applications such as Six-legged Robot, Deployable Parabolic Cylindrical
> Antenna and Long-Span Shelters are discussed.
>
> All are welcome to attend
>
> with regards
>
>
>

content.537:
Subject: Movie Screening
Text: Hi everyone!

It is my pleasure to announce to you all that we will be screening a movie
in Room No. 23 on Friday, 16th February 2019! (9:30pm onwards).
The movie is titled "Through our eyes", which has been produced by Pravin
Bhagwat, now CTO of Mojo Networks. This movie will be of particular
interest for those of you who have already done/ are doing the Computer
Networks course. However, since this isn't a technical film, you are all
invited to watch the film.
Please find attached a poster, (link to the) trailer and a brief about the
movie to be screened.
I would like to thank Gayathri ma'am and Manjunath Sir for making this
opportunity possible for us. I would like to thank the Open Students
Society (OSS), who kindly agreed to reschedule their Python Programming
Workshop to Saturday on such short notice.

The trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t8cbimhb9As

And a brief:

*Through Our Eyes*

A film by Brahmanand S Siingh

A project by Pravin Bhagwat



Through Our Eyes is the story of batch-mates looking back at their journey
of 25 years after their graduation from IIT Kanpur in year 1990. The
participants in the movie talk about their memories of college years, life
experiences, triumphs, trials, achievements, regrets, aspirations and
longings.



The movie was shot over one year period through collective efforts of
batch-mates who spent formative years together on IIT Kanpur campus from
1986 to 90/91. Shooting sessions were held in Mumbai, Pune, Rajgir, Kanpur,
California, New Jersey, New York and Singapore. A filming crew travelled
across the globe to capture interviews of 70+ batch-mates spread throughout
the globe. Nuggets from those conversations have been weaved together in an
insightful, captivating, entertaining and inspirational narrative.



The movie is a celebration of life where each one of us can also be a
participant, by joining these batch-mates on a special, experiential race
of excellence and learning ... where there is no finishing line.



*Sample review*

------------------------------------------------------

                ‚ÄúI.I.T.K film....a masterpiece‚Äù

                        S. N. Ambardekar  (former Sr. Vice President, Tata
Motors)

                ------------------------------------------------------

     ‚ÄúI must congratulate you on the video "Through Our Eyes". I watched it
just this                                     evening, and watched
      it in one sitting, so engrossing did I find it.‚Äù

                   Prof. S N Banerjee  (former Professor of Mechanical
Engineering, IIT Kanpur)

                ------------------------------------------------------

     Fantastic! Touching! Soulful! A must watch.

                  Naresh Gupta (Sr. Vice President, Adobe)

               ------------------------------------------------------



Thanks and regards,

Mehul Bose

General Secretary, Cultural Affairs

IIT Dharwad

content.541:
Subject: Learning Foreign Languages
Text: Hi!

Have you ever wanted to learn a foreign language (other than English)?

I am planning to take classes for either Russian or Japanese (or both,
depending on the responses I get). There will be one session per week.

Why you should learn Japanese:

   - I suppose a lot of you watch anime. That should be motivation enough
   to learn Japanese!
   - You will be able to read manga if you learn Japanese
   - Get to learn about the culture of Japan (and not just stereotypes!)

Why you should learn Russian:

   - It is the language in which some of the world's most well known
   writers have written (Leo Tolstoy, Fyodor Dostoevsky, to name a couple),
   and a lot of the most well known literature (Anna Karenina, War and Peace
   and a lot of short stories by Leo Tolstoy, The Idiot and Crime and
   Punishment by Dostoevsky) have been written. Hence, if you are a literary
   enthusiast, Russian is the language to learn!
   - Russian is spoken in the majority of countries which were part of the
   former USSR, and in a lot of countries in Eastern Europe. You will be able
   to communicate with people from Estonia to Armenia and from Minsk to
   Vladivostok!

Why you should learn a foreign language:

   - It allows you to explore different cultures and expand your horizon;
   it can change the way you look at the world
   - It allows you to meet and interact with new people from around the
   world
   - It allows you to explore new scripts and learn new ways to say things
   - Learn a language that is not a programming language for once!

Change is never a bad thing, so why not try something different?
Click here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSffoISxYx8Q1GQD9BFWOtLHMHP8SGe7c4AZa29FC06n7V7pdw/viewform?usp=sf_link>
to
fill the form!
Hoping to see a response from everyone!
content.542:
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to E-Summit'19 | IIIT Allahabad
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: *IIITA Info Communication Incubation Centre* <iiic@iiita.ac.in>
Date: Friday, February 8, 2019
Subject: Invitation to E-Summit'19 | IIIT Allahabad
To: Dean Sw <dean.sw@iitdh.ac.in>


Greetings From Team E-Summit,

*IIITA Info Communication and Incubation Center* alias *IIIC*, a business
incubator setup under the aegis of *IIIT Allahabad* catalyzed and supported
by the *Meity*(Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology) under
the *Startup India* Project of Govt. of India. IIIC seeks to contribute,
both to the advancement of knowledge and the practice of )Innovation and
Entrepreneurship.

At IIIC we believe that entrepreneurship is the key that can unlock India's
latent inventive potential and push India to the forefront of the world. To
bring this vision a step closer for becoming reality, we are organizing the
second edition of *E-Summit* from *8th to 10th March* at IIIT
Allahabad.  E-Summit'18 experienced a footfall of 7k people with
enthusiastic vibes where we incubated 9 startups. This year, we have more
and better opportunities for everyone who turns up to the event.

E-Summit'19 has all of the below to offer you :

   - *Keynote Talks*
   - *Conclave / Panel Discussion*
   - *B-Plan Writing Competetion - Link
   <https://iiita-ac-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1ozBiE0bmrxQW43s-mWpe_OZH3fIvkUmyZm14fNUzcXU-279017393&key=YAMMID-18393481&link=https%3A%2F%2Fiiic.iiita.ac.in%2Fapply.php>
**to
   submit your B-Plan  (Prize Money worth **Rs. 50K*)
   - *Incubation Selection - **Present your Start-Up to get Incubated under
   IIIC with seedfunding upto Rs. 25 Lacs.*
   - *Pitching Session **- Pitch in front of Investors, Venture
   Capitalists, StartUp mentors to get funding, mentoring for your startup.*
   - *StartUp BootCamp cum Accelerator Program - **A series of workshop to
   get started with your startup idea, product design ,marketing etc. *
   - *B-Hacks *- A platform where student can build products according to
   real world problem statements. (Prize Money *Rs. 50K* and Goodies worth *Rs.
   1 Lac*). Link to Apply
   <https://iiita-ac-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1ozBiE0bmrxQW43s-mWpe_OZH3fIvkUmyZm14fNUzcXU-279017393&key=YAMMID-18393481&link=http%3A%2F%2Fesummit-iiita.com%2Fbhacks%2F>

Several students at your institution are trying hard to make remarkable
contributions to the startup world. We would like to invite them to share
their ideas, present their potentials and provide them with incubation
opportunities and the chance to meet several founders, investors, venture
capitalists that will enrich their knowledge and experience in the start-up
world.

content.544:
Subject: Annual Progress Seminar - 8th July 2019
Text: Dear all,

The first annual progress seminar of Ms. Tephilla Prince (PhD scholar, CSE)
is scheduled to be held on 8th July 2019.
Please find the details of seminar below.


*Title*: Automata on Infinite Inputs and Their Applications in Formal
Verification
*Venue*: Room 119
*Time*: 3pm to 4pm
*Abstract*:  Formal verification is the procedure to ensure the correctness
of a system with respect to a desired property

by checking whether a mathematical model of the system satisfies a
specification. In the automata-theoretic approach  to formal

verification, both the system and the specification are modeled by
automata.


Temporal Logics such as Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) are widely used for
specifying properties of systems.

In the context of verification of reactive system, which are
non-terminating,  automata on infinite inputs are useful.


In this talk, we take a look at automata on infinite inputs such as  B√ºchi,
Muller, Rabin and  Streett automata
and Linear Temporal Logic (LTL).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
All  are welcome.


Thanks,
Ramchandra Phawade,
Dept of CSE,
IIT Dharwad.

content.555:
Subject: The Assertiveness Test
Text: Dear All,

Hope this email finds you happy, healthy and curious to learn more.

So here's a test to learn more, and rather importantly, to learn about
yourself.
Sharing with you the 'Assertiveness Test' shared by Team *Yourdost*. Please
feel free to try it out.

*And always feel free to connect with team Yourdost in case you need an ear
to listen in, or just a friendly 'hi' to chase away the blues.*


Bests,
Ridhima

<https://yourdost.com?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=GearUpToGetAheadTest&yd_term=19>
<https://yourdost.com/assertiveness-test?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=GearUpToGetAheadTest&yd_term=19>
Do you often find yourself overloaded with work because you are too polite
to refuse when a fellow collegemate asks for your help?

How often have you been in a situation when you wanted something, but you
were afraid to ask because you didn‚Äôt want to inconvenience others?

Being unable to speak up fearing long-lasting negative consequences can
lead to stress, burnout, helplessness, and damage relationships.

People shy away from being assertive because they associate it with brash
and aggressive behaviour. However assertiveness is not about being brash,
aggressive or unpleasant.What does it mean to be assertive? Take the
self-test and find out for yourself.

It‚Äôs time to #GearUpToGetAhead

SHOW ME HOW ASSERTIVE I AM
<https://yourdost.com/assertiveness-test?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=GearUpToGetAheadTest&yd_term=19>
If you have any further doubts, concerns, queries, or simply want to say
hi, drop us a mail at campus@yourdost.com.


*Standing with You, Team YourDOST*


-- 



Ridhima Tewari
Assistant Professor (English)
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences

content.558:
Subject: Talk announcement: Nikhil Hegde, Purdue University
Text: Dear All,

We have Nikhil Hegde giving us a talk about his work next week. All are
invited to attend.

Title: "D2P: Creating Distributed Dynamic Programming Codes Automatically"


Abstract:
Dynamic Programming (DP) algorithms are common targets for parallelization,
and, as these algorithms are applied to larger inputs, distributed
implementations become necessary. However, creating distributed-memory
solutions involves the challenges of task creation, program and data
partitioning, communication optimization, and task scheduling. In this work
we present D2P, an end-to-end system for automatically transforming a
specification of any recursive DP algorithm into distributed-memory
implementation of the algorithm. When given a pseudo-code of a recursive DP
algorithm, D2P automatically generates the corresponding MPI-based
implementation. Our evaluation of the generated distributed implementations
shows that they are efficient and scalable. Moreover, D2P-generated
implementations are faster than implementations generated by recent general
distributed DP frameworks, and are competitive with (and often faster than)
hand-written implementations.

Speaker Bio:
Nikhil Hegde is a PhD candidate in the School of Electrical and Computer
Engineering at Purdue University, USA advised by Prof. Milind Kulkarni. He
obtained his master's degree from IIT Madras in 2005, and bachelor's degree
from B.M.S.College of Engineering, Bangalore in 2002, both in Computer
Science and Engineering. He is interested in the broad areas of
high-performance computing, and programming languages. Currently, his
research focuses on distributed-memory parallelism of irregular
applications.  He also has over eight years of professional experience
working in the industry developing hardware, middleware, and software.

Date: 1st March 2019 (Friday)
Time: 15:00 to 16:00
Venue: Room 119

Thank you.

Regards,
Rajshekar

content.561:
Subject: Fwd: Invite to IUPC || Online Round || January 6, 2019
Text: MD RIZWAN ANSARI
theCodingClub Secretary
IIT Dharwad.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Cybros Plinth LNMIIT <cybros.plinth19.11@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, Jan 9, 2019, 19:42
Subject: Invite to IUPC || Online Round || January 6, 2019
To: <160010015@iitdh.ac.in>


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please forward this mail to your college groups.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi

Greetings from LNMIIT!

We are delighted to invite you to the Inter-University Programming Contest
organised by The LNM Institute of Information Technology ‚Äì Jaipur, during
the two-day Techno-Management-Literary Fest Plinth'19  to be held on
19th‚Äì20th January 2018.

The contest shall be a great opportunity for students to whet their
programming aptitude. This national level programming contest shall assess
their intelligence through various rounds:  the first round will be held
online on 6th January 2019 and further onsite rounds will be held during
Plinth'19 (19th‚Äì20th January 2019).


The key details of IUPC'19 are as follows:

    1. The first online round of the contest will be held on 6th January
2019 (Sunday) 9 PM onwards.

    2. Contest duration will be 5 hours.

    3. Team with a maximum of  3 members is allowed.

    4. All the members must be from the same institute.

    5. The contest will be held on www.codechef.com
<https://cybros-plinth19-11-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1nGrP2urNaz6sNpa9s3VUfdZIK2SioZRQk2YTJrkIC8I-0&key=YAMMID-43145744&link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.codechef.com%2F>

    6. Registration closes 2 hrs before the start of the contest.

    7. Plagiarism by any means will lead to immediate disqualification of
the team.

Registration Link: https://www.plinth.in/competitions/coding/iupc
<https://cybros-plinth19-11-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1nGrP2urNaz6sNpa9s3VUfdZIK2SioZRQk2YTJrkIC8I-0&key=YAMMID-43145744&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plinth.in%2Fcompetitions%2Fcoding%2Fiupc>

P. S. - Choose Pay Later while registering.

Contest Link: https://www.codechef.com/PILT2019
<https://cybros-plinth19-11-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1nGrP2urNaz6sNpa9s3VUfdZIK2SioZRQk2YTJrkIC8I-0&key=YAMMID-43145744&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.codechef.com%2FPILT2019>

250 laddus to the top 3 teams in the online round!!!

Prizes of INR 20,000/- (and more) up for grabs!!

We take pleasure in inviting your esteemed institution to participate and
be a part of this much-awaited contest.

For further details, feel free to contact us at or visit
https://www.plinth.in/
<https://cybros-plinth19-11-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1nGrP2urNaz6sNpa9s3VUfdZIK2SioZRQk2YTJrkIC8I-0&key=YAMMID-43145744&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plinth.in%2F>

We are looking forward to participation from your institute.

See you at the contest arena.

Attached below is the poster for IUPC.

Good Luck!

Cheers,

Plinth Organising Team.



To unsubscribe, click here
<https://cybros-plinth19-11-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1nGrP2urNaz6sNpa9s3VUfdZIK2SioZRQk2YTJrkIC8I-0&key=YAMMID-43145744&link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.plinth.in%2F>
.

content.562:
Subject: OSS SoI '19 Hardware Project Reimbursement
Text:  Hey all,
Thank you for participating in the SoI '19. Those who worked on Hardware
projects selected for the SoI '19 and purchased any equipment/material are
requested to submit the bills before *August 4, 2019, 11:59 pm*. Both the
soft copy and hard copy have to be submitted. The mentors should take the
responsibility to submit all the bills related to the project in a single
zip file along with an excel file containing the list of items purchased
and final list of students who have worked on the project. Some of the
hardware projects would be showcased to the Freshers also so be ready with
your projects.
Revert back to me in case of any queries.

*Note*: The bills should be clearly visible and should be dated between May
1, 2019, to July 28, 2019.

Regards,

Sonu Sourav
OSS Team
+91 9916228725

content.574:
Subject: Invitation to Join Us at DevHack 2019
Text: Hello all,

It gives me great pleasure to invite you all to participate in our
college‚Äôs first 30-hour hackathon, DevHack 2019, sponsored by GitHub. The
event will begin at 21:00 hrs on 11th January 2019 and close by 18:00 hrs
on 13th January 2019.

Problem statements, provided on the day of the event, will be in the broad
disciplines of hardware and software engineering and themed on a wide range
of real-life problems from simple college hacks to large-scale start-up
ideas. We strongly encourage participation from *all branches, research
scholars and TAs.*

We will provide refreshments during the hackathon and organize workshops,
provide resources and ensure our mentors are around to help you learn. All
we need is your enthusiasm to participate.

So, pull up your socks and sign up here <http://bit.do/iitdhdevhack> to
stand a chance to win Goodies, T-shirts and more!

*Note**: For further details click on the registration link. Also, we will
strictly close registrations by Wednesday midnight or when we reach our
maximum team limit(whichever happens first).*

Registration Link : bit.do/iitdhdevhack
Yours sincerely,
Arpit Agrawal
DevHack Team

*Chevening Fellowships and Scholarships*

*India programme *

Chevening is the UK government‚Äôs flagship global award scheme. Chevening in
India awards scholarships and fellowships to future leaders, influencers,
and decision-makers to develop professionally and academically, network
extensively, experience UK culture and build lasting positive relationships
with the UK.

India runs the largest Chevening programme in the world. Each year we send up
to 110 scholars & fellows to the UK for various programmes.

*Scholarship **for a one year Master‚Äôs degree*
A Chevening Scholarship offers financial support along with the opportunity
to become part of the highly regarded and influential Chevening global
network. We encourage outstanding graduates with at least two years‚Äô work
experience to pursue a one-year Master‚Äôs degree at any recognised
university in the UK, in a subject of their choice.

*Application dates: 5 August - 5 November 2019*
*Academic Year: 2020-21*

*10 Week Programme begins in March 2020 *Apply online from 5 August till 9
October 2019

[image: cid:image003.jpg@01D32578.D31F1850]

is aimed at mid-career professionals with high potential in the fields of
science, innovation, business & policy in India and Sri Lanka

*University of Oxford, UK*

*10 Week Programme begins in April 2020*
Apply online from 5 August till 9 October 2019



[image: cid:image004.jpg@01D32578.D31F1850]

opportunity to explore the range of approaches taken by the UK and the

content.585:
Subject: Invited talk on 8th Feb. on Optical signaling for backplanes in network racks
Text: Dear Colleagues and students,

We will have an invited talk by Shri Krishnan Rengarajan from Cypress
Semiconductors, on 8th February 2019. Students are encouraged to attend the
same.

Title: Optical signaling for backplanes in network racks

Venue : Room No. 119
Date and Time : 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM on 8th Feb. 2019

Abstract
-----------
Optical signaling has become ubiquitous today and has become the backbone
of communication. The merits of high bandwidth and low loss over long
distances has made optics the choice for long distance signaling. Optics
has now made its advent for rack to rack and even intra rack connectivity
in Datacenters, which are the hub of network activity consisting of 10s of
1000s of compute nodes. However, there is still throughput bottleneck
encountered due to speed limitation of electrical signaling in the
backplanes of network racks. This talk will discuss the possibities to
bring optics to shorter distance contexts.

Speaker Bio:
Krishnan Rengarajan is an Analog Mixed Signal Circuit Design Engineer with
experience
spanning several areas including High Speed Serial Links, Discrete volatile
and non-volatile memories, Compiler SRAMs/CAMs for ASICs, DRAM chips,
OTP/MTP/eFuse memories, 622Mbps Clock recovery IP, and Clock generation
chips,Designs using FPGAs for HDTV system, MCMs for printer control and
System design for printers. Prior jobs at IBM, Edison (Elpida India design
center), Texas Instruments, Cypress, IITM, DCM Microelectronics ‚Äì Built
teams and delivered on several products/IP through production. Held Project
and Technical Lead positions as well as Senior Management responsibilities
in a career span of 28 years.  He has 26 granted and 5 pending patents, 6
patent IP publications, 22 company internal and external conference
presentations/publications. He has held senior technical positions at
various companies including MGTS at TI, Director at Edison, STSM at IBM,
DMTS at GF. Recently he joined Cypress as Sr.MTS. He is an IEEE Senior
Member. His research areas include  Low Power High Performance Circuits,
Accurate AMS modeling methodology, Short reach Optical signal processing.
He got his Bachelors in Electrical & Electronics in 1989 and Masters in
Microelectronics,1991, both from BITS Pilani,India.

--
Regards,
Naveen Kadayinti

content.602:
Subject: Workshop on Parallel Computing with GPU's
Text: Hi people,
I hope you are doing great and enjoying your vacations.
I just wanted to get a little heads-up on who all would be interested to
engage in a workshop on Parallel Computing .
We would be learning about GPU's and how do we program them in
general.Dhiraj Sir would be guiding us through it.
People who are interested, should send me their names, by replying to this
same mail.
Please do research about the same and only then, give your names and not
just because everyone is doing so.

Thanks.
Happy Remaining Holidays :)

Samveed Desai.

content.612:
Subject: Fwd: Invitation- Techtatva'18
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Outstation Tech Tatva [MAHE-MIT] <outstation.techtatva@manipal.edu>
Date: Wed, Sep 19, 2018 at 7:24 PM
Subject: Invitation- Techtatva'18
To:


Sir/Ma‚Äôam,


Greetings from Manipal Institute of Technology!

TechTatva is the annual technical fest of MIT,Manipal. This year, we recall
our glorious past by learning what history has taught us ‚Äî adapting to
changing circumstances, creating solutions for yesterday's problems, and
innovating for the future generations. With projects and events keeping
this in mind, we present to you* TechTatva'18: Reminiscing Greatness*

*With prizes upto Rs. 10 Lakhs to be won*, we promise thrilling
competitions, scrumptious food and everything a participant will be
expecting from the 'Manipal Experience' and more. There can be no better
place for all the budding entrepreneurs from your esteemed institute to
test the mettle of their plans to take the corporate world by storm but not
before they battle it out against the best.

This year we have organized a myriad of diverse events. These include:



*Featured Events*

   1. Make Your Robot Tick!
   2. National Science & Engineering Exhibition
   3. Robowars
   4. Fuel RC
   5. Paper Presentation
   6. Overclocked
   7. Drone Racing League
   8. Bizzventure
   9. Vedanth 8.0
   10. The Manipal Conclave

*Categories*

   1. Airborne
   2. Energia
   3. Cheminova
   4. Kraftwagen
   5. Mechatron
   6. Constructure
   7. Robotrek
   8. Mechanize
   9. Turing
   10. Questionable Intelligence
   11. Epsilon
   12. Acumen
   13. Gaming
   14. Cryptoss
   15. Electrific
   16. Cosmic-Con
   17. Chrysalis
   18. Bizzmaestro
   19. Alacrity

*Please find attached our Invitation Letter for additional details.*



For any further information visit *https://techtatva.in
<https://techtatva.in>*
Feel free to contact us at outstaion.techtatva@manipal.edu



Regards,

TechTatva,18.
Outstation Management Team.

content.614:
Subject: Reminder: Announcement of Astronomy Night (April 4, 2018; 9:00PM onwards)
Text: Dear All,

This is a gentle reminder for today's Astronomy Night from 9:00PM onwards.

Thanking you.

Yours truly,
R. Prabhu



On Mon, Apr 2, 2018 at 2:27 PM, Dr. R. Prabhu <prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> We are pleased to announce the event - "Astronomy Night" - as per
> following details:
>
> *Date and time: *April 4, 2018 (Wednesday) at 9:00 PM onwards.
>
> *Venue: *Terrace of the Academic building (Terrace above the Physics Lab)
>
> *Program: *
> 1) Concept of Celestial Sphere, Right Ascension, Declination will be
> explained.
>
> 2) Equatorial Mount for our Telescope will be demonstrated.
>
>  3) Attempt will be made to focus on the Jupiter  (rising around 9 PM !!
> and very close to the Moon)
>       or Aldebaran (Rohini) setting around 10 PM !
>       Betelgeuse - Sirius are other possible targets
>
> Those who are interest to join the program, please write a reply email
> only to me and Professor Narasimha (prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in, d.nar
> asimha@iitdh.ac.in).
>
> Thanking you.
>
> Yours truly,
> R. Prabhu

content.625:
Subject: Requesting your cooperation about power management
Text: Dear All,

As you are aware, there have been incessant rains and quite inclement
weather.  Because of this, all our power supply lines (especially fuses)
have gotten affected seriously.



Yesterday, we had a crisis-like situation. Thanks to the efforts of our
institute team, we could get water pumped to the overhead tank. We could
get the power supply line to all the hostels behind, street lights and
Bhoopali mess from HESCOM restored with extreme difficulty.



Still, we are not able to get the power supply from HESCOM to Keeravani and
academic building.  We are trying various technical avenues to fix this
issue.  We are in continuous touch with the HESCOM team who is working
continually for us.  Our team also is working on this issue to get the
HESCOM power restored by today evening.



In case, if we cannot get the power restored from HESCOM, we are going to
manage bare essentials (water supply, cooking of food in the mess and hot
water bath) with the generators on.  Diesel is available in premium as
Hubli and Dharwad are cut off from Mumbai.  Hence, diesel generators would
be kept on only for two hours in the morning (5 AM ‚Äì 7.00 AM) and two hours
in the evening (4 PM ‚Äì 6 PM) for next three days (10th August to 12th
August 2019) for mess connections only.



I hope, as to-be-engineers, you will appreciate (understand) the situation
and use all essential items (water and electricity) in a frugal manner.   We
solicit your wholehearted cooperation so that we can wade through this
situation.


Yours sincerely,

Prabhu

Subject: Fwd: Inviting applications for Indo-Swiss BEEP Camp 2019: Student training on building energy efficiency to be held at CEPT University, Ahmedabad from December 15th-22nd 2019
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Saswati Chetia <pmtu@beepindia.org>
Date: Tue, Jul 16, 2019, 16:41
Subject: Inviting applications for Indo-Swiss BEEP Camp 2019: Student
training on building energy efficiency to be held at CEPT University,
Ahmedabad from December 15th-22nd 2019
To: Pro <pro@iitdh.ac.in>, Nageshiyer <nageshiyer@iitdh.ac.in>


Dear Sir/ Madam,

We are glad to inform you about *the 2nd Indo-Swiss Building Energy
Efficiency Camp (BEEP Camp) being organized at CEPT University, Ahmedabad
this year from December 15 - 22, 2019*. It is jointly organized by BEEP and
CEPT University, Ahmedabad for students and young professionals.

BEEP Camp is an intensive training, designed to enable learning in the
domain of building energy efficiency and the integrated design process. The
Camp will reinforce the fundamentals of building energy efficiency,
building physics, building envelop characteristics, thermal comfort, HVAC
Systems, daylighting and building performance indicators. Participants are
expected to learn from expert lecture sessions, tutorials, group exercises
and field visits. The faculty pool consists of technical experts and soft
skill trainers from India and Switzerland. *Please visit the BEEP Camp 2019
Facebook event page http://bit.ly/BEEPCamp2019
<https://beepindia-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1Nd0I1ldZWaH4qva0MZflGK_fwEY5l7lNCMPCbKMmmD4-0&key=YAMMID-75498363&link=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FBEEPCamp2019>
and the BEEP website (www.beepindia.org
<https://beepindia-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1Nd0I1ldZWaH4qva0MZflGK_fwEY5l7lNCMPCbKMmmD4-0&key=YAMMID-75498363&link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.beepindia.org>)
for more details of this year's camp and information of last year's camp.*

Attached is a copy of the poster. Please spread the word amongst the
students and other relevant people. A copy of the poster has also been sent
to your postal address foe display on your notice board. Students can apply
online at *http://bit.ly/BEEPCampApplication
<https://beepindia-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1Nd0I1ldZWaH4qva0MZflGK_fwEY5l7lNCMPCbKMmmD4-0&key=YAMMID-75498363&link=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FBEEPCampApplication>*.
Those without a google account can download the form from
*https://files.secureserver.net/0swPjCe4JoBt5m
<https://beepindia-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1Nd0I1ldZWaH4qva0MZflGK_fwEY5l7lNCMPCbKMmmD4-0&key=YAMMID-75498363&link=https%3A%2F%2Ffiles.secureserver.net%2F0swPjCe4JoBt5m>*
and email the completed form to *pmtu@beepindia.org <pmtu@beepindia.org>.*

In case of more information, kindly contact Ms. Vasudha Sunger (BEEP) or
Ms. Asha Joshi (CEPT) (contact details mentioned on the poster).

-- 
Warm Regards,
Saswati Chetia

Senior Programme Officer | Indo-Swiss Building Energy Efficiency Programme
(BEEP)
Mb. +91 9873780298| Telefax +91 11 45535574
*www.beepindia.org
<https://beepindia-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/Redirect?ukey=1Nd0I1ldZWaH4qva0MZflGK_fwEY5l7lNCMPCbKMmmD4-0&key=YAMMID-75498363&link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.beepindia.org%2F>*

  |

Subject: Inter Branch Cultural General Championship
Text: Hi everyone!

It gives me immense pleasure in announcing the first edition of the Inter
Branch Cultural General Championship! This Championship will span the
duration of the academic year (from August to April), consisting of
multiple events across the various cultural activities from Music to Dance
and from Literature to Quiz and the branch which is able to accumulate the
most number of points over the course of the year will be crowned as the
Champions.

The points system for the General Championship will work as follows:
Winning Branch : 10 points
1st Runner Up: 5 points
2nd Runner Up: 2 points

The events will be announced soon. I hope to see maximum participation in
these events.

Thanks and Regards,
Mehul Bose
General Secretary, Cultural Affairs
IIT Dharwad

content.642:
Subject: Re: Talk by Stephan Simonis (PhD Scholar, KIT Germany) on Thursday, 1st August
Text: Room No. 115

On Thu, Aug 1, 2019, 12:07 PM Dhiraj Patil <dhiraj@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:

> A gentle reminder of today's talk...
>
>
> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
> Assistant Professor (Homepage
> <https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
> Department of Mechanical Engineering,
> Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
> Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.
> O: 8362212829
>
>
> On Mon, Jul 29, 2019 at 10:00 AM Dhiraj Patil <dhiraj@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear all,
>>
>> Mr. Stephan Simonis (Ph.D. research scholar, Karlsruhe Institute of
>> Technology, Germany)
>> will deliver a talk on Thursday, 1st August 2019 at 2.30 pm. The details
>> are as follows,
>>
>> Title: Direct Numerical Simulation of Decaying Homogeneous Isotropic
>> Turbulence with Lattice Boltzmann Methods
>>
>> Abstract:
>> Despite the multiple uses of lattice Boltzmann methods (LBM) as an
>> alternative approach to computational fluid dynamics (CFD), especially
>> turbulent flow simulations with LBM require further validation and
>> important developments of established Navier-Stokes solvers have to be
>> caught up. Regardless of the academic character of benchmark tests on
>> highly simplified homogeneous isotropic turbulence (HIT), fundamental
>> statements can be made about the numerical method itself and the
>> development of turbulence models. In the presented work, stability,
>> consistency, and accuracy of commonly used lattice Boltzmann schemes are
>> investigated by means of numerical experiments on direct numerical
>> simulation (DNS) of decaying homogeneous isotropic turbulence (DHIT). As a
>> paragon for Kolmogorov's theory on HIT, the Taylor-Green vortex is chosen
>> as a benchmark problem and numerical solutions are evaluated in terms of
>> global turbulence quantities. Intermediate Reynolds numbers and
>> two-parameter scalings are used to investigate mesh-convergence of the LBM.
>> The results give insight into essential differences of the distinct
>> collision schemes and enable further recommendations on parameter choices.
>>
>> Biography:
>> Stephan Simonis is a Ph.D. student at the Institute for Applied and
>> Numerical Mathematics at Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), Germany.
>> He obtained his master's and bachelor's degree at KIT, both in Mathematics,
>> and spend a funded exchange year (ERS+) at the Royal Institute of

content.644:
Subject: Talk by Stephan Simonis (PhD Scholar, KIT Germany) on Thursday, 1st August
Text: Dear all,

Mr. Stephan Simonis (Ph.D. research scholar, Karlsruhe Institute of
Technology, Germany)
will deliver a talk on Thursday, 1st August 2019 at 2.30 pm. The details
are as follows,

Title: Direct Numerical Simulation of Decaying Homogeneous Isotropic
Turbulence with Lattice Boltzmann Methods

Abstract:
Despite the multiple uses of lattice Boltzmann methods (LBM) as an
alternative approach to computational fluid dynamics (CFD), especially
turbulent flow simulations with LBM require further validation and
important developments of established Navier-Stokes solvers have to be
caught up. Regardless of the academic character of benchmark tests on
highly simplified homogeneous isotropic turbulence (HIT), fundamental
statements can be made about the numerical method itself and the
development of turbulence models. In the presented work, stability,
consistency, and accuracy of commonly used lattice Boltzmann schemes are
investigated by means of numerical experiments on direct numerical
simulation (DNS) of decaying homogeneous isotropic turbulence (DHIT). As a
paragon for Kolmogorov's theory on HIT, the Taylor-Green vortex is chosen
as a benchmark problem and numerical solutions are evaluated in terms of
global turbulence quantities. Intermediate Reynolds numbers and
two-parameter scalings are used to investigate mesh-convergence of the LBM.
The results give insight into essential differences of the distinct
collision schemes and enable further recommendations on parameter choices.

Biography:
Stephan Simonis is a Ph.D. student at the Institute for Applied and
Numerical Mathematics at Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), Germany.
He obtained his master's and bachelor's degree at KIT, both in Mathematics,
and spend a funded exchange year (ERS+) at the Royal Institute of
Technology (KTH) in Stockholm, Sweden. Currently, his research focuses on
discrete velocity models, relaxation systems and lattice Boltzmann methods
for partial differential equations. As a part of the interdisciplinary
Lattice Boltzmann Research Group headed by Dr. Mathias J. Krause, he
contributes to their open-source framework OpenLB (www.openlb.net) which
addresses a vast range of transport problems (e.g. in CFD) with LBM and
allows for fast implementation in both, academic testing and advanced
engineering applications.

All are welcome.

Thank you,

Yours sincerely,
Dhiraj.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.
O: 8362212829

Subject: Ganeshotsav Rangoli Competition
Text: Hi everyone!

Ganesh Chaturthi is around the corner and on this auspicious occasion Fine
Arts Club and the organizing committee of Ganesh Utsav are collaborating to
bring to you the event "Ganeshotsav Rangoli Competition". FIll this form
<https://forms.gle/CeHRP1MqkxwW1yBWA> to register.

Things to be considered-

   - You have to form a team of 3-4 members.
   - The plan is each team will be allotted one day out of the 6 days. Lord
   Ganesha will be with us for 7 days out of which 6 days are allocated to the
   competition and for the final day (Visarjan) all the students are cordially
   invited the night before (9:00 pm 7th September 2019) to contribute to the
   rangoli.
   - Teams will be required to report between 9:00 p.m. and 11:59 p.m. on
   the day allotted and the rangoli should be completed by 6:00 a.m. the next
   morning.
   - Rangoli should be relevant to Lord Ganesha. You are free to come up
   with innovative ideas and experiment with the rangoli.
   - Rangoli colours will be provided by the committee.


*N.B. There are prizes for the winning and runner up teams.*

Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings!!!

Coimbatore Institute of Technology, Coimbatore is recognized as Teaching
Learning Centre under PMMMNMTT, Dept. of Higher Education, MHRD, GoI.

The objective of the Teaching Learning Centre is to raise the quality of
Teaching through training, retraining, refresher and orientation programmes
in the disciplines of Academic, Research, and Management (ARM).

As a part of its objective, TLC is organizing a workshop on *"Solving
Multiobjective Optimization Problems Using Deterministic & Stochastic
Algorithms ‚Äì  Hands-on Approach Using MATLAB Optimization Toolbox" *in
association with *MathWorks India Pvt. Ltd., Bangalore*.

This is a High Intensive programme for deterministic and stochastic
optimization techniques & its applications in Engineering with Hands-on
approach to solve various case studies with the aid of MATLAB optimization
toolbox.

The workshop is planned for (not limited to) faculty members and research
scholars of Electrical, Electronics & Computer Science Engineering streams
who are working in the areas of

optimization techniques.

Date: *13 to 19 July, 2019*

Venue: Coimbatore Institute of Technology, Coimbatore

¬∑         Experts from MathWorks India, Private Limited

Guru Nanak Khalsa College, Mumbai

¬∑         Dr. K. Ramakrishnan, Pondicherry Engineering College, Pondicherry

¬∑         Dr. M. Arounassalame, Pondicherry Engineering College, Pondicherry

*Workshop Topics:*

¬∑         MATLAB Optimization Toolbox

¬∑         Genetic Algorithm

¬∑         Particle Swarm Optimization

¬∑         Differential Evolutionary Algorithm

¬∑         Convex Optimization with LMI constraint

¬∑         Global Optimization with Bernstein Polynomial

content.667:
Subject: Talk by Dr. Harshavardhan Urankar
Text: Dear all,

All are cordially invited to attend the following talk.

*Title*:  A flame particle tracking analysis of turbulence-chemistry
interaction in turbulent premixed flames.

*Speaker*: Dr. Harshavardhana Urankar, Lead Research Engineer, Siemens CT
Research India.

*Room No*.: 203
*Date*: November 09, 2018 (Friday)
*Time*: 11.45am - 12.45pm

*Abstract*:
Understanding of turbulence-chemistry interaction is crucial for
development of next generation, ultra low emission, gas turbines and
internal combustion engines, and their efficient operation. Interactions of
turbulence, molecular transport, and energy transport, coupled with
chemistry play a crucial role in the evolution of flame surface geometry,
propagation, annihilation, and local extinction/reignition characteristics
of intensely turbulent premixed flames.

The present study seeks to understand how these interactions affect flame
surface annihilation of lean hydrogen‚Äìair premixed turbulent flames. Direct
numerical simulations (DNS) are conducted at different parametric
conditions with a detailed reaction mechanism and transport properties for
hydrogen‚Äìair flames. Flame particle tracking (FPT) technique is used to
follow specific flame surface segments. An analytical expression for the
local flame displacement speed (*S*d) of an isotherm is considered, and the
contributions of transport, chemistry, and kinematics on the flame
displacement speed at different turbulence flame interaction conditions are
identified. In general, the flame displacement speed for the flame
particles is found to increase with time for all conditions considered.
This is because, eventually all flame surfaces and their resident flame
particles approach annihilation by reactant island formation at the end of
stretching and folding processes induced by turbulence. Statistics of
principal curvature evolving in time, obtained using FPT, suggest that
these islands are ellipsoidal on average enclosing fresh reactants. Further
examinations show that the increase in *S*d is caused by the increased
negative curvature of the flame surface and eventual homogenization of
temperature gradients as these reactant islands shrink due to flame
propagation and turbulent mixing. Finally, the evolution of the normalized,
averaged, flame displacement speed vs. stretch Karlovitz number are found
to collapse on a narrow band, suggesting that a unified description of
flame speed dependence on stretch rate may be possible in the Lagrangian
description.


*Bio*:
Dr. Harshavardhana Urankar earned his PhD in Aerospace Engineering from
Indian Institute of Science Bengaluru, specializing on turbulent reactive
flows and numerical methods. Presently, he works at Siemens CT Research
India as  Lead Research Engineer, where he carry out research for the
design and development of ultra low emission, industrial gas turbine
combustors using Computational Fluid Dynamics. His research interests
include: Direct Numerical Simulations and Large Eddy Simulations of
turbulent and reactive flows, thermoacoustic instability, numerical
methods.

*Participation from 2nd and 3rd year ME students is highly encouraged.*

Thank you,
Sincerely,
-----
Dr. Shrikanth V.
Assistant Professor
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology,
Dharwad - 580011
Email: vshrikanth@iidh.ac.in <vicchha86@gmail.com>

Shunmugaraj

IIT Kanpur


---------------------------- Original Message ----------------------------
From:    "Academics and Research Cell, IIT Kanpur" <arc_sg@iitk.ac.in>
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear Sir/Madam,

The Academics and Research Cell (ARC), IIT Kanpur is organizing the very
first *Students‚Äô Research Convention (SRC)*, a 2-day-long multidisciplinary
research conference in the month of March. The Convention aims to create a
platform for young researchers to meet and exchange ideas.

The SRC 2019 will be the first of its kind and will bring together the best
of college students from all around the world to engage in talks,
presentations, workshops, and eye-opening discussions in the fields of
science. The convention will be held from *March 30 to March 31 *at IIT
Kanpur. Over the course of the convention, the participants will acquire
knowledge of various aspects of research that would benefit them with their
own research.

The cell is currently inviting students to participate in the convention
and are accepting abstracts for the same. We are looking for students that
have both a drive and a passion for science and research. The submission
deadline is *20th February 2019* .

For the same, ARC IIT Kanpur would be grateful if you may help us in
reaching out to students of your institute. I hope you could help us with
this by sharing our message among your students. We would like to provide
as many students with the opportunity to come to the convention, and your
support will really help us with it.

*Attached is a copy of the flyer for the convention along with a detailed
information about the event.*

content.677:
Subject: Some notes regarding 2019 elections
Text: Hi guys

Regarding the posters, contestants have to hand them over to the election
council who will then put them up. You can mail the poster to all students
if you want. Make sure there is nothing negative in the poster. The
Election council has the right to remove your poster if something negative
found on it about the previous secy or other contestants.

Manifestos of contestants, sorry that I will not be able to share any
templates. Your manifesto should only contain positive remarks or promises
you want to make. No criticism of the previous secy or other contestants
are allowed in the manifesto.

The Election council will collect the photos and manifestos of the
contestants to put it in the election app. So make sure you have a short
version of your manifesto as well as a photo ready in time. Manifestos and
the photo will be collected before 18th March.

Those students who are contesting for more than one post, you cannot do
that. I am extending the deadline just let me know which post you want to
contest for over mail, you will only be contesting for that post. Do this
before 9 am on (16/3/19)

List of contestants will be released tomorrow.

The members of the Election Council has been shared in another earlier this
week.

If anyone wants to withdraw from the post you were contesting for you can
do it before 20th March.

Regards

ASHRITH ADEPU
Gen. Secy Hostel Affairs

content.679:
Subject: Fwd: Summer Entrepreneurship Program @IIEC IIT Gandhinagar; May-June 2019
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IITGN, INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP CENTER <iiec@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Sat, 13 Apr 2019 at 4:35 PM
Subject: Summer Entrepreneurship Program @IIEC IIT Gandhinagar; May-June
2019
To:


Hi all

Are you looking for an idea to take up entrepreneurship?

or

Have an Idea and want to do market validation and costumer discovery?

or

Understand what it takes to pursue entrepreneurship?

*IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center (IIEC) is happy to
announce Summer Entrepreneurship Program during May-June 2019.*

The program will provide an opportunity to selected participants to work at
IIEC to experiment with their ideas and convert them to proof of concept
level. They will work for 2 months during May-June 2019 under guidance of
reputed mentors and industry experts. The program will start in the first
week of May.

What Participants will get:

   - *Free seat in co-working space with air conditioning, wifi*
   - *Free accommodation at IITGN Housing on sharing basis (participants
   have to pay for the food and other incidental expenses).*
   - *Product development funds worth maximum of upto Rs. 15,000/- per team
   during the program (on actual basis, subject to approval)*
   - *Access to tinkerer‚Äôs lab, library, labs*
   - *Mentoring*

*Registration is open till April 16, 2019 (Limited seats available)*.

Please register at https://forms.gle/SLe7nzEcwJ6bHiJD6. Applicant can be
individual or a team of maximum 3 persons (In case of team all the
applicants will have to apply individually and have to mention team detail
at relevant section on the form). This program is ideal for early stage
startups and students interested to pursue entrepreneurship.

We request you to forward the information to those who may be interested to
attend the program. Please feel free to contact us if you need any further
clarification.

Best regards,
Anand
http://www.iieciitgn.com/
-- 
=============================

leading industry and investment experts. Prizes are up for grabs during

content.698:
Subject: Invited talk on 9th April on Design of III-V Silicon Photonic Crystal Laser
Text: Dear Colleagues and students,

We will have an invited talk by Shri Niket Joshi, the details of which are
give below. Students are encouraged to attend the same.

Title: "Design of III-V Silicon Photonic Crystal Laser"
Date & Time: 3:30 PM on 9th April 2019.
Venue : Room No. 119

Abstract: This talk will be about design and FDTD (Finite Difference Time
Domain) simulation of the operation of a Photonic Crystal Laser. A detailed
study of Maxwell's equations was needed to even do this thesis of III-V
Silicon photonic crystal laser. It was based on the localized InP growth
technology developed in IMEC, Belgium. The photonic crystal laser in III-V
materials is to be
monolithically integrated on Silicon. The speciality of this Photonic
Crystal Laser is that it is able to emit at a wavelength of 1.55 micrometer
(~192 THz).

Speaker Bio: Niket Joshi did his B.Tech from National Institute of
Technology Karnataka,
Surathkal, Mangalore, India in Electrical Engineering. He did his M.S
jointly from Universiteit Gent (Ghent University), Belgium and Vrije
Universiteit Brussel, Belgium with specialization in Photonics. He has
worked experience as Design Engineer at Sankalp Semiconductors, Research
scientist at SAMEER IITB Campus, Project Assistant at IISc, Lab enginner at
IIT Roorkee.

--
Regards,
Naveen Kadayinti

content.703:
Subject: Talk by Dr. S. Vanka on 11th October
Text: Dear Colleagues and Students

We have a visitor, Dr. Sundaram Vanka, to the institute on 11th October. He
will be giving a talk on 11th October from 1400 to 1500 Hrs. The details of
the talk are as follows.

Title : Interference Management in Emerging Wireless Networks and Systems

Abstract: An important source of complexity in emerging wireless networks
is the increasingly diverse set of wireless devices and their applications.
Interference management is a key challenge in the design and operation of
such networks, and forms the overall theme that connects the speaker‚Äôs work
in diverse settings. This talk provides a brief overview of some aspects of
this work and is organized as follows. Part one situates his work in the
overall context of interference management and provides a bird‚Äôs eye view
of his work both in academia and in industry. Parts two and three will
discuss selected topics from his work in industry and as an academic
researcher, respectively. The talk concludes with some thoughts on the
challenges posed by the increased device heterogeneity expected in future
wireless networks.

The talk will touch upon the speaker‚Äôs contributions to three challenging
problems in wireless LAN (WLAN, commonly called ‚ÄúWi-Fi‚Äù) system design that
form some of the core technology in flagship wireless LAN SoC products. The
first two topics pertain to some of his work at  Broadcom on the general
problem of wireless coexistence, where devices with very different
communication requirements and constraints share a common spectrum. The
roles of interference avoidance, mitigation and adaptation are discussed in
the context of specific examples. It is pointed out how a holistic
perspective on the system-level impact of interference is necessary for
significantly improved coexistence. The third topic is selected to present
some of his work at Redpine Signals, Inc., that concerns the design of
low-complexity soft-output MIMO demodulators. It is shown how reasonably
accurate Likelihood-Ratios (LLRs) can be obtained without the need for
matrix inversion when the number of spatial streams is small, a scenario of
practical interest.

As part of his doctoral research, the speaker has worked on multiple
theoretical and experimental topics. One representative topic from each
methodology will be presented here. The experimental work will discuss the
development of the first known prototype of a superposition coded wireless
system that was implemented on a software radio platform. In addition to
systematically developing experimentally robust analogs and methodologies
to theoretical constructs (such as the information-theoretic rate region),
this line of work also investigates some approaches that can leverage
superposition coding in practice. The theoretical topic will discuss his
work on deriving asymptotic scaling laws for the convergence behavior for a
class of distributed signal processing algorithms called average consensus
algorithms when message exchange between network nodes occurs over an
interference-limited wireless network. By combining the mathematical tools
from Markov chain theory, geometric random graph theory and information
theory, this line of work was the first to establish convergence results on
this algorithm in the presence of interference. In particular, it
challenges the long-held view that increased communication range always
improves the rate of convergence to consensus.

The talk ends with some thoughts on the emergence of device heterogeneity,
and some challenges this poses in the context of the emerging Internet of
Things (IoT).

Speaker bio: Sundaram Vanka received the B. Tech. and M. Tech. degrees from
the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras in 2003, and the Ph. D. degree
from the University of Notre Dame, Indiana, United States of America in
2012, all in Electrical Engineering. Since 2012 he has been with the
wireless LAN (WLAN) systems architecture group at Broadcom Inc., a
market-leading designer, developer and supplier of WLAN chips on diverse
platforms, where he is currently Principal R&D engineer in the systems
architecture group. He leads systems R&D efforts into new system
architectures and protocols for interference management and coexistences
protocols, and defines the technology roadmap for these technologies. His
expertise and charter spans the mathematical modeling, design,
implementation, laboratory characterization and productization of
OFDM-based system design, interference-mitigation and coexistence protocols
for multiband/multichannel Wi-Fi and Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo solutions. His
designs form a critical part of Broadcom‚Äôs flagship WLAN/Bluetooth combo
System-on-Chip (SoC) products that are shipped to leading consumer
electronics companies. His work has resulted in 15 US patents (7 granted, 8
pending).

His research interests lie in wireless communications and networking,
spanning the mathematical modeling, simulation, design and prototyping of
wireless systems and networks. He believes the coming Internet of Things
opens up the possibility of re-evaluating some traditional assumptions
about wireless networks and offer new interesting topics for theoretical
and as well as experimental investigation.

--
Regards,
Naveen

Subject: A short survey regarding development of best practices within the institute
Text: Dear all,

Following the advise of our director, we are looking into finding a few
aspects that may help shape the culture of our institute in days to come.
Basically, we would like to try to figure out "what will our Institute
represent to people, say, after 15 years?", "what can be the core values
that we need to follow in order to produce Human Resources having those
core values" and "what type of actions we may take to embed such core
values into our system?" etc.

*We would like a bit of your help for this purpose. We would like to
request you to kindly take out 5-10 minutes from your busy schedule to fill
up the following short survey <https://form.jotform.me/91210509838457>.*

Hope to hear from you by next Monday. *The form is really small with only
two questions. *

I am sending this form to some people (mostly renowned Professors in and
outside India) from outside IIT Dharwad as well whose opinion I believe
will be helpful too. Please feel free to forward this survey to anyone
whose opinion you feel might be valuable for our purpose.

Thanking you,

Sagnik
