content.707:
Subject: Announcement of Talk on 14th Nov., 2018; from 2:30 to 3:30 PM; Room-119.
Text: Dear All,

This is to announce a* Talk* as per following details:

*****************************************************************
Speaker: *D**r. Venkata Sathish Akella*
               Senior Scientist (Project), Department of Applied Mechanics,
IIT Madras

Date.     : *14 November 2018 (Wednesday)*

Time.     : *2:30 to 3:30 PM*

Venue.   : *Room No. 119*

Title: *Self-propulsion by Marangoni forces*

*Abstract:* We experimentally study the self-propulsion of particles/drops
induced by surface tension gradients also known as Marangoni forces. In the
first part of the talk, we report experiments on an agarose gel tablet
loaded with camphoric acid (c-boat) spontaneously set into motion by
surface tension gradients on the water surface. We observe three distinct
modes of c-boat motion: harmonic mode where the c-boat speed oscillates
sinusoidally in time, a steady mode where the c-boat maintains constant
speed, and an intermittent mode where the c-boat maintains near-zero speed
between sudden jumps in speed. Whereas all three modes have been separately
reported before in different systems, controlled release of camphoric acid
from the agarose gel matrix allowed the observation of all the three modes
in the same system. In the second part, we report self-propulsion of liquid
drops on a liquid surface. The dynamics involved are quite rich in
comparison to that of a particle on liquid surface as a liquid drop
exhibits motion, deformation and break up. In this regard, we
experimentally study the motion of an Octanoic Acid drop on aqueous
solutions of octanoic acid. In the current work, we study a regime where
triple line undulations result in varying Marangoni propulsion and a random
walking drop. We discuss two parametric regimes where the drop motion
exhibits a Levy walk and a near-Gaussian random walk. We present mean
squared displacement, probability distributions of step lengths as well as
from velocity auto-correlations from observations of the drop motion as
evidence. Finally, we show that the drop `foraging' mimics a living system.

*Brief Biodata (Sic):* My primary interest is in the area of Soft Condensed
Matter Physics. I finished my Ph.D. in Physics from Brandeis University,
 USA, in Sep 2013. At Brandeis, I worked on nucleation kinetics of protein
crystallization (Advisor: Prof. Seth Fraden). I have been a post-doctoral
scholar with Prof. Mahesh Panchagnula at IIT Madras since Mar 2017. Before
that, I was a post-doctoral scholar with Prof. Mahesh M. Bandi at Okinawa
Institute of Science and Technology (Nov 2013 - Mar 2017). I completed my
M.Sc.(Physics) from IIT Madras and after that I began my research career at
Hindustan Unilever Research India, Bangalore as a Research Associate in
Chemical Engg. & Material Science division.
*****************************************************************

ALL ARE WELCOME.

Thanking you.

Yours truly,
R. Prabhu

-- 
Dr. R. Prabhu
Assistant Professor,
Department of Physics,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
Dharwad - 580011,
Karnataka, INDIA.

Email: prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in
Phone: 0091 836 2212 851 (Office)

Webpage: https://www.sites.google.com/site/prabhurama/

content.710:
Subject: Music - An Art or Science? Maybe both!
Text: Respected Authorities and Dear Students,

Hello everyone!
All those engineers who love Music and want to approach this Art with a
technical perspective, this can be the start of your Musical and
Technological Journey together!

I am glad to announce that a Talk on Music Technology, titled as '*Music
Technology: Opportunities, Challenges, Applications and Careers*', has been
organized by Music Club which is scheduled on *Monday, 12th November 2018*
from *5:30pm to 6:30pm* in *Room 23*. We are truly fortunate to have '*Dr.
Ajay Srinivasamurthy*', PhD in Music Technology, who is an applied
scientist at the Amazon Alexa Machine Learning Group in Bangalore, who has
already become familiar to us during DIAL 2018, as the speaker for this
Talk.

Certainly, this is a golden opportunity for those who do or want to
perceive Music as not only an Art but also as a Science. I strongly
recommend them to attend this Talk.

A flyer regarding the same has been attached. Please, take a look at it.
I hope many of us will be encouraged after this event, hope to see you
there.

Yours truly,
Saurav Dosi

-- 
Thanks and Regards,
Saurav Dosi
Institute Music Secretary
IIT Dharwad

content.715:
Subject: Fwd: Codefest'19, IIT(BHU)-Varanasi
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: *P Seshu* <Director@iitdh.ac.in>
Date: Friday, August 23, 2019
Subject: Fwd: Codefest'19, IIT(BHU)-Varanasi
To: Deans <deans@iitdh.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Team Codefest, IIT(BHU) Varanasi <codefest@iitbhu.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 23 Aug 2019 at 4:12 PM
Subject: Codefest'19, IIT(BHU)-Varanasi
To:


Respected Sir

Please forward this mail to all the students at your institute.
Thank you

----

Greetings from Team Codefest

The Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT (BHU) Varanasi in
association with AWS is proud to present Codefest'19, their annual Coding
festival from 23rd August to 25th September. Codefest'19 is a one-stop
destination for all the programming enthusiasts, with events ranging from
Competitive Programming, Data Analytics, App Development, Computer Vision,
etc. We are proud to partner with Cisco and GitHub.

One can participate in all of the events. The total prize money this year
is over Rs.600000. The events are as follows

1. Manthan - Our flagship competitive programming contest. Questions will
be based on data structures and algorithms. The contest is being held as a
rated Div 1 + Div 2 Codeforces round and the duration is 2 hours. Prizes
worth Rs.70000 for this event. The link for the round is
https://codeforces.com/contests/1208

2. Enigma - This is a challenge on Machine Learning and Data analytics. The
duration would be 2 and a half days. Prizes worth Rs.50000. The link of the
contest is https://www.hackerearth.com/enigma-codefest19/

3. Vista - This is a challenge on Computer Vision. The duration would be 2
and a half days. Prizes worth Rs.50000. The link of the contest is this.
https://www.hackerearth.com/vista-codefest19/

4. Mathmania - This is a challenge which will contain mathematical problems
wherein you will need to code the solutions. The duration would be around 3
hours. Prizes worth Rs.50000. Register yourself at <http://goog_1582471247>
https://www.hackerrank.com/mathmania-codefest19

5. CTF - This is a challenge on Cyber Security and Cryptography. The
duration of this contest is 18 hours. Prizes worth Rs.50000. The link for
the contest is https://www.hackerrank.com/codefest19-ctf

6. Perplexed - Constrained programming challenge. The duration of this
event would be 2.5 hours. Prizes worth Rs.50000. The link for the contest
is https://www.hackerrank.com/perplexed-codefest19

7. Linguipedia - This a challenge based on Natural Language Processing, The
event duration is 2 and a half days. Prizes worth Rs.50000. The link of the
contest is https://www.hackerearth.com/linguipedia-codefest19/

For any further information, you can visit codefest.tech or visit our
Facebook Page.

Regards,
Team Codefest!

Visit our website: http://www.codefest.tech
Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/c0defest
Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/codefest


--

content.721:
Subject: 5 signs of stress worth discussing with a counselor
Text: *|MC_PREVIEW_TEXT|*
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=StressSigns&yd_term=19>
<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=StressSigns&yd_term=19>
We've all been stressed at some point in our lives. According to research,
close to *90 percent *of significant illnesses are related to high-stress
levels. So how can you avoid such illnesses? Start by spotting these early
signs.
[image: unable to focus]
*1. You're just not able to focus*
When you've to deal with a truckload of work while balancing your other
commitments, life can get overwhelming. It is exactly at this point, your
body starts secreting cortisol, and as per research, prolonged exposure to
cortisol might lead to shrinking of the hippocampus, your brain's memory
center. All of this will culminate in you feeling distracted a lot.
[image: falling sick]
*2. You fall sick quite often*
Ever wondered why as weeks and days go by you seem to be catching cold, or
coughing a lot, or even feeling a little feverish. Well, it's not just the
changing weather around you, it could well be the stress you're going
through. When you're stressed, your body secretes a stress hormone called
cortisol, though they're helpful in the short-term when they're withdrawn
from your system as days pass by, your body becomes more susceptible to
sickness.
[image: hazy memory]
*3. Your memory is a little hazy*
Have you misplaced your keys quite a few times this week? Or have you found
yourself forgetting a word while speaking? Poor memory recall has often
been linked to excessive stress. In fact, research shows that stress can
reduce spatial memory, that part of your brain, which helps you locate
objects and other seemingly ordinary day-to-day things.
[image: too thirsty]
*4. You feel extremely thirsty*
When you get a little anxious, it causes your adrenal glands to secrete out
stress hormones into your body. This leads to a fluctuation in other
hormones, too, which go on to affect the fluid levels in your body. So if
you‚Äôre feeling thirsty reading this right now, maybe you're stressed out,
and you need to relax first before grabbing that bottle of water.
[image: sleepless]
*5. You are not able to get a good night's sleep*
If you find yourself waking up in the middle of the night or catch yourself
worrying or thinking about things that haven't happened yet, it could be a
sign of anxiety. After a long day filled with intellect engaging work,
sleep should come naturally to you, but if you feel tired and find it
difficult to fall asleep, it‚Äôs possible that your stress levels are high.

*Looking for tips to de-stress? Worry not, help is just a click away.
Connect with our Experts and find out how to live a stress-free life.*

connect to an expert now
<https://yourdost.com/chatSession/?workgroup=demo@workgroup.chat.yourdost.com&yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=StressSigns&yd_term=19>

*Standing with you, Team YourDOST*

On Thu, Sep 6, 2018 at 8:00 PM, Bharath B N <bharathbn@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Colleagues and students,
>
>    This to inform you that a talk is scheduled on 14th Sep. 2018. The
> details are provided below.
>
> Title: *Articulatory representations to address acoustic variability in
> speech*
> Who: *Dr. Ganesh Sivaraman*
> When: *14th Sep. 2018, 4:00PM to 5:00PM*
> Where: *will be announced soon.*
>
> *Abstract*
>
> The past decade has seen phenomenal improvement in the performance of
> Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems. In spite of this vast
> improvement in performance, the state-of-the-art still lags behind human
> speech recognition. Even though certain systems claim super-human
> performance, this performance often is sub-par across domains and across
> datasets. This gap is predominantly due to the lack of robustness against

content.728:
Subject: Talk (14th Sep. 2018)
Text: Dear Colleagues and students,

   This to inform you that a talk is scheduled on 14th Sep. 2018. The
details are provided below.

Title: *Articulatory representations to address acoustic variability in
speech*
Who: *Dr. Ganesh Sivaraman*
When: *14th Sep. 2018, 4:00PM to 5:00PM*
Where: *will be announced soon.*

*Abstract*

The past decade has seen phenomenal improvement in the performance of
Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems. In spite of this vast
improvement in performance, the state-of-the-art still lags behind human
speech recognition. Even though certain systems claim super-human
performance, this performance often is sub-par across domains and across
datasets. This gap is predominantly due to the lack of robustness against
speech variability. In this talk I will present articulatory feature based
approaches to analyze the variability of speech and address speech
variability in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) using articulatory
representations.

The first part of the talk focuses on a speaker independent
acoustic-to-articulatory inversion to estimate vocal tract constriction
variables (TVs) and articulatory gestures from speech. The second part is
about analysis of the articulatory trajectories under different types of
variability such as multiple speakers, speaking rate, and accents. I will
also present a speaker adaptation algorithm for speech inversion based on
Vocal Tract Length Normalization. The final part of the talk presents
articulatory feature based state-of-the-art medium and large vocabulary ASR
systems, using a hybrid convolutional neural network (CNN) architecture
developed to fuse the acoustic and articulatory feature streams in an ASR
system.

*Bio:* Ganesh Sivaraman is a Research Scientist at Pindrop, in Atlanta,
USA. He received his M.S. (2013) and Ph.D. (2017) in Electrical Engineering
from University of Maryland College Park, and, B.E. (Hons) in Electrical
Engineering from Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Goa, India.
Ganesh was a Future Faculty Fellow of the A. James Clark School of
Engineering at the University of Maryland. His research focuses on speaker
independent acoustic-to-articulatory inversion, robust speech recognition,
speaker adaptation, speech enhancement, and speaker recognition. Apart from
his official work, he is actively involved in teaching, mentoring, and
collaborating with students at the University of Maryland College Park.

*All are welcome!*

Regards,
B. N. Bharath
Assistant professor,
Electrical engineering department,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.

As shared earlier, the 21st of February is celebrated as International
Mother Language Day, globally. We had floated a creative writing event,
inviting Poems and Short Essays to celebrate Matribhasha Diwas today.

Thank you for your entries and your enthusiasm to write in native

Subject: Cultural Weekend!
Text: Hey Everyone!

The Cultural Council of IIT Dharwad presents to you the Cultural Weekend
between the 24th and 26th of August. There are a raft of events planned to
keep you occupied throughout these dates! So compete, attend and most of
all, enjoy your weekend!

Audiences can be present for any events in the weekend without
registration. However you must register for any event in which you wish to
participate. Please find the links for registration along with the
schedule.

content.734:
Subject: Offer for research and innovation
Text: Dear all,
The Indian Innovation Growth Programme 2.0, a unique tripartite initiative
of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, Lockheed
Martin and Tata Tr
usts is calling for application for the 2018 edition of IIGP 2.0 in social
and industrial sectors for Open Innovation Challenge.

IIGP 2.0 identifies and supports innovative Indian Technologies through two
annual parallel challenges-
1. *University Challenge: *Ideation and incubation of concepts from
individual students/teams.
2. *Open Innovation Challenge: *Innovation of concepts from the technology
community at large.

Win grants upto INR 10 Lacs under the University Challenge and upto INR 25
Lacs under Open Innovation Challenge.

To register, go to *www.indiainnovates.in <http://www.indiainnovates.in>*
I hope you will find it interesting.

Arpit Shukla

content.735:
Subject: Ethnic Day @ IIT Dharwad
Text: Hi Everyone!

At long last! We are proud to announce the first ethnic day of our
institute, on 5th September 2019!
As we come together to celebrate the enormous diversity which exists in our
great country, we would request everyone to wear traditional (ethnic!)
dresses. This goes for all in the institute, and no one is spared from this
request.
We would also request that you wear these dresses for as long as you can
(without breaking rules i.e. lab rules etc.), that is, from morning to
evening.
Needless to say, your attire should be sober and not attract attention for
the wrong reasons!
Hope to see a great spectacle!

Thanks and Regards,
Mehul Bose
General Secretary, Cultural Affairs
IIT Dharwad

content.741:
Subject: Elections 2019
Text: Guys

Since we have seen that many of have faced problem and there are bugs in
the app like with manifestos which ever taking time to load, the election
that we have had so far are being declared as *MOCK ELECTION*. We have
resolved as many issues as we can.

The *Main Election *is going to start from 1:20 pm to 6:00 pm. Now all the
votes until now will be erased and counting will start again. I have shared
latest apk file below install that, this will update your app and you can
start voting.

*Guys once you have given all your votes for each post don't forget to hit
the submit button. If you hit submit button only then your votes will be
registered*

Guys one more thing this app only supports android marshmallow or above.

Guys if the app is not working on your phone please borrow your friends
phone and follow the following steps to generate new password after which
you can login.

1. Click on *Generate/Change Password.*
2. Then put in your Roll number and hit submit.
3. Now you will receive a OTP on mail.
4. Input the OTP and the Password you want change it to.
5. Now go back and login to the app.
6. Now that you are in the app, you can see all the candidates under each
post, now you can vote.

*NOTE: If you are unable to login or you dont see IIT Dharwad logo on top
of the login page, this means you are not on the our WiFi network. Now just
close the completely and turn on WiFi and connect to IIT Dharwad network.
Now restart the app.*


To download the latest apk file: Click here
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1e0YH6LHdBRoZvQuISSmRc9BMfEFnuITa/view?usp=sharing>

Regards

ASHRITH ADEPU
Gen. Secy Hostel Affairs

content.746:
Subject: Elections 2019
Text: Hi guys

*We are going to have our Student Body Elections today (31st March 2019)*.
The election will start from *9:30 am to 5:00 pm*. The election will be
conducted on the app shared below. You be able to vote on the app during
the given timings, only if you are connected to our WiFi network only.
Since you can access our network anywhere in campus, you can vote from
anywhere in the campus.

The app is shared below, please download the apk file and install the app.
Once you have installed, open the app when you are connected to our WiFi
Network. Now follow the following instructions:
1. Click on *Generate/Change Password.*
2. Then put in your Roll number and hit submit.
3. Now you will receive a OTP on mail.
4. Input the OTP and the Password you want change it to.
5. Now go back and login to the app.
6. Now that you are in the app, you can see all the candidates under each
post, now you can vote.

*NOTE: If you are unable to login or you dont see IIT Dharwad logo on top
of the login page, this means you are not on the our WiFi network. Now just
close the completely and turn on WiFi and connect to IIT Dharwad network.
Now restart the app.*

To download the apk file: click here
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1inNOconp50H2fIThUzz_2K5eok3xGPjF/view?usp=sharing>

*I HOPE THERE WILL BE CLOSE TO 100% TURN OUT FOR THIS ELECTION.*

Regards

ASHRITH ADEPU
Gen. Secy Hostel Affairs

content.756:
Subject: Talk by Dr. Niranjan S. Ghaisas, Center for Turbulence Research, Stanford University, on Oct 26, 2018
Text: Dear all,

All are cordially invited to attend the following talk.

*Title*:  Large-eddy simulation study of combined configuration and
stability effects in wind farms
and development of geometry-based models for layout evaluation.

*Speaker*: Dr. Niranjan S. Ghaisas, Postdoctoral Fellow, CTR, Stanford, USA

*Room No*.: 203
*Date*: October 26, 2018 (Friday)
*Time*: 11.45am - 12.45pm

*Abstract*:
The diurnal variation of temperature leads to significant deviations from
neutral atmospheric stability conditions in the atmospheric boundary layer.
Previous field observations have revealed ambiguities in the effect of
atmospheric stability on wake losses and power production of wind farms.
Wake losses are also known to be affected significantly by the
configuration (layout and wind direction) of the wind farm. Large-eddy
simulations
(LES) of the Lillgrund wind farm (48 closely-spaced turbines) are conducted
in order to study the combined effects of layout, wind direction and
stability in large but finite wind farms. In keeping with previous
theoretical estimates, wake losses are found to be larger under stable than
under
neutral conditions for the perfectly aligned configuration. In contrast, in
three of the four configurations studied, wake losses actually decrease
under stable stratification compared to under neutral conditions. Two
competing effects, based on the rate of wake recovery and the lateral
spread
of the wakes are identified, which explain this unexpected influence of
stability on the power production. This study reveals that atmospheric
stability and configuration interact in a complicated manner to determine
the total power produced by large, finite wind farms.
The LES results are also used to develop simple statistical models that
predict the power based only on geometric parameters derived from the
wind farm layout. These geometry-based models are proposed as alternatives
to the industry-standard PARK model, and can be used for quick evaluation
and screening of wind farm layouts. Finally, efforts towards development of
advanced LES subgrid-scale models and towards high-order simulations of
deformations of solids, and their coupling to fluids, in a fully Eulerian
framework, will be briefly discussed.

*Bio*:
Dr. Niranjan S. Ghaisas received his Ph.D. from Purdue University in
December 2013 and completed a postdoctoral research stint at the
University of Delaware before joining the Center for Turbulence Research,
Stanford University, as a postdoctoral fellow in July 2015.
His research interests include subgrid scale modeling for stratified flows,
simulations for wind energy applications, and current work at CTR focuses
on Eulerian multi-material simulations using high-order methods. Dr.
Niranjan received his BTech from IIT Kharagpur in Industrial Engineering
with a minor in Mechanical Engineering and MSc (Engg.) from the Indian
Institute of Science Bangalore.

*Participation from 2nd and 3rd year ME students is highly encouraged.*

Thank you,
Sincerely,
Dhiraj.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.
O: 8362212829

Cc: Hansen, John <john.hansen@utdallas.edu>



Dear All in the Speech/Language Community:

*Announcing the FEARLESS STEPS Challenge! for ISCA INTERSPEECH-2019*

*HISTORY:* On July 20, 1969, at 20:17 UTC, Earth witnessed one of the most
challenging technology accomplishments by mankind to date of NASA Apollo-11
with over 600M people witnessing both the landing and first steps on the
moon by Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin. Next July 2019 marks the 50th
Anniversary of the historic Apollo-11 lunar landing and first steps.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_11

*NSF CRSS-UTDallas Project:* With support from the US National Science
Foundation (NSF-CISE), CRSS-UTDallas has spent the last six years
developing a hardware/software solution to digitize and recover all
30-track analog tapes from Apollo-11 (plus Apollo-13 and other missions),
as well as development of speech diarization technologies to advance speech
technology for such data. A total of 19,000 hours of data consisting of all
NASA air-to-ground, mission control, and backroom support team discussions
was released this year (news releases from this NSF sponsored project this
year include: NSF, NASA, BBC, AIP (Acoustical Society of America), NPR,
many online news sites, and involvement in a planned CNN documentary where
this data is contributing, etc.). To date, this will be the largest
publically available audio corpus of time synchronized, team-based (~600
people) naturalistic communications to accomplish a real-world task.

*ANNOUNCEMENT:* This email is to announce the Official Opening and Release
of the *FEARLESS STEPS CHALLENGE* corpus, which is being shared for a
Special Session at ISCA INTERSPEECH-2019. The attached Challenge
Release details
the 5 challenge tasks involved:

1. *SAD*: Speech Activity Detection

2. *SD*: Speaker Diarization

3. *SID*: Speaker Identification

4. *ASR*: Automatic Speech Recognition

5. *SENTIMENT*: Sentiment Detection



This challenge corpus consists of 100hours from 5 of the 30-track channels
spanning three phases of Apollo-11 mission: (i) Lift Off, (ii) Lunar
Landing, (iii) Lunar Walk. All data for this challenge *is now available
via a download option* for all to participate (this site has sample audio
from the NSF funded project: <https://app.exploreapollo.org/>
http://fearlesssteps.exploreapollo.org/ ). In addition, any lab/group
wishing to have access to the entire 19,000 hours can do so without charge
(this is public data, so it will be available via download, or a small fee
for a hard-disk and shipping to your lab).

While diarization efforts in the past have concentrated on single channel
broadcast news, interviews, etc. These all represent typically a single
speaker, or small group discussing topics of interest. The *FEARLESS STEPS
CORPUS* is all time synchronized (with IRIG Time Channel) across 30
channels, with loops containing anywhere from 3-33 speakers working
collaboratively to solve challenging problems. CRSS-UTDallas has produced
full diarization output for the entire 19,000hrs of data (SAD, SID,
DIAR/ASR) which is available with the corpus.

*REQUEST:*  Please visit the website and register for participating in this
historical 50th Anniversary Special Session at ISCA INTERSPEECH-2019. If
you have interest in getting access to the *FEARLESS STEPS CORPUS* and
potentially participating in the CHALLENGE, *please register and download
the corpus! *

*NOTE:* All updates to the Data and Evaluation Plan will be updated on
the Fearless
Steps Challenge <http://fearlesssteps.exploreapollo.org/> Website

Many thanks for your interest!

Regards,



*Fearless Steps Team,*

*Center for Robust Speech Speech Systems (CRSS)*


*Robust Speech Technologies Lab (RSTL) *

*The University of Texas at Dallas *

Dear Professor,



Summer School on Theoretical Foundations of Computer Science
                    18th-22nd June, 2018 @ IIIT, Bangalore


*CALL FOR PARTICIPATION *
International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore (IIIT-B) is
organising a "Summer School on Theoretical Foundations of Computer Science"
that is sponsored by Sonata Software Ltd. The aim of this school is to
encourage and promote interest in theoretical foundations of computer
science among students and researchers. We identify a few selected topics
in theoretical computer science and aim to conduct lectures in a tutorial
fashion, primarily aimed at students with a basic understanding of
theoretical computer science. This five-day event also features a few
invited talks given by researchers from both academia and industry. The
focus of the tutorial-style lectures will be on the foundations of the
selected topics and will aim to include problem solving/hands-on sessions.
The invited talks will focus on the state-of-the-art research on these or
related topics and their applications.

The topics that we aim to cover are from Approximation Algorithms,
Parameterised Algorithms and Complexity, Cryptography, Program Analysis and
Formal Methods, and Foundations of Open-world Computing. Since each of the
above topics is itself broad, we only seek to give a very brief overview of
the subject, and additionally some deeper insights into specific sub topics
that may reflect the research interests of the speakers.

Target Audience:
This school is primarily intended for third year onwards undergraduate
(BE/BTech/BSc/BCA) and post graduate (ME/MTech/MSc/PhD) students of
computer science and related disciplines. Researchers and faculty members
are also welcome. Pre-requisites to participate in this workshop are a
basic understanding of discrete mathematics, data structures and
algorithms. Hence this workshop would be suitable for undergraduate
students who have completed at least 4 semesters in a typical computer
science, information technology or related streams.

Date: 18th June (Monday) to 22nd June (Friday), 2018
Venue: International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore

Tutorial Topics and Speakers:
     Approximation Algorithms - Prof. V.N. Muralidhara, IIIT Bangalore
     Parameterised Algorithms and Complexity - Prof. Pradeesha Ashok, IIIT
Bangalore
     Cryptography - Prof. Srinivas Vivek, IIIT Bangalore
     Program Analysis and Formal Methods - Prof. Meenakshi D'Souza, IIIT
Bangalore
     Foundations of Open-world Computing - Prof. Srinath Srinivasa, IIIT
Bangalore

Invited Talks and Speakers:
     Confidentiality in Blockchains - Dr. Satya Lokam - Microsoft Research
India, Bangalore
     TBD - Prof. Venkatesh Raman - IMSc, Chennai

     MORE SPEAKERS TO BE CONFIRMED SOON


Registration is FREE but mandatory. Only limited seats available.
The deadline for registration is 31st May, 2018.

Travel support:
Basic travel support including accommodation at IIIT-B hostel are available
in limited numbers only for participants from outside of Bangalore.

For more information about the workshop and registration, please visit the
website:

                    <http://tfocs.iiitb.ac.in/>http://tfocs.iiitb.ac.in


Please find attached a poster for the event.





With best wishes,



S Sadagopan

Dear All



Greetings !!



*Can You & AI Solve it ?*



Artificial intelligence (AI) is the science of developing intelligence like
humans in computing systems, where machines emulate the human behavior and
expertise. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is poised as the next industrial
revolution enriching the way people live and work. India, being the fastest
growing economy recognizes AI's potential and has strategized its approach
to use AI to solve problems related to the second largest population in the
world. AI is being and will be addressing national priorities, solving
social challenges, increasing economic prosperity and touching every aspect
of life and sciences.



C-DAC along with NVIDIA is hosting a 5 days *AI Hackathon* from 26th-30th
September 2019. An AI hackathon is a coding event in which teams of
developers will work on the problem statement provided by C-DAC and NVIDIA
in AI/ML space. The problem statement from C-DAC and NVIDIA will be chosen
from domains highly relevant to solving Indian problems.



Participating in an AI hackathon provides a unique opportunity for teams to
jumpstart acceleration use case on GPUs. The participants will be provided
with mentors and experts in this field. They will guide the teams to tune
and adhere to best practices to get best performance on GPU with higher
accuracy. Basically it‚Äôs a place where you get the chance to work and
collaborate on projects with like-minded people.



Be the part of this grand AI Hackathon 2019 event, if you are an AI
enthusiast and passionate of artificial intelligence, this could be your
moment to showcase your skills and your transformative solutions come into
the limelight.



For more information and registration please visit *AI Hackathon 2019*
website: *: https://aihackathon.cdac.in <aihackathon@cdac.in>. *



*Registration started from 31st July 2019 *



*Note: Requested to all kindly circulate AI Hackathon 2019 details with
peers and others for maximum participations and proliferation. Please
display event brochure on Notice board. *

Cc:
Bcc:
Date: Wed, 2 May 2018 07:10:58 +0000
Subject: Fw: Invitation for the hands on workshop at IISc

Dear Colleagues:


Please spread this invitation among your students and encourage interested
ones, in particular the research students, to attend this hands-on workshop
at IISc.


Regards,
Chandra


------------------------------
*From:* Chetan Singh Thakur
*Sent:* Sunday, April 29, 2018 5:55 PM
*To:* Chandra Sekhar Seelamantula
*Subject:* Invitation for the hands on workshop at IISc


Hi Chandra,



Please find the writeup for the workshop, we are organising. Please let me
know if anyone in your circle is interested.





We are organizing a summer workshop (hands on) in the broad area of Deep
learning, neural signal processing and robotics during June 10-16.  The
workshop will be hosted in IISc at the Department of Electronic Systems
Engineering.



We have identified the following three themes as the main focus of the
workshop



a. EEG based processing of Audio Signals with BCI applications

b. Developing Deep learning algorithms for Robotics platform

c. Embedded systems and Neuromorphic Sensors



Each of the themes will have at least two faculty mentors and up to 20
students working on the theme for a week at IISc.



In this regard, I am pleased to invite you working in one of the areas. The
finer details of the work are flexible and will be finalized based on the
mutual interest of the team.



The workshop is loosely modelled in line with the JHU/Telluride workshop
where we will get an initial work started on a chosen research theme. This
can then progress after the workshop and become a long term collaborative
effort. The workshop will also feature daily talks from experts in this
broad field of Neuromorphic computing.



The workshop organization will take care of the transportation (including
airfare) and lodging at IISc (for all attendees) during the period of
workshop. Also, all facilities including cloud computing, EEG recording
setup, data set necessary for processing, would be made available during
the workshop. This workshop is supported by generous funds from Broadcom
Inc.



Please let us know your availability for the workshop. We look forward to
hosting you here at IISc for this hands on workshop.



Kind regards,

Chetan

Assistant Professor, IISc

content.770:
Subject: Fwd: PhD Positions available at SIRe, IIT Delhi
Text: Dear Students,

Please find below some opportunities for higher studies at IIT Delhi.

---------- Forwarded message ---------


The School for Interdisciplinary Research (SIRe) was started at IIT Delhi
a couple of years ago to enable greater interdisciplinarity of research
and research entrepreneurial efforts on campus.

Saliently, the way it works is:

1. Two faculty colleagues (coadvisors), from different Departments /
Centers within IIT Delhi, or from schools we have an MoU with, such as
AIIMS, JNU or NII float a project that defines the specific research they
are interested in. Information regarding this is available on our

webpage: http://sire.iitd.ac.in/admission-process.php
<http://sire.iitd.ac.in/admission-process.php>.

2. Students satisfying the requirements of the project can apply,
regardless of their background as long as they satisfy admission
requirements:
http://sire.iitd.ac.in/degree-program.php#eligibility
<http://sire.iitd.ac.in/degree-program.php#eligibility>.

So, the best way for
students to proceed is to proactively contact IITD faculty colleagues (any
Department) and express their desire to work with them if there is a
specific research / research entrepreneurship problem they want to work on
(will need to be
specific).

3. Financial support will be provided by the co-advisors through their
projects or
consultancies, or a center of excellence at IIT Delhi. Student fellowships
such as
CSIR, UGC, DBT, etc. are all welcome. Part-time students are permitted
from partner
organizations we have an MoU with. Please see:
http://sire.iitd.ac.in/financial-support.php
<http://sire.iitd.ac.in/financial-support.php>.

4. At this time, we are only accepting Ph. D. applicants. MS applicants
will be
accepted in the near future.





-- 
Rajshekar K
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science and Engineering
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad, Karnataka, India.
www.cse.iitd.ac.in/~rajshekar

content.783:
Subject: Traffic Safety and Rules Awareness Program
Text: Hello everyone,

Accidents resulting in life time injury or death are becoming common in
India. On an average there is at least one death in every four minutes due
to accidents in India. The traffic is increasing every day. Work load and
stress is increasing in the traffic police and while the traffic police is
becoming stringent day by day, the citizens still don‚Äôt consider it their
duty to follow traffic rules. Traffic rules are questioned; the traffic
police is abused for being stringent. And hence the accidents keep
increasing. The youth is usually more prone to accidents and it is very
crucial for them to know their traffic rules well and more importantly
follow them.

Hence, Pragati Foundation is offering us free awareness program in traffic
rules and safety. *Pragati Foundation is an NGO registered in 2007. They
are also training partners of National Skills Development Council (NSDC),
New Delhi.*

*I would request you to attend this program organised on 15th October 2018,
Monday.*

*Venue: Room no. 23*
*Time: 3:00 p.m.*

Thanks,
Shruti Patel
General Secretary Academic Affairs

Subject: Mathematics Dept Seminar/Colloquium talks
Text: Dear All,
Gentle reminder for the Math Seminar tomorrow. The  time, place, speaker
information and the summary of the talk are given below.
Amlan
==============================================================
Time: 4:15 pm to 5:15 pm
Room: 119
Speaker: Dr. Sunder Ramkrishnan
Abstract: We give an introduction to nonstandard analysis, starting with an
ultrapower construction of the hyperreals. We then demonstrate how theorems
in standard analysis 'transfer over' to nonstandard analysis, and also how
theorems in standard analysis can be proven using the nonstandard
counterpart.

content.804:
Subject: Minutes of 2nd Sports Board meeting held by IIT Kharagpur
Text: Dear all,

I'm sharing with you the decisions made in this board meeting.

*1) Co-hosting of Inter IIT Sports Meet*
IIT Kharagpur and IIT Bhubaneswar will be hosting the upcoming Inter IIT
Sports meet. IIT Bhubaneswar as a co-host will organize *Badminton*(Male &
Female), *Volleyball*(Male & Female),*Table Tennis*(Male & Female) and
*Squash*(Male & Female).
Rest of the events will be organized by IIT Kharagpur.

*2) Increase in Contingent Strength*
a.      For 1st Generation IITS may be increased by 10 excluding Chess. (6M
& 4F)
b.      For 2nd Generation IITS may be increased by 10 excluding Chess. (6M
& 4F)
c.      For *3rd Generation IITS may be increased by 40 *excluding Chess.
(25M & 15F)

So the total strength of new *IITs is 81* excluding chess.

*3) Addition of new games*
Earlier Chess was a held as a demo game. Now it is the part of the main
meet with points.

Regards
Nikhilesh Kumar Thakur
Gen. Secy. Sports
Contact No. - 9481245572

content.816:
Subject: Fwd: Workshop on Computer Systems 2018 - Call for Student Participation
Text: *                                             2nd Workshop on Computer
Systems*

*WoCS 2018*



Ashoka University, Sonipat



*http://cs.ashoka.edu.in/wocs2018/ <http://cs.ashoka.edu.in/wocs2018/>*



*December 8th ‚Äì 9th 2018*



WoCS 2018 will build up on the success of Workshop on Memory and Storage
Systems (WoMS 2017). The 2018 iteration of WoCSwill continue with its focus
on memory and storage systems. However, the scope of the workshop is being
increased this year to include other systems research areas like operating
systems, compilers, programming language design etc.) to make it
interesting to the larger computer systems community in India.



*Workshop Format*

The workshop will have invited speakers from both industry and academia to
talk about contemporary, pressing issues that need to be addressed in these
areas and the research that is being done to solve them.



In addition to the talks, the event will have several forums for informal
interactions - over coffee, in an open-house style panel discussions about
research opportunities in memory and storage systems in particular and
computer systems in general.



*Target Audience*

The target audience for this workshop is senior undergraduate (3rd or 4th
year) or early career graduate students who are looking for introduction to
research opportunities in the field of computer systems. The organizers are
looking to select approximately 50 students to attend WoCS 2018.



There is *no application or participation fee*. Discounted, shared
accommodation will be provided at Ashoka University for selected candidates.



*Poster Presentations*

WoCS 2018 organizers also invite graduate students to present posters of
their *already* *published* research results to disseminate them to a
focused audience, or get feedback for possible future research directions.



Student application deadline: 20th November 2018

Application link - https://goo.gl/forms/g0VbNiiAyJ72LibZ2

content.818:
Subject: Rhapsody - Logo Design Quest
Text: Hello folks,

As we have already come up with a name for our Music Club, we would like to
take a step further. With a name and a logo together, the Club will have
its own identity. Designing merchandise is our next goal for which we need
to have a unique and meaningful logo for our Club. As we would be pleased
to consider all your creative ideas, I expose you to an opportunity of
designing a logo for the Music Club.

Interested people can *click here* <https://goo.gl/forms/wL9R169Xm41eY3Ii2>
for more details.

Expectations from the design have been mentioned in the form itself.
Committee members, with some inputs from professionals, will select the
best design which satisfies all our expectations and the winning Artist(s)
will be given the entire credit and a lot of publicity on social media.

I hope I get to know all the true Artists among us.

Good luck!
Yours truly,
Saurav Dosi

-- 
Thanks and Regards,
Saurav Dosi
Institute Music Secretary
IIT Dharwad

content.828:
Subject: This Diwali, #BeSomeonesLight
Text: -




<https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMailer&yd_campaign=Diwali2018&yd_term=19>
<http://bit.ly/BeSomeonesLight>
*Diwali - "The Festival of Lights"* symbolises the spiritual "victory of
light over darkness, good over evil and knowledge over ignorance". So
often, we see our friends struggling with the darkness of distress, and we
have no clue how to help them fight it.

So this Diwali, why not help bring some light into their lives? Help them
give a boost to their emotional wellness by referring them to connect with
one of our Experts today by filling this form. This Diwali, let's
*#BeSomeonesLight*

content.833:
Subject: Announcement of Physics Lecture on April 15th, 2019; from 2 to 3 PM: Room-119.
Text: Dear All,

This is to announce a Physics Lecture as per following details:

*****************************************************************
Speaker: *Dr. Rajasekhar Medapalli*
                Postdoctoral Researcher,
                University of California in San Diego, USA.

Date.     : *15 April 2019 (Monday)*

Time.     : *2:00 to 3:00 PM*

Venue.   : *Room No. 119*

Title: *Towards the next generation data storage technology: Ultrafast
optical control of magnetic materials*

*Abstract: *The study of all-optical control of materials mainly
involveswith exploiting interactions amongst the fundamental reservoirs of
energy and angular momentum in materials:charge, spin and lattice. The
interaction of femtosecond laser pulse with magnetic material triggers
transfer of energy from the electrons into spin and lattice systems. The
developments in various time-resolved pump-probe techniques allowed us to
explore such interactions between these reservoirs, in metals, that occur
at sub-picosecond to picosecond timescales. Investigating the interactions
at ultrashort timescales is a key to obtain control over many phenomena
such as ultrafast demagnetization, laser-induced magnetization reversal
(all-optical switching), super-diffusive spin-transport, and even
laser-induced magnetic phase-transition. My research goal is to explore
mechanisms involving the aforementioned phenomena in advanced magnetic
materials suitable for energy efficient spintronic technologies operating
at terahertz (THz) frequencies.

In my talk, I will address potential mechanisms involving the helicity
(circular polarization)-independent and helicity-dependent all-optical
switching (AOS) processes in both ferrimagnetic GdFeCo and ferromagnetic
Co/Pt thin film systems. It has been demonstrated, in metallic magnets,
that the loss of spin ordering to the laser excitation, i.e., ultrafast
demagnetization triggers a flow of spin-polarized current oscillating at
terahertz frequencies, which will eventually be converted to THz charge
current when a heavy metal layer is placed next to the magnetic layer. I
will present the laser-driven THz-signals, in Co/Pt bilayers, and their
sensitivity to varied roughness, crystal structure, and intermixing at the
interface. Finally, I will discuss the timescales of laser-induced
phase-transition from antiferromagnetic to ferromagnetic phase in FeRh.
Excitation of antiferromagnetic FeRh/Pt bilayer by femtosecond laser pulses
results in an efficient emission of nearly single cycle THz pulse being an
evidence for laser-induced changes of the magnetization in FeRh. The study
based on double pump THz-emission spectroscopy technique reveals that the
laser-induced phase-transition emerges at sub-nanosecond timescale, the
speed that yields a further control over phase-transition by means of both
temperature and applied magnetic field.

*Succinct information about the speaker: *Dr. Rajasekhar Medapalli is a
postdoctoral researcher at the Center for Memory and Recording Research,
University of California San Diego. His research mainly focuses on the
all-optical control of (magnetic-)materials at nanometer length scales. He
also fabricates rare-earth thin films based spintronic devices suitable for
terahertz spintronics.Dr. Medapalli received his Ph.D. in Physics from
Radboud University Nijmegen in 2014 focusing on efficient optical control
of magnetization dynamics in metallic alloys. Prior to this, he received
his M.Tech degree (Nanotechnology) from Amity University in 2009 and M.Sc
degree (Physics) from Andhra University in 2007.

*****************************************************************

ALL ARE WELCOME.

Thanking you.

Yours truly,
R. Prabhu

-- 
Dr. R. Prabhu
Assistant Professor,
Department of Physics,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
Dharwad - 580011,
Karnataka, INDIA.

Email: prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in
Phone: 0091 836 2212 851 (Office)

Webpage: https://www.sites.google.com/site/prabhurama/

content.837:
Subject: Interactive Sports Event On August 3
Text: Dear all,
I feel great pleasure in announcing that we are going to organize an
interactive sports event for zealous interaction across the different
batches. The event is scheduled on August 3, 2019 (if weather permits). It
will include *Football, Table Tennis *and *Women's Throwball*.

1. *Football*

   - Two teams
   - One team with 5 players from the first year and 6 players from the
   fourth year
   - Another team with 5 players from the second year and 6 players from
   the third year
   - The game will be of 50 minutes, two halves of 25 minutes each

2. *Table Tennis*

   - Three teams of different departments
   - Each team with 6 players in total, 3 from the first year, 1 from the
   second year, 1 from the third year and 1 from the fourth year

3. *Women's Throwball*

   - Two teams
   - One team with 4 female players from the first year and 3 female
   players from the third year
   - Another team with 4 female players from the second year and 3 female
   players from the fourth year

The exact schedule of the event will be shared later.
I hope, the event will be a great opportunity to develop everlasting
relations.

Best wishes
Abhay Sahu
Gen. Secy. Sports

I am thinking of creating an itinerary for a cycling trip (~100 kms) on a

Not yet decided, but as the range suggests - it won't be tooo far.

"Yes", "Yep", "count me in", or any other positive reply to this email.

> We will celebrate our constitution like never before by assembling more than 1500 cyclists of all religions,castes,sex,age to showcase synchronization on cycles just like we Indians follow the constitution. It is a unique opportunity to showcase your love for our motherland India as well as express your passion for cycling, both at the same time ! 
> 
> 
>

> 
> 
> 
>  If you can follow the following thumb rules, we will have no difficulty holding the Guinness World Record for India. 
> 
> 
> 
> 1 . You need to cycle at a slow speed of 8-10Km Per hours only.
> 
> 2. It is not a RACE and you cannot overtake the rider in front.
> 
> 3. You need to maintain a distance of not more than  2 Cycle length i.e 10 feet from the cyclist in front of you
> 
> 4. If you fall down,have a puncture or have any issue with your cycle, just leave the line and allow the cyclist behind you to overtake you. You will still be given certificate and medal. This gesture will be highly appreciated. 
> 
> 5. Drinking water and taking out your phone for a photo during the attempt is strictly not allowed. If seen doing it, our volunteers will immediately pull you out of the line. 
> 
> 6. Dont look or waive at the cameras which will be covering the attempt. CAMERA IS ANYWAYS LOOKING AT YOU AND CAPTURING YOUR MOMENT WHICH WILL BE GIVEN TO YOU.
> 
> 7. We have taken the pain of executing this mammoth project and have spent more than 12 months to deliver it to you. Your cooperation is of highest appreciation for breaking the record. 
> 
> 8. Remember that if you fail, we all fail. Practice slow cycling

> 
>

content.842:
Subject: Become a part of Guinness World Record attempt on 26th January 2019
Text: Hey there, I would like to share on behalf of Hubballi Bicycle Riders. We
IITians can be part of Guinness World Record. So I request you all to go
through this email and make it a big number from IIT for the attempt. You
can register by following the link below:

https://www.hbcriders.com/why-guinness-attempt

We will celebrate our constitution like never before by assembling more
than 1500 cyclists of all religions,castes,sex,age to showcase
synchronization on cycles just like we Indians follow the constitution. It
is a unique opportunity to showcase your love for our motherland India as
well as express your passion for cycling, both at the same time !



The execution requires common sense more than anything else. Recently more
than 5000 cyclists failed to break the record in Philippines because they
did not follow simple rules and apply commonsense.



 If you can follow the following thumb rules, we will have no difficulty
holding the Guinness World Record for India.



1 . You need to cycle at a slow speed of 8-10Km Per hours only.

2. It is not a RACE and you cannot overtake the rider in front.

3. You need to maintain a distance of not more than  2 Cycle length i.e 10
feet from the cyclist in front of you

4. If you fall down,have a puncture or have any issue with your cycle, just
leave the line and allow the cyclist behind you to overtake you. You will
still be given certificate and medal. This gesture will be highly
appreciated.

5. Drinking water and taking out your phone for a photo during the attempt
is strictly not allowed. If seen doing it, our volunteers will immediately
pull you out of the line.

6. Dont look or waive at the cameras which will be covering the attempt.
CAMERA IS ANYWAYS LOOKING AT YOU AND CAPTURING YOUR MOMENT WHICH WILL BE
GIVEN TO YOU.

7. We have taken the pain of executing this mammoth project and have spent
more than 12 months to deliver it to you. Your cooperation is of highest
appreciation for breaking the record.

8. Remember that if you fail, we all fail. Practice slow cycling



To know more please read the Frequently asked question section



If you have any doubt or query after reading the query, please mail to
support@hbcriders.com



Please watch the Bangladesh Record video for more information.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6J1vY3Ay-fg

Regards:
Pranjal

content.848:
Subject: Re: Talk on Music Technology
Text: A gentle reminder regarding today's talk at 4:00PM.

On Thu 22 Aug, 2019, 14:40 GAGAN G.B, <170020029@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:

> Hello everyone,
>
>
> We will have an orientation talk by Dr. Ajay Srinivasamurthy, the details
> of which are given below. All are invited to attend the same.
>
>
> *Title:* "Music Technology: Opportunities, Challenges, Applications and
> Careers"
>
> *Date & Time:* 4:00PM on 27th August 2019
>
> *Venue:* Room No. 23
>
>
>
> *Abstract:* The art of music has been practised for centuries. In the
> last century, the science of music developed, with musicologists studying
> music systematically using a scientific approach. Engineering of music is
> now emerging: Music Technology is a multidisciplinary field that draws from
> several fields such as acoustics, psychoacoustics, signal processing,
> machine learning, computer science, psychology and musicology to build
> tools and techniques for performance, production, analysis, understanding
> and synthesis of music. The tools aim to create a novel experience with
> music for both musicians and the audience, enhancing our collective
> experience with music. Music Technology encompasses several fields
> including music production, music perception and cognition,

content.849:
Subject: Talk on Music Technology
Text: Hello everyone,


We will have an orientation talk by Dr. Ajay Srinivasamurthy, the details
of which are given below. All are invited to attend the same.


*Title:* "Music Technology: Opportunities, Challenges, Applications and
Careers"

*Date & Time:* 4:00PM on 27th August 2019

*Venue:* Room No. 23



*Abstract:* The art of music has been practised for centuries. In the last
century, the science of music developed, with musicologists studying music
systematically using a scientific approach. Engineering of music is now
emerging: Music Technology is a multidisciplinary field that draws from
several fields such as acoustics, psychoacoustics, signal processing,
machine learning, computer science, psychology and musicology to build
tools and techniques for performance, production, analysis, understanding
and synthesis of music. The tools aim to create a novel experience with
music for both musicians and the audience, enhancing our collective
experience with music. Music Technology encompasses several fields
including music production, music perception and cognition,
computational/digital musicology and music information retrieval. This talk
is aimed to be an introductory overview of music technology that discusses
the opportunities, challenges and applications in the field, while also
discussing possible career paths. With a special emphasis on Indian music,
the talk will also discuss the current state of the art, relevant problems
and resources available to start working on music technology in the Indian
socio-cultural context.



The talk will also provide additional information about the upcoming course
on Computational Musicology that is planned to be offered as a 1 credit
course this semester:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BTH7Sep_WG5XIEq86CD7cLTM8p1PleoQk0t8qkDQFHo/edit?ts=5cea6600



*Bio:* Ajay Srinivasamurthy is an Applied Scientist at the Amazon Alexa
Machine Learning Group in Bangalore, where he works on large scale
automatic speech recognition systems. Prior to joining Amazon, he was a
postdoctoral researcher at Idiap Research Institute, Martigny Switzerland
working on speech recognition for Air Traffic Control. He got his PhD in
Music Technology from Universitat Pompeu Fabra, where he was a part of the
CompMusic project led by Prof. Xavier Serra and worked on several automatic
rhythm analysis problems in Indian Art Music. He has an M.E. in Signal
Processing from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore and a B.Tech
from National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal. He has diverse
research interests and experience in the areas of Speech, Audio and Music
Signal Processing and Machine Learning (More info:
www.ajaysrinivasamurthy.in).

content.852:
Subject: Re: Lack of basic necessities in IIT Dharwad
Text: Dear Ashutosh

Thanks for your mail.  Thanks a lot for alerting us about water purifiers
and network speed.

First of all, kindly do not send emails from CDC. It is to be sent by your
mail. Be careful about it next time.

Second,. for each of these issues there is a mechanism in our institute to
take care.

For example,. In bhoopali mess if water purifier is not working, then the
mess committee needs to bring it to the notice of dean.ips office.  There
is a form on our website which has to be filled and submitted.  Then
concerned person will take care of it.  Similar procedure goes for academic
building water purifier as well.  To this effect a mail was sent by Dean
IPS office to all long time back.

At the end of the day, it is our institute where we shall take care of our
institute ourselves.  So let us take responsibility together and take care.

Coming to network speed,. I will talk to Prof. Rajshekhar (cc in charge)
and apprise you about the current situation.

Yours sincerely
Prabhu

content.854:
Subject: Lack of basic necessities in IIT Dharwad
Text: Sir
I am extremely sorry to inform you about the poor conditions of basic
necessities in our institute.

Every floor in the academic area has a water cooler machine but has anyone
checked out of them how many actually works? Even in the Bhoopali mess
drinking water doesn't come half of the time. Studying in an IIT, are we
expected to go outside to buy a drinking water bottle every time we feel
thirsty?

It's been three years since our institute has established, but still we do
not have a stable wifi connection.We are expected to do a course online via
NPTEL and the internet facility hardly works. Even if it works then what is
the point of getting a 75 Kbps speed (mostly) when you can't stream a video
even in the lowest quality. We have even tried to use the internet using
our own mobile data but the maximum speed we get during the day time is
less than 300 Kbps. Ironically this is the four times the speed of our
college wifi but it is still useless.

I hope due attention is given to this mail and efforts will be done to
provide the students with the basic necessities.

content.860:
Subject: Incredible India Quiz - (Cultural Championship)
Text: Hey,

The Quiz club of IIT Dharwad takes immense pride in annoucing the first
event under the *Inter Branch Cultural Championship*, a thematic quiz about
India, *The Incredible India Quiz*.

This is a team event, that is, you have to participate in a *team of 2. *You
need to fill out the form given below to register for the quiz. Based on
the number of registrations, there would be a *prelims* conducted this
Sunday, i.e. *11th August, at 9PM in Room no 23. *The top 6 teams will
advance to the finals.

The finals would be conducted on the *15th of August, Sunday. *Timings will
be conveyed later.
The finals would have 6 teams, 2 from every branch.

The prelims and the finals both, is themed on India. Let's celebrate this
73rd year of independance of our great nation by testing our knowledge
about it.

I hope to see maximum participants from everyone. Drop me a mail in case of
any queries.

Form link for prelims registration: Click Here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfEk9yJ5zF1mOwi8_ruZmg5H2XC4JZPLhpitlc9eNHs1Z7EJg/viewform>


Regards,
Shivam Chaturvedi
Quiz Club Secretary
IIT Dharwad

From: Indumathi Manivannan Nambi <indunambi@iitm.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Jul 16, 2018 at 5:31 PM
Subject: Inviting Applications for Carbon Zero Challenge 2019 ‚Äì All India
Energy & Environment Innovation Contest
To: "director@iitdh.ac.in" <director@iitdh.ac.in>



*[image: iitm_logo] *
*Dr. Indumathi M Nambi*
Professor, Department of Civil Engineering
Indian Institute of Technology Madras
Chennai ‚Äì 600036, INDIA‚Äã
E-mail: indunambi@iitm.ac.in
Phone: +91-44-22574289, +91-9444687042
www.czeroc.iitm.ac.in


July 16th, 2018
Respected Prof.P Seshu‚Äã,

*Greetings from IIT Madras*

As part of various efforts to foster innovation among students and the
youth, IIT Madras has launched a one-of-its-kind initiative - Carbon Zero
Challenge (CZeroC). Carbon Zero Challenge is a one-of-its-kind initiative
focusing on Innovation and Entrepreneurship in the energy and environment
sector and aims to support early stage start-ups, aspiring entrepreneurs
and college students. The initiative is supported by Virtusa.  Industrial
Waste Management Association (IWMA) is the organizing partner and YouNoodle
is the Technology Partner.

*Carbon Zero Challenge 2019 ‚Äì All India Energy & Environment Innovation
Contest*
CZeroC 2018 - that completed in Feb 2018 was a grand success. 20+
student/startup teams from various parts of South India developed their
innovative zero carbon solution from a mere idea to an impactful working
prototype. Encouraged by the enormous interest from the student community
for a contest like this which fosters innovation, IIT Madras has launched
second edition of Carbon Zero Challenge as an ALL INDIA Energy and
Environment Innovation Contest.


Some of the unique benefits of this competition are:

   1. Selected teams (Maximum of 25 teams) will be supported with a funding
   assistance of *up to Rs 5 Lakhs* per team to help them build a working
   prototype and hence convert their innovative idea into scalable
   product/solution for the market
   2. *Entrepreneurship training and certification* for selected teams ‚Äì
   which could help them immensely in their Startup journey
   3. An attractive *Start-up support fund* of upto *Rs. 10 lakhs* for the
   winning team and further incubation opportunities
   4. Mentorship support by Technical and Business Experts from both
   academia and industry ‚Äì to assist the teams in building a successful
   prototype
   5. Assistance in liaising with the industry during the problem
   identification phase


 Carbon Zero Challenge has been attracting a profound interest among the
Startup community, Press and Media. Some of the below links are provided
for your kind reference.

   - NDTV (July 11th,  2018) https://www.ndtv.com/ed
   ucation/iit-madras-carbon-zero-challenge-attracts-participan
   ts-from-students-startups-1881576
   <https://www.ndtv.com/education/iit-madras-carbon-zero-challenge-attracts-participants-from-students-startups-1881576>
   - Deccan Chronicle (June 13th,  2018) https://www.deccanchron
   icle.com/nation/current-affairs/130618/iit-m-researche
   rs-double-the-joy-make-fuel-oil-from-plastic.html
   <https://www.deccanchronicle.com/nation/current-affairs/130618/iit-m-researchers-double-the-joy-make-fuel-oil-from-plastic.html>
   - Puthiya Thalaimurai (June 13th, 2018) https://www.youtube.com/
   watch?v=zSeNZz5aIxk
   - Financial Express (February 10th,  2018) https://www.financialexpress.c
   om/education-2/big-achievement-these-2-teams-of-iit-madras-
   made-institute-proud-bagged-top-honours-in-this-big-challenge/1060148/
   <https://www.financialexpress.com/education-2/big-achievement-these-2-teams-of-iit-madras-made-institute-proud-bagged-top-honours-in-this-big-challenge/1060148/>


*On behalf of IIT Madras and CZeroC Organizing Committee, I am extremely
glad to invite nominations from best student teams from your college to
participate in Carbon Zero Challenge 2019. *

Guidelines for applying and link to application portal can be found at
*http://czeroc.com/apply/.* <http://czeroc.com/apply/> Meanwhile, please
share the information about the contest in your institution widely. Please
do not hesitate to contact the CZeroC team (Mob: +91-9498070046/ ‚Äãi
nfoczeroc@iitm.ac.in <infoczeroc@iitm.ac.in>) for more details.

Kindly note that the deadline for submitting the CZeroC 2019 application is
July 30th, 2018.

 Kind Regards,
Dr. Indumathi M Nambi‚Äã

content.863:
Subject: Fwd: [Emailer - IIT Dharwad] Crio Summer of Doing - Come join us for real learning & great career opportunities
Text:  CrioSummerOfDoing is a great opportunity for Student Developers who are
looking forward to an Internship-like Micro-Experience which will help you
to learn real software dev skills and get connected with really good
opportunities in startups/product companies, check out the details and
apply: https://crio.do/csod/apply

About Crio.Do (https://crio.do/about-us)


   -

   We are a learn by doing platform for tech, used by developers at leading
   tech companies like Flipkart, VISA, etc.
   -

   Co-founded by Ex-Flipkart and Ex-Google folks and backed by tech
   industry leaders like Binny Bansal (Flipkart, Co-Founder) & others
   -

   Here are some Press releases
   -


      https://tech.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/startups/binny-bansal-udaan-founders-back-crio-a-learning-platform-for-developers/67740952
      )
      -

      https://tracxn.com/explore/India's-Most-Exciting-Startups-of-2018/


About the CSoD (https://crio.do/csod)

#CrioSummerOfDoing is an internship like online Micro-Experience focussed
on real learning and great career opportunities for student developers.

It‚Äôs a nationwide program with limited seats. Selected participants will go
through an internship like online Micro-Experience for 4 weeks (May 27th -
Jun 19th) focussed on market-relevant software engineering skills.

Benefits for participants of CSoD:

   -

   During this program, students will have an opportunity to learn skills
   and apply them to solve real-world problems using the same technology/tools
   used in leading tech companies, along with mentorship from experienced
   developers
   -

   As part of the program, Crio has also lined up an impressive list of
   experts from companies like Flipkart, Google, Uber etc. for students to
   interact
   -

   Students who complete this program successfully will be connected with
   Crio‚Äôs hiring partners like Udaan, CureFit, CRED, Groww etc. for internship
   or full-time job interviews.

Regards,
Sonu Sourav
General Secretary, Technical Affairs

Dear Prasanna ji,

It was a pleasure talking to you yesterday. As discussed please extend the
invitation to all the students of IIT, Dharwad. This will be an eye opener
for all the aspirants. We believe if we can give such kind of exposure to
the people who are aspiring to be Entrepreneurs, it will help them make
that decision much faster. We will appreciate if you can share the list of
students 15-20 aspirants who can be part of the conference.

Sandbox Startups Presents *Startup Dialogue 2019* ‚Äì A one-of-its-kind
Startup conference in North Karnataka.

Startup Dialogue is our flagship event that intends to bring all
stakeholders - entrepreneurs, mentors, Investors, Industry experts under
one roof at Hubballi to boost and co-create the entrepreneurial ecosystem.
The dialogue will feature the likes of *Mr. Narayana Murthy* (Founder,
Infosys); *Dr. Gururaj ‚ÄòDesh‚Äô Deshpande* (Founder, Deshpande Foundation); *Mr.
Ramanan Ramanathan* (Mission Director, Atal Innovation Mission) Mr*. Neeraj
Kakkar, (*CEO, Paper boat)*, Shradha Sharma*, (founder YourStory) and many
more. This year the dialogue will see a convergence of over *250 Startups,
20+ Inspirational speakers, 50+ Mentors, 20+ Investors and over 200 young
tech geeks*.

*Register now on www.startupdialogue.org
<http://www.startupdialogue.org/> to be part of the conference and
experience*

¬∑         *Inspiring panel sessions for Startups from some of the best in
the industry*

¬∑         *Sandbox Challenge - B- Plan competition with Investment
opportunities*

¬∑         *Workshops by experts*

¬∑         *Mentors Clinic - Speed dating  with Investors & Mentors.*

¬∑         *Startup Expo*

We vision to promote and nurture innovative ideas and enterprises that are
willing to penetrate into 70% Indian Untapped market. Over the past 10
years we have promoted over 100 startups through our different programs for
pre-incubation and incubation. Startups incubated with us benefit from an
ecosystem that has well equipped office space with access to product
building capabilities, over 50+ mentors, connected market access,
networking opportunities, funding support and more.

Feel free to write back to us or ring us on +91-9686654749 for more details.

Thanks and Regards

Manjunath Gogi

content.880:
Subject: Team chess tournament
Text: Hello,
I am glad to inform you all that we are organizing an Team chess tournament
from 11th to 14th April, 2019. Three branch wise teams from every year are
invited to participate in the tournament. Each team will consist of 4
players (3 playing + 1 reserve). It will be knockout tournament with a time
control of 30 minutes for each player. Please send the list of players and
the captain of each team by 10 pm tomorrow. The games will be played in the
late evening in the Board Games room in Bhoopali.
Please also give the list by the board order of the team. Once the board
order (correspondence of boards and players) is given, it cannot be
changed. It can only be shifted (if anyone of the 3 players is not playing,
the 4th player can play on the 3rd board only).
The 3 games will be played simultaneously and in case of a draw (1.5 wins
of each team), the result will be decide by a blitz game (5 minutes each)
between the person sitting on the first table of each team.
Hoping to see a great participation from everyone.

Regards,
Shubham Deshpande,
Institute Board Games Secretary.

content.885:
Subject: Swachhta Pakhwada
Text: Guys,

As a part of Swachhta Pakhwada an initiative by the Government of India as
a part of the Swachh Bharat Mission, we are planning to have some
competitions and go around our campus in order to make it clean and garbage
free.

1) *Hostel Cleanliness Competition : *This competiton will judge the
cleanliness of all the apartments, common areas in the hostel and also the
area around the hostel. This competition will be judged by a committee,
this committee can visit anytime *from Monday (10/9/2018) on wards till
Saturday (15/9/2018)*. On Saturday the top *Three* Hostels will be ranked
in an order and these hostels will be given some kind of Reward.

2) *Cleaning the Campus :* To make our campus much more clean and in the
spirit of Swachh Bharat Mission we will go around our hostel from the back
side to the front of the campus. This will be held on *Wednesday
(12/9/2018) at 4 pm*. We will be *starting from the gate in the back of our
campus*. All the are requested to please participate in this event, Lets
make our campus cleanly and better please to live in,


Regards

ASHRITH ADEPU
Gen. Secy Hostel Affairs

content.890:
Subject: Tech plans and Budget for upcoming academic year
Text: Hello everyone,
This is a call for a meeting on *April 12, 2019 (Friday), at 9:00 pm in
Room no 23* for all the tech enthusiasts to discuss the tech plans of IIT
Dharwad. The topics of discussion of the meeting are going to be the
following:
1. Tech Budget
2. Tech Events for next academic year
3. Plan for Summer Projects ( Both Hardware and Software)
4. Inter IIT
5. IIT Dharwad TechFest and Team

I specially request all the technical club/team/project members and
students interested in summer projects to be present there for sure because
the tech budget has to be submitted within a week and I want to ensure that
it represents the voice of all the students. Also, once the budget gets
approved, no additional requests will be entertained anytime in the middle
of the year so be prepared with your plans.
Looking forward to seeing you at the meeting.

Add this meeting to your calendar to get notified automatically (Don't want
to disturb others with my reminder)

Respected Madam/Sir,

Greetings of the day!!

It is my pleasure to inform you that Robotics club of Meerut Institute of
Engineering and Technology (MIET), Meerut is organizing *ROBOCHAMPS‚Äì2K19,* a
National Level Robotics Championship in collaboration with *TechFest
IIT-BOMBAY, Cognizance IIT Roorkee and Team Xenon, *from 29‚Äì31 August 2019. *15
other international teams* will also participate in the event. It is fourth
in this series, with participation from different Institutions across India
and Prize worth *Rs. 1.5 Lakh+.*

*Winners of RoboChamps will directly go in the Semifinals TechFest and
Cognizance. *

Under this, the following competitions will be organized:



*1.         Robowar (35 Kg and 20 Kg) -          The Real fight*

*2.         Drone                                      -          Remote
control Flying Machine*

*3.        Robo Race                              -          Real Race of
Bots*

*4.        Silk Route                               -          The Line
follower Challenge*

*5.        Amphibot                                -          A Bizarre
Competition*

*6.         Robo Soccer                           -          Show your bot
Skills*

*7.        RoboTranspo                          -          Pick and place
robot competition*

*8.        Hackatronics                           -          The Battle of
Intellect*

*9.        Coding Arena                         -          Higher concept
Coding Question*

*10.       Ricochet                                  -          Boost
yourself with games*

*11.       IoT Based Hackathon            -          Innovating Ideas and
Solutions*

*12.      Rev Innovation ‚Äô19             -          Idea Competition (Only
PPT Based presentation)*



For registrations and other details, kindly visit our website:
http://robochampsmiet.com/ to share this with students of other colleges.

 I hereby find an opportunity to invite you and motivate your students to

content.896:
Subject: Paneer Bhurji ingredients in Bhoopali mess : Paneer + egg ??
Text: Dear all,
       Today in Bhoopali mess during breakfast time there was no Paneer
Bhurji
(as usual it is finished). So I was waiting for the second round of Paneer
Bhurji and
observing how they are preparing it. Initially, the cook added a few eggs
into the Kadhai, I thought he may preparing something else however his
second ingredient was paneer. The cook finished his job (god only knows
what he was making). The service boy took that item from Kadhai and served
as Paneer Bhurji.
     I have never seen such kind of Paneer Bhurji (that too vegetarian).
     The mess people are not trustworthy, this time they added eggs any
other time they may add something else.


Regards,
Amitkumar S. Gawas
Ph.D. Scholar IIT Dharwad
Mob. 8237123330

Greetings from Manipal Institute of Technology, Manipal!
Hope you're having a wonderful day.

We're excited to return with the latest edition with our annual technical
fest :
*Techtatva'19 : Embracing Contraries*

Making its first ever appearance this year is the inaugural *Manipal
Hackathon* powered by the Manipal Education and Medical Group [MEMG].

The unique event revolves around *'Social Innovation'* that encompasses
introduction of new ideas and practices which allows us to meet social
needs like Working Conditions,Community Development and Healthcare.

The competition is sure to attract some of the top programmers/coders in
the country as they vie for bragging rights and cash prizes of up to *3
lakhs INR.*




Please find attached the Problems Statements along with the Guidelines and
Judging Criteria for the hackathon.

Join us today to be a part of this exciting opportunity to shape the future.
Registrations open at hackathon.techtatva.in
<http://hackathon.techtatva.in/>
Manipal Hackathon <http://hackathon.techtatva.in/>
The aim behind the hackathon is to solve problems of social innovation
pertaining to various domains using simple programming solutions.
hackathon.techtatva.in

Sincerely,
Outstation Management Team
Techtava'19
Manipal Institute of Technology
