content.915:
Subject: Fwd: Euristica 2019, IIT Indore's Annual Coding Fest.
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Prog Club <progclub@iiti.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 28, 2019 at 12:20 AM
Subject: Euristica 2019, IIT Indore's Annual Coding Fest.
To: <kedark@iitdh.ac.in>


Dear Kedar Khandeparkar,

IIT Indore is organizing its Annual Coding Fest, Euristica'19. We request
you to forward this mail to all the students of your Institute.

Greetings from Team Euristica 2019!

After the grand success of Euristice 2018, we are happy to present the
second iteration of *annual coding fest of IIT Indore, **Euristica*, by The
Programming Club, IIT Indore. We are going to conduct a variety of events
ranging from *Competitive Programming *and *Software Development *to* Cyber
Security *and* Machine Learning*. On the way,  the participants can win
some *amazing prizes worth INR 300K!* We have crafted awesome problems for
all the events and we are sure you will relish every single moment
throughout the fest.

*Duration of the Fest*: From *1st April* to *14th April 2019*;

We have planned the following events:

   - *Divide By Zero 7.0* - Our flagship event, a short duration
   competitive programming contest.
   - *ThreadBit Showcase Hackathon* - A social coding event to build new
   software under the to-be-announced broad themes. Each team can consist of a
   maximum of 4 people.
   - *Byte Bandits Capture the Flag* - A Capture the Flag Competition held
   by Byte Bandits, IIT Indore‚Äôs academic CTF team. The team size for the CTF
   should be a maximum of 4 people.
   - *Cognitia Machine Learning Codesprint* - Participants will be given
   real-world Machine Learning problems, and will have to train their
   computers to understand and model the data, and predict target outputs
   corresponding to unseen inputs.
   - *Code M√©lange 5.0* - A long algorithmic competitive programming
   contest which will test your logical, analytical and algorithmic skills.
   - *Code Golf 5.0* - A coding contest in which shorter is your code,
   better is your score.
   - *Surprise Language 5.0* - A programming contest in which the language
   will be a secret, revealed only 15 minutes before the contest. We will be
   releasing a list of languages 3 days before the contest.
   - *Hack the Code* - A programming contest which tests your debugging
   skills by correcting/debugging the given code for the failing test case(s).
   - *Fool You!* - A unique programming contest, in which thinking for the
   solution might still be easier than understanding the problem!
   - *SOH CAH TOA* - A short-duration mathematical programming contest
   focusing on number theory, probability, combinatorics, modular arithmetic,
   and other interesting math topics.

All the events are conducted online and thus the participants can
participate in the comfort of their rooms. Also to mention again there are
exciting prizes to be won! *The schedule of the events will be available on
our official website - https://euristica.in <https://euristica.in/> *
For more queries, one can contact the events head mentioned on the site
itself, or inbox us on Facebook.

See you on the leaderboard;
*Register Now at https://euristica.in <https://euristica.in/> to get
updates regarding events;*
*We request you to forward this mail to all the students in your Institute.
Also please share the event poster on your club's Facebook page.*
Link to the Facebook Page: *https://www.facebook.com/pclubiiti*
<https://www.facebook.com/pclubiiti/>

*Follow Euristica's Title Sponsor Arcesium to stay posted regarding hiring
for open job positions -*
*Arcesium
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/arcesium/?originalSubdomain=in
<https://www.linkedin.com/company/arcesium/?originalSubdomain=in>*
*Arcesium Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/arcesium
<https://www.facebook.com/arcesium/>*

[image: WhatsApp Image 2019-03-28 at 00.12.36.jpeg]


Happy Coding!

Team Euristica,
IIT Indore.
*https://euristica.in <https://euristica.in/>*


-- 
Thanks,

Kedar Khandeparkar
Dept. Computer Science and Engg.
IIT Dharwad

content.922:
Subject: Selection for Institute Badminton Team
Text: Hello guys,
As you all know inter IIT Sports meet is approaching and we need to
finalise the team and start practising.
As for the freshers, inter IIT Sports meet is an annual sports extravaganza
where teams from all the IITs compete for the top three spots in each sport.
This year the Sports department has decided that both the guys and girls
badminton teams will be representing IIT Dharwad at this competition which
comprises of 4 guys and 2 girls.
The selection for the same will be held at Agricultural University Dharwad
on Sunday 18th August at 10am. I have attached the link to the location of
the court.
Will hope to see many new talented individuals from across the four batches
and the PHD and MS programmes.
PS: Transport will not be provided by college.
https://goo.gl/maps/6aeWcrP71iEGkx867
Thanks and Regards
Rohan Shrothrium
Institute Badminton Secretary

content.930:
Subject: It is very important that you read the Manifestos before you vote.
Text: Hello all,
It is very important that you know whose hands are you putting IIT
Dharwad's, and by that our, future in. We need to know who we are voting
for.
Manifestos are meant to be the power in the hands of the voters as they are
the only means through which the voters can always question the elected
ones. So it is very important that you read the manifestos before voting.

I am contesting for General Secretary for Technical Affairs and here's a
briefing of mine. (The PDF of the manifesto is attached below too)

*************************

MYSELF:

‚óè I have always been an honest and a hardworking person.
‚óè You can also think of me as a very supportive and responsibility taking
friend of yours.


For the Welfare of Students:

‚óè I will ensure that every interested one gets a chance to show their
skills before I select a team for any contest/event, and the fit would be
selected, without any bias.
‚óè I will also ensure that the rest shall be given required training through
workshops, as per their interests.


For the Welfare of the Institute and the Technical Clubs:

‚óè I will make sure that equality has been maintained among all the
technical areas.
‚óè What IIT Dharwad needs is not the best innovator, but the most no. of
innovators. I‚Äôll ensure that the maximum of the interested students get to
participate in the events.


Finally:

‚óè I will make sure that this manifesto stays available with you all so that
you will have the questioning power.
‚óè I‚Äôm not done yet. I will be reaching you people, learning your problems,
searching for solutions and really be looking forward to putting them
forward.

******************************

I encourage you to read all the manifestos before you vote.

Thanking you,
Karthik V V.

content.941:
Subject: End Sem Exams: Health is Indeed Wealth!
Text: Dear Students,

Today I am writing to you with a friendly concern.

Right now you must all be getting knee deep in your end sem preparation.

You're also probably losing sleep, not eating too well, and just more
stressed than usual.
At this time. all I ask of you is to make sure that you take care of
yourself. *Yes, grades are very important, but so is your well-being, both
physical and mental.*

While you're in the middle of all this, I would like to assure you my dear
students that we're here for you.
I would also like to take this opportunity to apprise you of the resources
available exclusively to you as students of IIT Dharwad. You can receive
the right kind of support for free, through YourDOST :

   1. Online text counseling counseling 24x7 from the Experts at
   http://bit.ly/IITDhChatWithAnExpert <http://bit.ly/IITDhChatWithAnExpert>
   2. Telephonic or Video(Skype) sessions with Experts. You can book your
   appointment at http://bit.ly/IITDhBookAnAppointment

So whether you're having difficulty focusing, managing your time, or are
just stressed in general, I request you to make full use of these resources
available to you.

Good luck and Good health to you!


Ridhima

-- 

"I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library."

Ridhima Tewari, Ph.D
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011
Phone: +91 836 221 2843
Website: https://sites.google.com/view/www-ridhimalit-com/home

content.958:
Subject: Wednesday 10 April, Talk - 2, by Prof. Bhavin Kothari on "Design Thinking for Technocrats"
Text: Dear all,

All are cordially invited to attend the following talk.

*Title*: *Design Thinking for Technocrats.*

*Speaker*: Professor Bhavin Kothari
Senior Faculty - Strategic Design Management
NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DESIGN
Gandhinagar 382 007 INDIA

*Room No*. 203
*Date: April 10, 2019 (Wednesday)*
*Time:* 3.30 pm - 4.30 pm

*Abstract*:
Today, India stands at the threshold of dynamic economic growth. To realize
an economically-independent, environmentally-sustainable and socially-
responsible future
requires the support of technically-sound, scientifically-rigorous and
contextually-relevant solutions. This is where the role of design thinking
becomes pivotal.
Design as ‚Äòplanning for change‚Äô is the engine for innovation in all forms.
It cuts across all facets of the innovation ecosystem and connects them
together.
It is a knowledge-intensive activity that spans both
problem-finding-and-formulation and problem solving to ensure development
of feasible solutions that contextually fulfil functionality and improve
the quality of life.

Design Thinking is frequently analogized to business today. It is important
to recognize that Design Thinking is not exclusive to designers or
unattainable to those in another discipline. Design Thinking is an approach
to inquiry and expression that complements and enhances existing skills,
behaviors and techniques.
Leaders are looking to find something new to grasp onto in order to make
sense of what‚Äôs going on and to prepare for a future of unprecedented
uncertainties.

The talk would expose the students to basics of Design Thinking and would
have some hands-on experience to understand design thinking better,
which would help participants shape their career better.

*Speaker Bio:*
Professor Bhavin Kothari is Senior Faculty with Strategic Design Management
discipline at National Institute of Design (NID). His comprehensive
bio-sketch is attached for your reference.

*Participation in large numbers is highly encouraged.*

Thank you,
Sincerely,
Dhiraj.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.
O: 8362212829
content.959:
Subject: Re: Robotics Competition
Text: Hey Guys,
The reason for this mail is that many of you especially from first year
students are asking questions like
1. Will the maze be same in final event?
2. How many tries are allowed?
3. Communication with the robot
4. Starting position and orientation.

Answers:
We have already made these things clear in the rules.
1. Yes. So you guys will have the idea beforehand.
2. We allow only 1 restart at the time of event but you will incur the
penalty as mentioned in the rules.
3. The communications are allowed in so far as the microcontroller may not
be able to store the entirety of your code. In such a case you are allowed
to run the code on your laptops/phones or any such external devices via the
Bluetooth and/or WiFi. The robot is supposed to be completely autonomous. *You
cannot manually control the robot during the event.* Any such control will
lead to disqualification of the team.
You will be allowed unrestrained access to the maze from 10th October
onwards so far as you do not damage it. So you may practice for all the
possible scenarios.
4. The starting position and orientations will be determined on the spot
and will be identical for all the teams. However you may align the robot
yourself in such a way that it follows all the conditions.

*There have been some modifications in the scoring scheme and team rules.
Please go through it.*

 Robotics Competition.docx
<https://drive.google.com/a/iitdh.ac.in/file/d/1TiH_jBEIFOuseJSavyVmzqhOq1E1dBad/view?usp=drive_web>
As you all might be aware, the budgets are limited so I would suggest that
you guys put the construction on hold till the registrations are over.
Also if you face difficulties in coming up with ideas or algorithms for
better performance, you may refer to internet of ask your
seniors/peers/faculties as long as you declare and acknowledge the help
acquired. You put the sources in the code as comments

*We encourage the formation of teams across all branches and batches. You
may even form teams with Ph.D. and M.S. Scholars as well as other B.Tech
students.*

content.961:
Subject: Pre-bid meeting for new tender
Text: Dear all,
It is to inform you that the Institute is in the process of changing the
mess service contractor and tender advertisement regarding the same is
already public. Regarding this, we had a pre-bid meeting for all the
prospective bidders yesterday to explain them the service conditions of
mess and to take their questions regarding different issues. This kind of
pre-bid meetings are important as they work as a medium for information
dissemination regarding mess services so that only serious bidders bid and
we ensure seamless operation of mess services. Few highlight points of the
pre-bid meeting are as follows:
1. All the tender conditions were explained to the prospective bidders and
their questions were also answered if they required some clarification.
2. Provisions regarding rules & regulations, fines, menu, and other
requirements, along with the functioning of the mess, were explained in
detail.
3. Institute administration including student members of the mess committee
was very particular about the timings of the mess services, provision of
the food items during the entire allotted period and 365 days seamless
operation of the mess services.
4. Also, there will be a biometric attendance from next semester. It will
be the mess manager responsibility to conduct the attendance that will help
in the rebate system, that will be applicable from next semester.
5. All the contractors were made aware of the requirements and eligibility
of the mess manager (preferably an MBA), professional behavior of mess
staff along with a proper dress code including gloves and headgear.
6. Need to abide by labour laws, procurement of branded items, etc. were
also explained in detail.

So these were key points about yesterday's pre-bid meeting with all the
prospective bidders. We tried to make them aware of all the rules and our
requirements. We are hopeful to get a good service provider who values the
quality of the service and professional ethics.


-- 
*Yours Sincerely *
*Student Members of the Mess Committee*
*IIT Dharwad*

" Commitment got us started, responsibility shall keep us going. "

content.981:
Subject: Regarding the conduction of Epeolatry, a Word Games Event, next weekend.
Text: Hello everyone,

Are you an avid reader? Want to flaunt your unmatchable vocabulary?
‚ÄòEpeolatry‚Äô is the place for you. Bring along your partner in crime, drown
in this vast ocean and let your grey matter blow out. Play with words,
mingle with ciphers, blow stuff up with your wordy cannons!

*Eunoia*, the Literary Club, IIT Dharwad, takes immense pleasure in
announcing the next event of the *Inter-Branch Cultural General
Championship*, 2019-20, *EPEOLATRY* a Word Games event on 14th and 15th
September, 2019.

Since this is a team event,you will have to participate in *teams of
two. *Since
this is an inter- branch event *both the participants must be from the same
branch. *Based on the number of registrations, there would be a
*prelims* conducted
on *14-09-2019, at 9:00 p.m. *in* Room No 23. *The top 6 teams, two from
every branch,  will advance to the *finals *which will be conducted on*
15-09-2019, i.e., Sunday *at* 2:30 p.m. *in* Room No 23*.

Please fill out the Google form below before *11:59 p.m. on 13-09-2019*,
i.e., *Friday*, to register for the event.
https://forms.gle/bhsJNSLwkPRosmb97

The poster for the event is attached below.

Hoping to see a lot of you turn up!

Regards,
Gowri Y Subedar,
Secretary,
Eunoia

content.992:
Subject: Re: Reg a course on analysis
Text: Dear Biradar,

The prerequisites are minimal. Awareness, though not necessarily mastery,
of basis notions in linear algebra would be helpful. For example, what is a
linear transformation? What is a basis of a vector space?

I intend to begin with the Greeks :), namely that why \sqrt{2} is not
rational, then proceed to discuss the Dedekind's construction of so called
'real' numbers. From there we proceed to study the notions of convergence,
derivative, and integral. Later on we proceed to study the notion of
Riemann integral, its limitations, and its usage in the theory of Fourier
series (elementary). We will study Cauchy integral and its generalisation
as the notion of differential form.  These topics constitute the first
three books of Godement's analysis.  I believe it takes at least 6 months
to go over all these concepts.

I want to emphasise that this so called 'course on analysis' (*which is not
an official course--  no credits, no tests, no assignments) *is not about
learning various techniques in mathematical analysis ( though that comes as
bonus). It is about how various notions like convergence, derivative arise
naturally, and how they force one to perceive the already defined notions
in a much more general framework.

To continue with the previous paragraph, we will look into the fourth
volume of Godement's analysis. It takes at least 6 months to go through
this volume. The first three volumes takes 6 months though. This is because
the fourth volume is highly technical, containing the Lebesgue's notion of
an integral, studying which leads us to consider symmetric spaces, locally
compact groups, etc. Finally in the last chapter of the book, we see the
culmination of all the techniques learned until then, in the theory of
modular forms, L functions, and automorphic forms; these later topics
constitute current research in number theory.

The entire journey takes at least one year, and I believe it is worth
taking at least once in a life time. We will be able to see the importance
of coming up with the right definition in solving a mathematical problem,
in addition to learning various techniques to solve several classical
problems in mathematics.


Kishore


















On Thu, Jun 20, 2019 at 10:18 AM Sushma Biradar <170010032@iitdh.ac.in>
wrote:

> Yours sincerely
> Sushma

>
>> Dear all,
>>
>> (I am Kishore, an assistant professor in the Math. department). This is
>> regarding a meet up for a course on analysis. I intend to discuss the
>> material found in the 4 volumes of "Analysis" by Roger Godement. These
>> books by Godement treats analysis- real, complex or functional- as a single
>> unit; such an exposition enables one to see the existent integrity among
>> seemingly disparate areas of  mathematics.
>>
>> Please let me know whether you would like to attend the lectures. If the
>> count is at least 5, we may go further and plan about the venue and the
>> meeting hours.
>>

>> Kishore.
>>

Kishore.
content.993:
Subject: Reg a course on analysis
Text: Dear all,

(I am Kishore, an assistant professor in the Math. department). This is
regarding a meet up for a course on analysis. I intend to discuss the
material found in the 4 volumes of "Analysis" by Roger Godement. These
books by Godement treats analysis- real, complex or functional- as a single
unit; such an exposition enables one to see the existent integrity among
seemingly disparate areas of  mathematics.

Please let me know whether you would like to attend the lectures. If the
count is at least 5, we may go further and plan about the venue and the
meeting hours.

Sincerely,
Kishore.

content.997:
Subject: A web portal for booking available equipment for research
Text: Dear researchers,

With the intention of linking the researchers and resources, the GoI
initiated a national program called I-STEM (Indian Science Technology and
Engineering facilities Map). As part of this program, a web portal (
https://www.istem.gov.in) has been launched where all the available
equipment/facilities from all the higher educational institutions across
India will be listed and through this portal, any researcher from any
institute can book available equipment for his/her research work.
Registration is a must to get started with this portal, pls see below for
the link:
https://www.i-stem.ac.in/register
The instrument usage charges, available time slots and other details of the
equipment are all displayed as you proceed for the booking of specific
equipment.

This portal is of great help for us till we procure equipments; please make
use of this facility.

Should have any queries in accessing the portal or slot booking etc, pls
feel free to contact me.

Best wishes,
Rajesh




-- 
Dr. Rajeswara Rao Malakalapalli,
Department of Chemistry,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
Dharwad-580011.
Ph: +91 836 2212 834

Text: Dear 2018 Batch students:

Thank you for pre-registering your interests (total registered: so far, 42
students) for a one-credit course
on "Introduction to High-Performance Computing" (HPC) by
Prof. Virendrakumar C. Bhavsar, Honorary Research Professor and Professor
Emeritus, (former Professor and Dean),
Faculty of Computer Science, University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, NB,
E3B 5A3, Canada.

The final & approved course syllabus is attached herewith. The venue of the
course will be Room No. 115.

The schedule of the course (total of 8 hrs lectures) is as follows:

Wed. 6th March:  2.00pm to 3.30pm   and   4.00pm to 5.30pm
Fri. 8th March:  4.30pm to 6.30pm
Wed. 13th March:  2.00pm to 3.30pm   and   4.00pm to 5.30pm

Exam: Fri.15th March:    4.30pm to 6.30pm

Those students who have not pre-registered and wish to take this course,
are required to register using below link before 6th March, 10.00 am.

<https://goo.gl/forms/xLEJ1QV3mNMPF8YC2>

availability
and interests; however, need to fill up the form and attend all lectures.

Thank you for your time.
Sincerely,
Dhiraj.

Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)

On Fri, Jan 25, 2019 at 3:39 PM Dhiraj Patil <dhiraj@iitdh.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear all,
>
> Please go through the attached pdf file as a course syllabus
> for 1 credit course on High-Performance Computing (HPC).
>
> The course is to be delivered by Prof. Virendrakumar C. Bhavsar, Honorary
> Research Professor and Professor Emeritus, (former Professor and Dean),
> Faculty of Computer Science, University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, NB,
> E3B 5A3, Canada.
>
> High-performance computing (HPC) is very important in science,
> engineering, and other applications. Parallel computing is fundamental to
> HPC on PCs, desktops, and servers to supercomputers. This course starts
> with many applications requiring HPC to obtain results and/or carry out
> actions within acceptable times. Subsequently, it gives an overview of
> computer architectures and their implications for developing algorithms and
> programs. An overview of commonly used standards (viz. OpenMP and MPI) for
> parallel programming is given. The course material is presented at a basic
> level so that it would benefit all branches of science and engineering,
> right from the first year to research scholars. Many case studies from
> different applications are included.
>
> If you are interested to credit this course, please do the pre-registration
> for the course. You may consult your faculty-advisor or talk to me or
> Prof. Rajsekhar from CSE.
>
> Below is the pre-registration link.

>

> Sincerely,

Subject: Invitation to IUPC Online Round!!!
To: <160010015@iitdh.ac.in>


Hi

Greetings from LNMIIT!

We are delighted to invite you to the Inter-University Programming Contest
organised by The LNM Institute of Information Technology ‚Äì Jaipur, during
the two-day Techno-Management-Literary Fest Plinth'19  to be held on
19th‚Äì20th January 2018.

The contest shall be a great opportunity for students to whet their
programming aptitude. This national level programming contest shall assess
their intelligence through various rounds:  the first round will be held
online on 6th January 2019 and further onsite rounds will be held during
Plinth'19 (19th‚Äì20th January 2019).


The key details of IUPC'19 are as follows:

    1. The first online round of the contest will be held on 6th January
2019 (Sunday) 9 PM onward.

    2. Contest duration will be 5 hours.

    3. Team with a maximum of  3 members is allowed.

    4. All the members must be from the same institute.

    5. The contest will be held on www.codechef.com

content.1001:
Subject: OSS - Open Student Society
Text:  Open Student Society - Launch


[image: IIT Dharwad Logo]






A community where people of
all ages, branches, genders and walks
of life can build awesome open-sourced projects



Register For PyDay
(More details below) <https://goo.gl/3A1gvx>




*Greetings!*

We are proud to announce the beginning of a new community in our college, *OSS
‚Äì Open Student Society*, to unite developers and promote technical
activities in our institute.

Our last event, DevHack 2019, clearly showed the true potential of our
students and it is this inspiration, derived from you, that led us to
spear-head this initiative in the name ‚ÄòOSS‚Äô. We keenly look forward to
your active participation in our future endeavours and would really
appreciate to know your ideas for this community as well.

OSS is mainly focused:
- To provide a platform for students with similar interest to work together
on projects.
- To help students to be part of the open-source ecosystem.
- To organise workshops, seminars, and hackathons to keep students up to
date with latest technologies.

*To know more, visit our website right here <https://oss2019.github.io>.*

We are looking forward to more mentors who would like share knowledge of
their tech stack. To join us as a mentor, click here <https://goo.gl/wYSnLK>.


PyDay 2019 To continue the growing trend of technical affairs in our
community, we would like to invite those interested to our next event,
PyDay, a Beginner-to -Pro Python workshop. For more details, and
registration, please visit this link <https://goo.gl/3A1gvx>.




[image: OSS Logo] <https://oss2019.github.io>
oss@iitdh.ac.in
<https://github.com/oss2019>

content.1004:
Subject: Tech Meeting: The overview
Text: It was great to interact with you all and I thank all those who could make
for it. Important points of discussion:

*Budget:*
Everyone is welcome to submit a proposal for the technical equipment one
needs, in the format provided here
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R10TplNsP6oMwU_J5QCcQmfjnE2lyHofNUmUdioTDQI/edit?usp=sharing>
. The deadline for submission is  *(Tuesday) April 16, 2019, 11:59 pm*.
Submit your proposal through this form <https://forms.gle/Nw3zJMfkPahz4WcE9>
. Make sure to do good homework before submission otherwise it is liable to
rejection.


*Summer/Semester Projects:*
For summer, we have both hardware and software projects this time.

*Software*
All software projects will be uploaded to GitHub soon and all conversation
will happen on Gitter channel only (Join our Gitter Channel here
<https://gitter.im/oss2019/community>). All repos will have one or more
mentor who will look after the repo and help you get started. The
technology that will be covered in this summer for the software domain are:
1. Android
2. Node JS
3. Django
4. Security and Penetration testing
5. Bots
6. Flutter ( One app for both Android and iOS)
7. ML and DL
8. Web Development
    more to come........

All these projects could be found here <https://github.com/oss2019> .
Contributors are free to switch between projects but are recommended to
stick to one. Contact info of mentors is present in the repo itself for any
assistance.

*Hardware*
For hardware, we need the list of students who are willing to stay here in
IIT during summer. Either you can work on your project or choose from the
one proposed today. Instead of having a mentor-mentee format, this time we
would like both of them to work together as a team. But there will be a POC
for each project which could be decided by mutual consent of the team
members. For more information contact Vihang Puranik and Rohan Savakar.
Those who are planning to stay during the summer, please fill this form
<https://forms.gle/7MifvocieyWX321U7> .

*Technical Awards*
From coming year, we are planning to have Technical awards so that your
contributions do not go unrecognized. Soon, the names of awards with
complete description will be provided.* Students are requested to report
each technical activity they take part in to @GSTech*, like workshops,
hackathons, technical conference, etc. so that other people could know
about it. The activity may also include achievements like GSoC, Developer
Leads of different organizations, an invitation for a guest
lecture/workshop, etc.

*InstiGo *
An app for hostel management which covers mess, academia, hostel, and other
fields. This app is currently present in the Android platform only but
possibly by the next semester will be present across all platforms (
Android, iOS, and Web). The app is currently in development mode and apk
could be found here
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-UCEAZSIDWyXEhDonA1Z6w8BrccAe-9Q>.Those
who are interested can contact me directly.

Let's try to make our IIT one of rapidly growing IITs in technology ( what
is it known for). All this can be possible only with your combined support
and you can always count on me for any technical support.

Regards,

Sonu Sourav
General Secretary, Technical Affairs
IIT Dharwad

content.1012:
Subject: Are you giving in to these habits that amplify stress?
Text: Dear All,

Sharing a set of habits most of us are quite fond of. Turns out, they are
adding to our stress levels.
Happy reading and pondering!



Ridhima






> *|MC_PREVIEW_TEXT|*
>
> <https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=HabitsStress&yd_term=19>
>
> <https://yourdost.com/?yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=HabitsStress&yd_term=19>
>
> It's vacation time. Would it be fair to say that you're probably using
> this time to relax a bit? We're sure it's well deserved. At this time, when
> we're trying to de-stress, we may unknowingly give in to habits which tend
> to work as stress amplifiers. Could you be giving in to any of these? Find
> out here:
> *1. Night Outs*
> Staying up till very late in the night to catch-up on your favourite
> series or movies is quite the norm. But studies show that adequate sleep is
> essential to feeling awake and alert, even in the long run. Sleep helps
> the brain process and consolidate learned information. So maybe try not to
> sleep too late and watch the remaining episodes sometime in the day.
> *2. Caffeine*
> Caffeine consumed at odd hours or in excessive quantities interferes with
> sleep. Studies show that caffeine consumed 6 hours before bedtime
> reduces total sleep time by 1 hour. So be mindful of your consumption of
> coffee, tea, chocolates, energy drinks, etc.
> *3. Messy Room*
> Clutter creates stress that has two major biological and neurological
> effects on us‚Äîincrease in the levels of cortisol, a stress hormone, and
> restricting our brain‚Äôs capacity to relax. So tidying up your room may be a
> good idea right now.
> *4. Couch Potato*
> No matter how busy you are, try to squeeze at least 30 minutes of some
> physical activity into your schedule. Put on those running shoes, go for a
> walk or play a few rounds of your favourite sport, or swim for a while.
> Exercise has some direct stress-busting benefits and regulates emotions.
> *5. No Showers*
> Well, let's be honest, a lot of us can admit that we're guilty of skipping
> showers. The fact is that a quick shower will make you feel less drowsy and
> lethargic. So go on, soak up.
>
> *So, what do you think? Can you avoid these habits? Not so tough right? If
> you need help in overcoming them, we're here for you -*
>
>
> connect to an expert now
> <https://yourdost.com/chatSession/?workgroup=demo@workgroup.chat.yourdost.com&yd_source=IITDh_NL&yd_medium=IITDhMail&yd_campaign=HabitsStress&yd_term=19>
>
> If you have any further doubts, concerns, queries, or simply want to say
> hi, drop us a mail at campus@yourdost.com.
> Always here for You,
> *Team YourDOST*
>


-- 

"I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library."

Ridhima Tewari
Assistant Professor (English)
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011
Phone: +91 836 221 2843

content.1014:
Subject: Fwd: National Conference on ‚ÄúDisability and Social Inclusion ‚Äì The Role of Technology‚Äù
Text: wbw
Prasanna
----
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: NationalConference NILD <ncnild2019@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, 6 Dec 2018 at 1:33 PM
Subject: National Conference on ‚ÄúDisability and Social Inclusion ‚Äì The Role
of Technology‚Äù
To: <director@iitdh.ac.in>



To,

Prof. P Seshu

Director

Indian Institute Of Technology Dharwad


Sub: National Conference on ‚ÄúDisability and Social Inclusion ‚Äì The Role of
Technology‚Äù



Sir,



National Institute for Locomotor Disabilities (Divyangjan), (NILD) Kolkata,
under the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
(Divyangjan), Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India is
going to organize a *Two-Days **National Conference on ‚ÄòDisability and
Social Inclusion ‚Äì The Role of Technology‚Äô on 10th & 11th January, 2019 in
collaboration with IIT, Guwahati. The venue of the conference will be at
the premises of IIT-Guwahati, **Surjyamukhi Road, North, Amingaon,
Guwahati, Assam- 781039.*



The Conference will be inaugurated by *Hon‚Äôble Cabinet Minister Shri
Thawaar Chand Gehlot**, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment,
Government of India* on 10th Jan 2019 from 9.30 A.M, The Secretary, Joint
Secretary of the Department and other central & state government officials
will also grace the occasion.



      The Conference will bring together stake holder working in the area
of Technology for the Divyangjan including Scientists, Researchers,
Engineers, Doctors, Rehabilitation Professionals (Physiotherapists,
Occupational therapists, P&O Professionals, Social Scientists,
Psychologists, Vocational Counsellors, Rehabilitation Nurses and Special
Educators), GOs, NGOs, Civil Rights Advocates & give them the opportunity
to share latest findings in the field of Technology for Divyangjan. A
comprehensive program has been planned to cover Technology for all types of
Disabilities under RPWD Act 2016. It covers more than 30 speakers from
IIT/NIT/Central Research Institute/Institute of National Importance and
more than 50 research papers under free paper categories.



We shall be highly obliged if you arrange a wide circulation regarding the
conference in your Institution and allow your officials/faculties/Research
Scholars and students to participate, present prototype/concept if any or
present paper and exchange their views.



Guest house or Hostel accommodation will be provided within the premises of
IIT, Guwahati on first-come first-served basis. All other details including
program brochure are available in our website www.niohkol.nic.in



Thanking you,


Yours faithfully,

Dr. A. Biswas

Director

NILD Kolkata


--

content.1020:

content.1027:
Subject: Regarding Inter-IIT Tech Meet 2018
Text: Hi all.
I hope everyone is enjoying their vacations to the full extent!

IIT Dharwad participated in the just concluded 7th Inter-IIT Tech Meet held
at IIT Bombay. We had a contingent size of 30 students, participating in 6
competitions and had members from all the 3 departments and all 3 years.
It gives me immense pleasure to announce to all of you that our team, which
participated in the BeTiC Innovation challenge, wherein we made a
system/device to stabilize Parkinson's tremors, won the* Silver Medal* for
the same.
Also, our team, which participated in the Coding Hackathon, bagged the *4th
position out of 23 IIT's.*
Even the first year students, who were the youngest participants in their
event,did a great job and got applauds for their great efforts.
All the other team members gave their best, in their respective events.
All said and done, we can improve our performance in the upcoming Inter-IIT
Tech Meets and slowly break the stereotype that only the older IIT's are
the best. I believe if our efforts are given the right direction, we can
achieve great heights.

Keep the nerdy and tinkering bug alive in you!
Happy Thinking!
-- 
Samveed Desai
General Secretary, Technical Affairs

Subject: Fwd: Invite to Enigma and IUPC - Plinth 2019
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Cybros LNMIIT <cybros.plinth19.14@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, Dec 27, 2018, 11:08
Subject: Invite to Enigma and IUPC - Plinth 2019
To: <160010015@iitdh.ac.in>


Hi,

Greetings from *Cybros*!

We are delighted to invite you to participate in the *two-day
Techno-Management-Literary Fest Plinth'19* to be held on *19th-20th January
2019 *at *The LNM Institute of Information Technology, Jaipur**.*

*Cybros - The Computer Club* is organizing two events in *collaboration
with Codechef* involving an online qualifier round, followed by the onsite
final round.

Below mentioned are the details of the events:

*ENIGMA* - The solo coding contest for the masterminds who perform best
alone. This contest will test the participant's skills on two levels: The
*online qualifier **round *which will be being held on *5th January
2019* followed
by the onsite round on *20th January 2019.*

*IUPC* - The Inter-University Programming Contest is modeled on the
*world-famous
ACM ICPC contest!* Our flagship event - it surely is a great opportunity
for students to sharpen their programming skills. This contest has seen
participation by some of the *best teams across the country* and hopes to
continue seeing such enthusiasm. Teams will have to qualify the *first
online round* which will be held on *6th January 2019* to participate in
the onsite round on *19th January 2019.*

The onsite round for both the contests will be* at the LNMIIT during
Plinth'19 (on January 19-20, 2019)*.

*To stay updated with the latest details of these contests please fill in
the below mentioned Google Form:-*
*https://goo.gl/forms/zjQ96xwKtFcg18Fb2
<https://goo.gl/forms/zjQ96xwKtFcg18Fb2>*

*To stay updated with the details of the dates and prizes, please do fill
the form above.*

*PFA, the rules and posters for both events.*

We take pleasure in inviting your esteemed institution to participate and
be a part of this much-awaited contest.

For further details, feel free to visit https://www.plinth.in/.

*In case of queries, feel free to contact:*

*Vrinda Goel *- +91 8003890410

See you at the contest arena.

content.1037:
Subject: Re: Cycle parking at non-designated spots
Text: Dear security supervisor,

May be its true that you are facing some kind of problem but I want to tell
that you cannot give us such a warning that you would "deflate cycle". I
think by threatening like this you crossed your limits.You claimed that it
has been "decided" to deflate our cycles,I request you reveal identity of
person, so that we can go and talk to concerned person.
Also I don't think there are any official institute rules for a petty thing
like parking cycles. Even if there are such rules I don't think institute
will give you right deflate our cycles as it is student property. The way,
we don't have right to destroy college property and we would be fined if we
do so,  on same lines even you cant destroy our property.
And I don't think I ever received any mail regarding this issue although it
was claimed that various requests are made to refrain.
I think you should arrange a guard near cycle stand who takes care of  all
this like in all other public places instead of sending  aggressive mails
to students.Please remember that we are students of this college and not
some random uncivilized people. I hope things would be dealt with empathy
and in a refined  and considerate manner from now.
Thanking you.
Regards
T.Varshha
160010027
CSE- VI semester

content.1038:
Subject: Cycle parking at non-designated spots
Text: Dear All,

This is to inform that, many students have been found parking cycles in a
haphazard manner which gives a shabby outlook to campus and depicts scant
regard to the institute rules. This has been state of affairs in spite of
various request to refrain.

In order to ensure compliance it has now been decided that cycles must only
be parked at designated spots in an organised manner. Cycles found
parked/kept at non-designated spots will be deflated.


 Thanks & Regards,
Security Supervisor

content.1057:
Subject: Invited Talk by Dr. Barendra Kumar Bhoi on "Goods and Services Tax: Biggest Indirect Tax Reforms in India" 13/03/2018
Text: Dear All,


You are cordially invited to a talk titled "Goods and Services Tax: Biggest
Indirect Tax Reforms in India", by Dr. Barendra Kumar Bhoi.

The details of the talk are as follows:

Venue: Room No. 23, Ground Floor
Date: 13th March, 2018 (Tuesday)


The talk will be followed by a discussion with the resource person.

I look forward to your participation,



Thanks and Regards,
Ridhima



About Dr. Bhoi:

Dr Bhoi obtained his Ph.D. in Economics from the Indian Institute of
Technology Bombay in 1997 on the topic ‚ÄúFinancial Innovations and the Issue
of Instability in the Demand for Money in India‚Äù. His association and work
at the Reserve Bank of India dates back to 1984. Dr. Bhoi was the Principal
Adviser and Head of the Monetary Policy Department (MPD), Reserve Bank of
India, responsible for implementing the new monetary policy framework -
Flexible Inflation Targeting (FIT) in India and resolving transitional
problems. He has also deliberated and published on critical economic issues
in  Quantitative Journal of Economics, RBI Occasional Papers, as well as in
the Economic and Political Weekly.




--

content.1060:
Subject: Dedicated Service Award to Prof. C. Amarnath
Text: Dear Students,

Please join me in congratulating Prof. Amarnath for being awarded Dedicated
Service Award for his love and passion for mechanisms by International
Federation for the Promotion of Mechanisms and Machine Science.

It is a great privilege that, we at IIT Dharwad, are benefitting from his
vast wealth of knowledge and experience.

Yours sincerely,
Prabhu





---------------------------- Original Message ----------------------------
Subject: [Faculty-notices] Congratulations to Prof. Amarnath
From:    "Dean Faculty" <dean.fa@iitb.ac.in>
Date:    Sun, December 23, 2018 9:24 am
To:      faculty-notices@iitb.ac.in
Cc:      director@iitb.ac.in
         pro@iitb.ac.in
         awards@ircc.iitb.ac.in
         dean.fa.office@iitb.ac.in
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

========================================
If you reply to mails received from this list, please take care **NOT**
to send a copy to faculty-notices.
========================================
Dear Colleagues,

I am happy to inform you that Prof Amarnath (Mechanical Engineering) has
been awarded a Dedicated Service Award for his love and passion for
mechanisms by International Federation for the Promotion of Mechanisms and
Machine Science.
At IIT Bombay, Professor Amarnath pursued his passion for Mechanisms
throughout his career, his early efforts on organising ‚ÄòYantriki‚Äô, a
competition of machines at IIT Bombay, where students all over India would
build and compete with their machines has inspired millions to work using
their hands. This award is the testimonial.

Congratulations to Prof. Amarnath

-- 
Krishna P. Kaliappan
Dean (Faculty Affairs)


IMPORTANT !! PLEASE READ BELOW
________________________________________

The faculty-notices mailing list is meant for dissemination
of official notes/announcements. By default only some
Institute functionaries can post messages to this list.

If your mail does not fall into the category of an official
notice, it is likely to be rejected.

The mailing list seminar@iitb.ac.in is
meant for announcing seminars, lectures etc. The list events@iitb.ac.in is
meant to carry all general
events announcements. All discussions, non-official and faculty
related announcements, greetings etc may please be sent to
discuss-faculty@iitb.ac.in.
_______________________________________________
Faculty-notices@iitb.ac.in mailing list

content.1062:
Subject: Fwd: LIMIT - AN INTERNATIONAL MATHEMATICS COMPETITION
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: LIMIT 2019 <limit.isibangalore@gmail.com>
Date: Sun, Mar 10, 2019 at 2:16 PM
Subject: LIMIT - AN INTERNATIONAL MATHEMATICS COMPETITION
To: <svprabhu@iitdh.ac.in>


Respected Sir/Madam,
We, the students community of Indian Statistical Institute, Bangalore would
like to inform you that we are organizing LIMIT, an international online
mathematics competition, for high schoolers and undergraduates.
LIMIT will provide a platform to the entire students community to compete
against each other and to assess themselves respective to their
contemporaries throughout the world. We would like to request you to
encourage your students to take part in this competition to get an exposure
to the world of Mathematics. We want to promote a culture of Mathematics in
our country, and we feel LIMIT is a great platform for it.

LIMIT Website: www.isibang.ac.in/~limit

**The last date of registration has been extended to 18th March, 2019**

Few necessary details about LIMIT are provided below:

   - The competition will be held in April, 2019. All the necessary dates
   are in our official website. Last date of registration is 18th March, 2019.
   - There is no venue restriction, candidates can appear from anywhere,
   even from their homes.
   - Candidates will receive participation certificates, certificates of
   merit based on performance.
   - We will invite around 50 students based on their performance to a
   mathematics camp to interact with world famous mathematicians from India.
   - Toppers will receive cash prizes and exciting goodies.


As our aim is to reach out to the entire students community who would wish
to participate in LIMIT, we would be grateful to you if you kindly forward
this message to the students community of your institute.
We are attaching two posters of LIMIT along with this e-mail. Kindly
circulate them as well.

For any query or further details, visit our website www.isibang.ac.in/~limit,
or feel free to contact us at-
Udvas Das- 9739562795
Nidhi Talwar- 9820207100
Aritra Mandal- 8777042400
or via email at limit.isibangalore@gmail.com

Thanking you,
Yours sincerely,
Aritra Mandal
LIMIT Coordinator

content.1066:
Subject: Teachers day
Text: Dear All,

A gentle reminder for the same.

You are all cordially invited to the Teacher's day celebration on Thursday,
5th September 2019.

 As part of the function,  Dr. R R Sonde, Executive Vice President --
Innovation & Technology, Thermax will deliver a lecture on the following
topics:

*a. Emerging new pathways in energy and environment and exciting
developments in clean energy and transport.*
*b. Insights on the creation of ideas and their fast-forwarding concept to
commerce.*

The details of the event are as follows:
Venue: Room No. 23
Date: 5th September 2019
Time: 2:00pm (function begins)
The lecture begins at 2: 15 pm

Hope to see you all there!

About the speaker:

Dr. Sonde joined the Thermax Management Council as Executive Vice President
- Innovation & Technology in 2007.

A Ph. D. from IIT, Mumbai, Dr. Sonde comes to Thermax after an illustrious
25-year career with the Department of Atomic Energy.

He was awarded the Dr. Homi Bhabha Gold Medal by the Prime Minister in
2006, for his outstanding contributions in the field of nuclear energy. A
Member of the Department of Science & Technology's Scientific Advisory
Committee, Dr. Sonde continues to serve as a member on the IIT Senate
Committee. Since 2004, he had been heading the R&D and Energy Technologies
Centre of NTPC.

At Thermax, Dr. Sonde is currently developing and nurturing the Research,
Technology & Innovation Center (RTIC).

Hope to see you there.

Thanks and Regards,
Mehul Bose
General Secretary, Cultural Affairs
IIT Dharwad

faculty@iitdh.ac.in>
Cc: Academic Staff <academicstaff@iitdh.ac.in>, Assistant Registrar
Academic <aracademic@iitdh.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Please find enclosed the *provisional* rules and regulations of B.Tech
Programme.
Kindly go through the rules carefully and plan your courses for next
semester accordingly.* If there are any doubts about these rules, kindly
contact only your faculty advisor.* No response would come if your mail is
sent to Dean (AP) or Academic Staff or AR academic.
* All the doubts are to be clarified through Faculty advisors only.  *

In case, if you do not know who is your faculty advisor, the list is
available in the following link
http://iitdh.ac.in/academics_FacultyAdvisors.php

Your faculty advisor is providing a presentation on these rules on 1st
August 2019 at 10 AM with a venue announced by him. I would request class
representative to coordinate this presentation.

Yours sincerely,
Prabhu

content.1085:
Subject: INTER BRANCH FOOTBALL TOURNAMENT.
Text: Hey Guys,
It gives me immense pleasure to announce that our college will be
organizing INTER BRANCH FOOTBALL TOURNAMENT next weekend (14-15 Sept.).
The guidelines for the tournament are as follows:

   - Each Team (CSE, ME ,EE) will play one match against other two
   opponents.
   - Point System: Winning team gets 3 points. In case of a Draw, each team
   gets 1 point.
   - After the league matches, the top two teams will play the FINAL. (In
   case of equal points, Goal Difference will be the deciding factor.)
   - Each team can have maximum of 16 players. (11 + Substitutions).
   - Every team must have atleast 3 players from each year.
   - In the playing 11, there must be atleast 2 players from each year
   throughout the game.
   - Rolling Substitution will be followed.
   - The squad for each team will be decided by their respective Captains.

Further details about the Match duration and KIck-Off time will be informed
later.
Hoping for maximum participation and Great enthusiasm.

Regards,
Zahid Pathan.
Football Secretary.

content.1093:
Subject: Co-Op program IIT Dharwad
Text: Hello everyone,

I would like to inform you about the Co-Op program that our institute has
started
under which a student may work up to a year on an industry-defined project.
This will ensure that the work done is something substantial.

Generally, students are physically available at the industry campus during
the summer (May to July) and winter (December) for internships.

*According to the Co-Op programme*, the student may continue to work on the
project while being present in the IITDh campus during her/ his seventh
semester (August to November ) and eighth semester (January to April ). The
work done during these semesters will also earn the student credits as part
of the academic curriculum. Further details are attached.

Regards,
CDC Support
Ashutosh Agarwal
Abhishek R
IIT Dharwad
content.1094:
Subject: Regarding Special Lunch/Dinner
Text: Hi all,
This mail is to inform you all that, we'll not have any Special
Lunch/Dinner tomorrow.
Because in meeting today with Dean Student Welfare and Mess Warden. We were
told that the additional money of these meals (Approx 250 Rs per Lunch or
Dinner) is deducted from our mess advance fee only. ( i.e it's not like
Institute is paying for it)

*Additional Info*:-We were told in meeting that *a student's/day mess cost
is roughly 200 Rs*. That makes it *24000 Rs per sem. *For now, it seems
Institute is managing the cost so if we arrange a special meal the
additional charges will be surely on our pockets.
*Note*: It is roughly 200 Rs(not exact info).

 So, we want to know your decision whether you would like to have Special
Lunch/Dinner or not on upcoming festives.
Click here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfczABFSIiKupF4R1JfPGixIeaopFCt7gXk1dBMVRJ7SVqa2Q/viewform?usp=sf_link>
to
fill the form.
Deadline to fill form 16-Aug-19 till 5:00 pm.

-- 
*Yours Sincerely *
*Student Members of the Mess Committee*
*IIT Dharwad*

content.1095:
Subject: Wednesday Student Talk 2.30 PM room 23
Text: Dear Students,

Mr Sai Anuroop, second year student of CSE will give the STUDENT TALK
this week - on

         Wednesday, January 9, 2018 at 2.30 PM

            in classroom 23.

He will tell about the Radio Astronomy school in Pune which he attended
in December, the project he did (for which his Group was awarded
the first prize) and his frank views on the School.
There will also be discussion on possible Summer Internship programmes
(for some of which we are already late!).

I  urge you to attend the talk.
That might help some of you plan your summer Internship.

I am enclosing a Soft Copy of the Poster of the talk.


Irrespective of your grades, if you cannot present yourself clearly
in oral form during the Campus Interview around this September or
in written form when you apply for job or highr studies,
you will definitely be at a disadvantage.



D Narasimha

content.1098:
Subject: Fwd: LIMIT : An International Academic Event
Text: Dear All,
Indian Statistical Institute is hosting a mathematical contest.
Undergraduates (as well school going students from eight standard on wards)
can appear. You can contemplate to appear for the contest.
Amlan
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: LIMIT CONTEST <limit.isibangalore@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, Feb 21, 2019 at 3:16 AM
Subject: LIMIT : An International Academic Event
To: <abarua@iitdh.ac.in>


Respected Sir/Madam,

We, the students community of Indian Statistical Institute, Bangalore would
like to inform you that we are organizing LIMIT, an international online
mathematics competition, for high schoolers and undergraduates.

LIMIT will provide a platform to the entire students community to compete
against each other and to assess themselves respective to their
contemporaries throughout the world. We would like to request you to
encourage your students to take part in this competition to get an exposure
to the world of Mathematics. We want to promote a culture of Mathematics in
our country, and we feel LIMIT is a great platform for it.

Few necessary details about LIMIT are provided below:

   - The competition will be held in April,2019. All the necessary dates
   are in our official website. Last date of registration is 10 March,2019.
   - There is no venue restriction, candidates can appear from anywhere.
   - Candidates will receive participation certificates, certificates of
   merit based on performance.
   - We will invite around 50 students based on their performance to a
   mathematics camp to interact with world famous mathematicians from India.
   - Toppers will receive cash prizes and exciting goodies.


As our aim is to reach out to the entire students community who would wish
to participate in LIMIT, we would be grateful to you if you kindly forward
this message to the students community of your institute.

We are attaching two posters of LIMIT along with this e-mail. Kindly
circulate them as well.

For any query or further details, feel free to contact us at-
Udvas Das- 9739562795
Nidhi Talwar- 9820207100
Aritra Mandal- 8777042400
or via email at limit.isibangalore@gmail.com

Thanking you,
Yours sincerely,

Aritra Mandal
LIMIT Coordinator

content.1100:
Subject: Reminder: Announcement of Physics Lecture on April 15th, 2019; from 2 to 3 PM: Room-119.
Text: Dear All,

This is a gentle reminder for today's Physics Seminar at 2:00PM.

All are welcome.

Yours Truly,
R. Prabhu

On Wed, Apr 10, 2019 at 1:50 PM Dr. R. Prabhu <prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> This is to announce a Physics Lecture as per following details:
>
> *****************************************************************
> Speaker: *Dr. Rajasekhar Medapalli*
>                 Postdoctoral Researcher,
>                 University of California in San Diego, USA.
>
> Date.     : *15 April 2019 (Monday)*
>
> Time.     : *2:00 to 3:00 PM*
>
> Venue.   : *Room No. 119*
>
> Title: *Towards the next generation data storage technology: Ultrafast
> optical control of magnetic materials*
>
> *Abstract: *The study of all-optical control of materials mainly
> involveswith exploiting interactions amongst the fundamental reservoirs of
> energy and angular momentum in materials:charge, spin and lattice. The
> interaction of femtosecond laser pulse with magnetic material triggers
> transfer of energy from the electrons into spin and lattice systems. The
> developments in various time-resolved pump-probe techniques allowed us to
> explore such interactions between these reservoirs, in metals, that occur
> at sub-picosecond to picosecond timescales. Investigating the interactions
> at ultrashort timescales is a key to obtain control over many phenomena
> such as ultrafast demagnetization, laser-induced magnetization reversal
> (all-optical switching), super-diffusive spin-transport, and even
> laser-induced magnetic phase-transition. My research goal is to explore
> mechanisms involving the aforementioned phenomena in advanced magnetic
> materials suitable for energy efficient spintronic technologies operating
> at terahertz (THz) frequencies.
>
> In my talk, I will address potential mechanisms involving the helicity
> (circular polarization)-independent and helicity-dependent all-optical
> switching (AOS) processes in both ferrimagnetic GdFeCo and ferromagnetic
> Co/Pt thin film systems. It has been demonstrated, in metallic magnets,
> that the loss of spin ordering to the laser excitation, i.e., ultrafast
> demagnetization triggers a flow of spin-polarized current oscillating at
> terahertz frequencies, which will eventually be converted to THz charge
> current when a heavy metal layer is placed next to the magnetic layer. I
> will present the laser-driven THz-signals, in Co/Pt bilayers, and their
> sensitivity to varied roughness, crystal structure, and intermixing at the
> interface. Finally, I will discuss the timescales of laser-induced
> phase-transition from antiferromagnetic to ferromagnetic phase in FeRh.
> Excitation of antiferromagnetic FeRh/Pt bilayer by femtosecond laser pulses
> results in an efficient emission of nearly single cycle THz pulse being an
> evidence for laser-induced changes of the magnetization in FeRh. The study
> based on double pump THz-emission spectroscopy technique reveals that the
> laser-induced phase-transition emerges at sub-nanosecond timescale, the
> speed that yields a further control over phase-transition by means of both
> temperature and applied magnetic field.
>
> *Succinct information about the speaker: *Dr. Rajasekhar Medapalli is a
> postdoctoral researcher at the Center for Memory and Recording Research,
> University of California San Diego. His research mainly focuses on the
> all-optical control of (magnetic-)materials at nanometer length scales. He
> also fabricates rare-earth thin films based spintronic devices suitable for
> terahertz spintronics.Dr. Medapalli received his Ph.D. in Physics from
> Radboud University Nijmegen in 2014 focusing on efficient optical control
> of magnetization dynamics in metallic alloys. Prior to this, he received
> his M.Tech degree (Nanotechnology) from Amity University in 2009 and M.Sc
> degree (Physics) from Andhra University in 2007.
>
> *****************************************************************
>
> ALL ARE WELCOME.
>
> Thanking you.
>
> Yours truly,
> R. Prabhu
>
> --
> Dr. R. Prabhu
> Assistant Professor,
> Department of Physics,
> Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
> Dharwad - 580011,
> Karnataka, INDIA.
>
> Email: prabhurama@iitdh.ac.in
> Phone: 0091 836 2212 851 (Office)
>
> Webpage: https://www.sites.google.com/site/prabhurama/
>


-- 
Dr. R. Prabhu
Assistant Professor,
Department of Physics,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad,
Dharwad - 580011,
Karnataka, INDIA.

content.1105:
Subject: Talk on 6th April on Engineering Design:Text Book to Practice
Text: Dear all

We are going to have an interaction session /mini seminar today at 4:30 pm
in room no 23.
Interaction will be mainly about practical applications of text book
knowledge over the course of vehicle designing. We will get overview of
first principals of engineering design and its application.

Topic of discussion:

   1. Material Selection
   2. Understanding Material Properties
   3. Electric vehicle dynamics 101
   4. Practical Qualitative Structure analysis

Orator is Mr. Mahek Mody . He has done B.tech and M.tech in Mechanical
engineering from IIT Bombay He is chief of staff at Ather energy,a
Bangalore based Electric Vehicle Startup which recently launched its first
product the Ather 450.

This may be most relevant to ME students but is basic enough to for any
engineering undergrad to have interest.
This interaction can help you in choosing better opportunity.

Subject: Google India: Tech Intern Connect
Text: Hello,

Summer couldn‚Äôt have gotten better for us! Google is hosting an Intern
Connect for Tech interns on 29 June, 2019.

If you are interested to network with Googlers, fellow interns, learn more
about Google‚Äôs culture & are able to attend the event in
Bangalore/Gurgaon/Hyderabad/Mumbai, please register via the form mentioned
below.

If you are shortlisted to attend the event (there are limited seats), a
confirmation will be sent to you. The registration link and event details
are mentioned below, last date to register is 16 June, 2019.
------------------------------

Google India: Tech Intern Connect

When

DATE: 29 June  (Saturday)

TIME: 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM

Registration Form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc8hH0loErD_tXBuuVCXJTD3Khoxxh72Och8MU2d2_ecRBBmg/viewform>

Where

LOCATION : Google Offices in Hyderabad, Gurgaon, Mumbai and Bangalore.

Eligibility & Other Criteria

-You need to be an intern and currently pursuing your engineering (Computer
Science related fields), graduating in 2020/2021.

-The event is on 29 June 2019, Saturday from 8:30 AM - 4:00 PM. If invited,
you shall be able to attend the entire event.

Hyderabad

content.1126:
Subject: Interactive Session with Dr N R Narayana Murthy
Text:  Hi,
It is an honour for us that the great stalwart, the founder of Infosys, *Dr
N R Narayana Murthy* is going to visit us on Sunday, 3rd February. We will
be having an interactive session with him in Room No. 23., at around 2 PM.

I really feel it is a great opportunity for all of us, to learn from his
experiences and gather as much knowledge as possible. This is one event
which I feel none of us should miss.

We will be having a registration for this session.The first 100 students
will be given the opportunity to sit in Room No. 23, on first come first
serve basis. The rest of the students will be given the chance to sit in
the very same room, if there is space or can view the discussion in Room
No. 115 and Room No. 203, via video conference.

I am floating the Google Form here. We are also giving you the opportunity
to ask questions to him, which has to be filled in the form itself. Some
good questions would be shortlisted.So, give a good thought and ask :)

Also, there is a section of Projects Done, in the form. You can fill the
Projects which you have done till date. This may not include just the
projects which you have done in IIT. Also, it's not necessary that you add
only technical projects. Even drawing, painting etc, can be added. Some
distinguishable and unique Projects/skills would be selected and presented
in front of our esteemed guest.(Don't worry, I won't be selecting.Our Deans
and Director will take that call)

Sorry for the long mail but I feel all details should be included. All the
General Secretaries are co-ordinating the event. Feel free to contact them
for any query.
Students who will register MUST compulsorily attend the session.
Do register ASAP!! The form will close on *Wednesday, 12 PM* sharp!

https://goo.gl/forms/uBTsYGhPUSVW3osu1
-- 
Samveed Desai
General Secretary, Technical Affairs

content.1138:
Subject: Send mail if you are into ARP
Text: Dear Students,

This is an alert in case if you are an ARP student. Details of ARP are
given at the end of the mail.

In case, if you *have 5 active backlogs (FR's+DX's) for first and second
year students, and 7 active backlogs(FR's+DX's) for subsequent year
students, then kindly mail to academicstaff@iitdh.ac.in
<academicstaff@iitdh.ac.in>.*


*Also, please note that you need to bring your one of the parent on the day
of registration without which your registration would not be carried out. *

Yours sincerely,
Raju Tuppad


Academic Rehabilitation Program
Academic Rehabilitation Program (ARP) shall deal with students who are
unable to cope up with the academic pressure and have been performing
poorly. It acts as a buffer for such students and provides them with an
opportunity to stay in IIT for completion of their degree.
Entry to ARP: The ARPC convenes a meeting to assess the performances of
academically weak students and the need for putting a particular student
under ARP is analyzed. Thereafter, the transition from regular student to
ARP has to begin with a meeting of the students and their parents/guardians
with the committee overseeing the performance of such students. This
meeting must emphasize the seriousness of the situation to the students and
their guardians. *5 active backlogs (FR's+DX's+XX's) for first and second
year students, and 7 active backlogs(FR's+DX's+XX's) for subsequent year
students are the usual numbers that will put a student in ARP.*
The fee requirements are also the same as that for a normal student.
However, an ARP Student must contact the respective professors of his/her
courses personally for grades and then the professors will forward the
grades to the Academic Section. No paper record otherwise exists for the
grades.

Mentoring and Monitoring in the initial few years the responsibility of
mentoring and monitoring the ARP students have been undertaken by the ARPC.
During the course of his stay in ARP, the student works in close
coordination with a faculty member. An ARP student can register for roughly
24 credits for the semester. The credits could be more or less depending
upon the ARP Faculty Coordinator. In order to get the basics clear, an ARP
student may take up the courses which he/she has already cleared in his
previous semesters. However, no extra credits/improvisation are provided
for such courses.

Exit from ARP: The ARPC convenes a meeting and treats individual cases in
terms of the report from the faculty coordinator, report of the department
mentor, and the performance of the student in the semester are evaluated
and a decision is taken based on these criteria. If the students perform
well in his ARP time, he is transferred back to the normal curriculum load.
In very few cases, if the student fails to perform in ARP, he/she is
recommended to take termination from the institute

-- 
Academic Office
IIT Dharwad
content.1139:
Subject: Regarding Exams, Preparation and Available Support
Text: Dear Students,

We are almost at the end of the semester, and you must all be running
around now, or may be sitting at a go for hours, trying to find the perfect
notes, for the end-sems  that are around the corner.

I can imagine that it might be a stressful time for you, and some of you
might find it difficult to cope with all the pressure.

Just remember that you're not alone in this and that we're always here to
help and support you.

A wise man named Fred Rogers once said, ‚Äú*In times of stress, the best
thing we can do for each other is to listen with our ears and our hearts
and to be assured that our questions are just as important as our answers*
.‚Äù

I would like to remind you that there are *experts *out there who can do a
tremendous job at listening to your problems for free through *YourDOST.*
There are three ways you can go about it:

1. Online chat counseling 24x7 from the Experts at *http://bit.ly/YDatIITDhChat
<http://bit.ly/YDatIITDhChat>*
2. Book an appointment for Telephonic or Video (Skype) sessions with
Experts at http://bit.ly/YDatIITDhAppointment
3. Book an appointment for in-person counseling with an Expert at
http://bit.ly/F2FIITDh <http://bitly.com/F2FIITDh>

Even if there are challenges apart from exams and you just need a lending
ear, I would request you to take advantage of this opportunity and make the
best use of it.

All the best for your exams!

Bests,
Ridhima
-- 

Ridhima Tewari
Assistant Professor (English)
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad
Dharwad- 580011

content.1142:
Subject: Invitation for celebrating Ganesh Utsav
Text: Hello everyone!

We would like to invite you to Ganesh Chaturthi and Ganesh Utsav
celebrations starting from tomorrow morning. The Ganesh Sthapana and
morning aarti will take place at 8:30am in the morning. It will be a week

content.1148:
Subject: Fwd: LIMIT : An International Academic Event
Text: ---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: LIMIT CONTEST <limit.isibangalore@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, Feb 21, 2019 at 3:17 AM
Subject: LIMIT : An International Academic Event
To: <sunder@iitdh.ac.in>


Respected Sir/Madam,

We, the students community of Indian Statistical Institute, Bangalore would
like to inform you that we are organizing LIMIT, an international online
mathematics competition, for high schoolers and undergraduates.

LIMIT will provide a platform to the entire students community to compete
against each other and to assess themselves respective to their
contemporaries throughout the world. We would like to request you to
encourage your students to take part in this competition to get an exposure
to the world of Mathematics. We want to promote a culture of Mathematics in
our country, and we feel LIMIT is a great platform for it.

Few necessary details about LIMIT are provided below:

   - The competition will be held in April,2019. All the necessary dates
   are in our official website. Last date of registration is 10 March,2019.
   - There is no venue restriction, candidates can appear from anywhere.
   - Candidates will receive participation certificates, certificates of
   merit based on performance.
   - We will invite around 50 students based on their performance to a
   mathematics camp to interact with world famous mathematicians from India.
   - Toppers will receive cash prizes and exciting goodies.


As our aim is to reach out to the entire students community who would wish
to participate in LIMIT, we would be grateful to you if you kindly forward
this message to the students community of your institute.

We are attaching two posters of LIMIT along with this e-mail. Kindly
circulate them as well.

For any query or further details, feel free to contact us at-
Udvas Das- 9739562795
Nidhi Talwar- 9820207100
Aritra Mandal- 8777042400
or via email at limit.isibangalore@gmail.com

Thanking you,
Yours sincerely,

Aritra Mandal
LIMIT Coordinator

content.1156:
Subject: APS: Amitkumar Gawas, 29th July, 2.30pm, Room No. 115
Text: Dear all,

Mr. Amitkumar Gawas will give his annual progress seminar (APS)
on Monday, 29th July 2019 at 2.30 pm. The details are as follows:

Title: Computational fluid dynamics using multiple relaxation time thermal
lattice
Boltzmann method
Date: Monday, 29th July at 2.30 pm.
Venue: Classroom 115

Abstract:
In this presentation, a general algorithm of the lattice Boltzmann method
is discussed. In order
to understand the use of the multiple-relaxation time lattice Boltzmann
method, few benchmark problems of thermal
and fluid flow are solved including the Rayleigh Bernard convection in
enclosures of di erent geometries.
Next, the axisymmetric MRT-LB method is studied to solve the problems which
use the axisymmetric domain
as athermal model. The LB-MRT axisymmetric model is further extended to
include temperature field.
The use of higher grid size requires high computational power and it is
time-consuming as compared to the lower
grid size computation. Hence parallelization of the axisymmetric LB-MRT
serial code is done with
MPI and parameterized.

The report is attached herewith for your reference.
All are welcome to attend.

Thank you,
Sincerely,
Dhiraj.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr. Dhiraj V. Patil
Assistant Professor (Homepage
<https://sites.google.com/site/dvpmultiplefluidsatiitmandi/>)
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Indian Institute of Technology Dharwad.
Dharwad - 580011, Karnataka, India.
O: 8362212829

*Greetings from Texas Instruments!*

*The India Innovation Challenge Design Contest (IICDC),* launched by *Texas
Instruments India* in association with the *Department Of Science And
Technology* and *Indian Institute of Management Bangalore* has provided
young tech entrepreneurs with an ecosystem and support to nurture their
entrepreneurial spirit and an opportunity to leverage their talent and
convert their innovation to a startup. *IICDC 2017* has witnessed some of
the brightest engineering minds of the country giving shape to their
innovative ideas by engineering path-breaking solutions.

The contest began with more than *15,380 students* from *965* engineering
colleges entering the qualifying round across all the states in India.
Enthused with creative brilliance in their uninhibited minds, undeterred by
the hurdles, mentored by their committed teachers, they are striving hard
and competing in India Innovation Challenge 2017 to build a better tomorrow
with their product start-ups.



*To inspire an entrepreneurial spirit that drives students from idea to
invention to industry, helping them become successful entrepreneurs DST has
supported the contest with funding of INR 3.5 Crores. with an aim to
catalyze the Indian manufacturing ecosystem and strengthen the ‚ÄòMake in
India‚Äô initiative. This initiative is also supported by Department of
Industrial Policy & Promotion, Govt. of India and myGOV. IIMB will provide
business mentorship during incubation of the startups. To guide these
future entrepreneurs through the transition of idea to invention to
industry, TI will provide technical mentorship and resources. Coming
together of these stalwarts has created the perfect platform to encourage a
thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem. Our final objective from contest is to
identify Ten successful startups from the contest which will be incubated
at the NSRCEL of IIM Bangalore.*


Texas Instruments in collaboration with Department of Science and
Technology (DST) proudly announce their next edition of  *India Innovation
Challenge Design Contest (IICDC) 2018* anchored by NSRCEL, Indian Institute
of Management, Bangalore (IIMB) and supported by MyGov. The contest is open
for all Indian engineering students pursuing undergraduate, postgraduate &
Doctoral degrees with Indian engineering colleges.

TI values your contribution to education and your commitment toward
building a stronger entrepreneurial ecosystem. Your support to the contest
will motivate the next generation of student entrepreneurs as they create
groundbreaking solutions to lead India into an innovation revolution that
will change the world. We request you to motivate and inspire all student
innovators, thinkers and makers of the country to join the revolution, who
have a dream to create something new, aspire to make a difference,
contribute to India's success towards becoming an Innovation Hub.

*Awards and Recognition: *

   - INR 20 Lacs seed funds to top 10 startups
   - INR 5 Lacs product development funds to select semifinalists teams
   - INR 30K stipends to select Semifinalists teams
   - Free TI Tools worth up to INR 70 Lacs to participants
   - 15000+ certificates spread across the whole contest
   - 600+ types of cash prizes spread throughout the contest totaling up to
   INR 50 Lacs
   - *Recognition for the Faculty (Mentors) of the Semifinalists and
   Finalists teams*

<https://innovate.mygov.in/iicdc2018/>*
